description:
So I have been to both Java Beach Cafes and they are sufficiently the same thing. Sandwiches, coffee, so on and so forth. 

So yeah, I really only go here to study and get work done. The sandwiches and coffee are expensive and aren't spectacular by any means. It's nice simply because it's spacious and everyone is friendly and there's a plethora of outlets. I imagine it must be a nice place to read and hang out during the day too since it's practically next to the beach.

All in all, a reliable cafe but pricier one.
author: Derek T.

description:
Came to this little gem after work with my significant other because he knew I love hot chocolate. I didn't think about ordering a hot sub.

 But of course, I did. Even though it was 45 minutes to closing, the sandwich was made to my kind of perfection. I couldn't even talk to my partner for I was enjoying the sandwich more than expected. Dakota was such a sweetheart. Normally when I go to places that serve beverages and/or food late night, employees give off the impression like they want to go home. Dakota's presence was much more opposite. She greeted us upon arrival and made small conversation. I felt a sense of appreciation.

The only downside is parking is a pain in the you know what.
author: Trix P.

description:
Coffee, bagels, hot sandwiches, brownies/cookies over a chill place to work. 

It feels a little weird that I am writing this review as I sit here doing work over a mocha, but oh well! Honestly I love this coffee shop in the city right across the street from the beach. It's similar to Chit Chat Cafe in Pacifica but I tend to be closer to SF on Fridays for a nice change of scenery. This is especially one of my go-to shops because they also serve food. There is free parking along the side of the street on La Playa, and is very low-hassle to get here via Great Highway. I also came here at night after Outsidelands and it was great to warm up to a nice cup of hot chocolate at like 10pm. 

As a self-proclaimed whipped cream aficionado, this place has the cream (ohoho) of the crop on top of their mochas and hot chocolates. I also love that you can get their bagels with pesto or sun-dried tomato cream cheese. It's literally a game changer. 

The wifi is a bit spotty here depending on what you're working on (I have xfinity wifi so it doesn't really matter). However, I highly recommend this place for a chill study spot!
author: Clarissa C.

description:
Nice and cozy, descent food, great environment and very good prices! 
Went here with a colleague of mine for a meeting, and we ended up staying the entire day for a "home" office day. 
I had a coffee to start with, later an Italian salad with salmon and some diet cokes. I was very tempted to try out their bakeries as it looked really good!
author: Nadia S.

description:
I found this spot on yelp and when I came to ocean beach, this place I found to be located perfectly.
It is one block from the sand and the first/last stop of the public transportation is at their door!

The place was vibrant when I walked in, with all ages and purposes. Working, meeting,... or touristing just like myself.

The menu was displayed on large wall boards. I ordered an iced latte with almond milk and the whirling dervish veggie sub. I could choose between chips or coleslaw as a side. 

The sandwich was really delicious and I am so happy I picked the coleslaw because it was probably the best I ever had! Home made dressing with sirracha yet not really spicy but rather sweet, and cranberries on top of it just make this delicious!
The sandwich was good but a little dry. I did like it was warm and it had really good flavors.
My latte was delicious too. Better than any chain coffee shop will ever serve you.

The staff was extremely friendly and worked very fast. They were very accommodating. 

There is tons of seating both inside as outside. They have their own style. Inside tables are made of surf boards. Or you can sit by the bar. Everything is wood. Outside even on the side every space is used to provide seating. Just so much character in this establishment!

The only minor issue was the single restroom, it was gross but I guess unisex and only one available needs constant maintenance to be able to keep it clean.

Great experience and very cheap especially for SF and location! I paid $13.20 for my sandwich and latte!
Highly recommend! And I am happy I found this spot in my research on yelp when planning this trip!
author: Apple S.

description:
Food: not many vegan options on the menu aside from modified salads and bagels, BUT, holy hell the vegan chocolate chip cookies near the register are delicious. They don't advertise that these are vegan, so ask to be sure you grab the right ones!! All coffee drinks can be made vegan. 

Service: Friendly and efficient. Order and pick up at the counter.

Ambiance: beachy with beach going patrons. Welcome to NorCal!
author: Shannon H.

description: Convenient to the ocean Beach and on the end of the Muni N-Judah run. Great Turkey Club.
author: John M.

description:
The ambiance really is what makes this cafe so great. Literally right next to the beach! Surfer vibes! Sunset vibes! Ocean beach at your fingertips! CAFFEINE. What more do you need? 

It's a quaint little spot right by the beach, the neighbourhood is not too busy usually. Parking is alright. There's a decent amount of seating indoors and free wifi! Woo! It's a nice place to do some work when you're able to snag a table. 

I've gotten the sandwiches and fruit bowls, oatmeal, and various other items from here before but the food isn't much of a standout for me. It's meh. It's on the pricy side for the quality of food that you get, but really I just love this place because of how cute and cozy it is. It's a neighbourhood gem in my opinion so although the food is ok, it's the proximity to the beach and the vibe of the cafe that keeps me coming back.
author: Amy T.

description:
Coffee on the beach? Not quite, but Java Beach Cafe is close.

This neighborhood cafe is BUSY - even in the wee hours. Regulars come here, bikers on the way down the 1, and surfer dudes who make their way to the beach.

Java Beach offers a variety of origin coffee, hot and cold sandwiches, and, as Yelper Peter L pointed out, even beer. Indoor and outdoor seating is available.

When I go there it's usually pretty early so I skip the beer, grab my coffee, and make it over to the beach for a quick walk. Location, location, location.
author: Sebastian F.

description: Great study cafe! Has a very vibrant and positive vibe! Located in a corner and right across the beach, this place is perfect for a group meeting or even to finish up an assignment. They have a good collection of healthy food, soups and salads. The soups change every day and they have good bread that goes along with it!
author: Premila M.

description: Very good bagels and coffee for a breakfast with nice and quick service. Highly recommended.
author: Markku K.

description: Not many words are needed besides EXCELLENT. You cannot go wrong with anything here. The coffee is exceptional. They have OATLY oat milk and options for vegetarians/vegans. Thank you
author: Jay L.

description:
For what you pay: great!  
Ambiance: surfer coffee/bar vibes.  
Service: nice
Taste: good!

I have started to frequent here prior to going out to surf.  Seems that is a common habit of locals. Many of the people pop in here wearing wetsuits, looking for that early morning splash in the face that isn't too cold just yet.  This cozy coffee bar offers a warm wake up and a hospitable lounge for weekend work: steady stream of reggae, beach vibes and strong coffee grinds.

The vibes here really beat out any metropolitan Starbucks or Peets around town.  Mostly every surface is wooden and seemingly handcrafted. 4-5 seat bar. Multiple tables spaced around a bench. 

The food is marvelous. Many vegan options but not so much a restaurant menu. Bagels are solid. Service is great. Come here for beer in the afternoon. 

2 bathrooms. Free WiFi. Park on skreeets.
author: Rob C.

description:
When I think of Ocean Beach, I think of Java Beach Cafe. And their gigantic sandwiches. And how I want to go back there soon. 

There aren't a ton of great food options around and after hiking the city all day, all we wanted was carbs. Java Beach delivers in the form of said sandwiches that you can easily split into two meals. We ordered both the Club sandwich and the BBQ chicken one. They came out quickly, the only challenge was eating without making too much of a mess. 

Besides the beach side location, I love the atmosphere here. Not touristy, not mega hip, just chill. And on that sunday night, there was live music, too. A perfect end to a perfect day and Java Beach Cafe continues to be my go to in the area.
author: Katja S.

description:
Came here twice today, once for a coffee then again for an early lunch.

Coffee was so out of this world, creamy, sweet and delicious. I wouldn't normally take the time to write about every coffee I drink but this was special! I had a decaf latte. Loved every last drop. 

Lunch was a sunrise smoked salmon bagel and it didn't disappoint. It was just the way I like it with delicious cream cheese, great salmon, onion, tomato and capers. It could have used a little cucumber or pickle  but that's a minor point.

The ambiance is friendly and welcoming and the staff obliges to go the extra mile which is hugely appreciated.

Love the beach side spot, this will be my go to ocean Beach Cafe from now on!!
author: Zoe L.

description:
I ordered a Tsunami sub and waited over 20 mins for it. Got home and the sandwich had no meat in it. Went back because I live in the neighborhood. When I told the person at the counter, he did not apologize. I've worked in the industry before and a screw-up that big deserves an apology and some attempt to make up for it, especially if the customer came all the way back. Remake also took over 20 min. I will take this review down if the owner messages me. I've been coming here for over 10 years. Retrain!!!

Update: manager responded to my post in under an hour with a profuse apology and offered a refund. And that's how you manage a restaurant. Turn a 1 star into a 5 star.
author: Richard K.

description: I usually come here after a long run on a Saturday or Sunday and there is always a line but it moves at a decent rate. From hopping in line to getting my food about 25 minutes but today was a sunny Sunday afternoon around 2 pm. I ordered the Hot Tsunami and the soup of the day that came out not warm. It was a hot day like I said and busy so I didn't feel like exchanging it. Still like this place and would rec it to anyone!
author: Julianne O.

description:
Street corner beach coffee joint that roasts their own. Are
You kidding me?! Grub and a Java is the staple of a neighborhood. This place is FULL of locals this Saturday morning. That speaks to the favor the locals have for Java Beach Cafe. The joint has been here for 20+ years  and it shows in its skill product. It's a must times 10.
author: Mark A.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend when I was working from home.

Parking was really difficult on a Friday because all of the nearby street signs were Friday ones. So beware of that! I found a spot along the beach highway. 

Ambiance: This is a laid back cafe right by the beach and it was pretty crowded with people on their laptops. A lot of small tables that are perfect to study or WFH. There were outlets right under our table that were very hard to reach, we had to get almost on the floor to plug it in.

Service: The service here was pretty quick. You order in line and then they call it out. Took about 10-15 minutes overall with a small line ahead of me.

Food/drink: I got a plain bagel with tomato basil cream cheese and a caramel latte. The caramel latte was horrible... tasted just like sweet milk.. no coffee what so ever. I ended up asking them to change my drink to a iced soy chai and they did that no problem. I appreciated how they changed my order. The soy chai was way better! The bagel with tomato cream cheese was good, I like the spread at Noah's bagels better but it was decent here! 

I would come back to try their pastries and work. Wasn't that impressed though :/
author: Hayley D.

description: I love java beach, especially this location. Right on the edge of the beach to enjoy a nice latte and croissant in the sun. Laid back vibe and it feels like a real sunset district staple. If you enjoy coffee and have a minute to take a break and relax. Visit!
author: Manny R.

description:
After a nice morning spent at Lands End, my friend and I were looking for a place for a quick bite and coffee. I found this place about 5 min away and such happy I found this gem!! Cute little cafe, dog friendly, with lots of pastries, bagels, coffee and yummy food! We got a quiche, chicken salad, and dirty water (Americano)

This little cafe made me fall even more in love with San Francisco
author: Olivia L.

description: Had to create a Yelp account to rave about this place! Wonderful subs, friendly staff, and cozy environment. Will definitely be back.
author: Julian K.

description: Where should I start?! I got one of their hot subs and it was delicious. I usually go here on Sundays after my kids soccer games. They love to come in an get a hot chocolate with a bagel. The young lady who took my order is always nice and very respectful. The energy all around is uplifting and relaxing. I will be adding this to my weekend routine. I would definitely recommend a BBQ chicken sub or Kelly Cove.
author: Zee B.

description:
Love this coffee shop. Cute little place tucked away near lands-end. They had live music last time we were there. The baristas are awesome. Cheery, fast and serve great coffee. They take the effort to tell you what's in your coffee- which is great for those who are trying new stuff like "muddy water":P Thats their best coffee guys!

The only downside could be the crowd.
author: Viji S.

description:
The pesto creme cheese bagel was so good!  

The girl making th bagel didn't really know what she was doing I watched her make all the bagels for people for sit down but everyone ordered to go.  She also didn't toast mine as asked and I watched her scrape off something from the bagel so I'm not sure what she was doing.   I will go back as the food was excellent as well as the Carmel latte!
author: Linette H.

description:
After looking at previous reviews, I thought there would be a good selection of vegan options. In reality, the only meal I saw on the menu that was vegan was the Hummus Bagel. I tried order the Sundried Tomato Bagel without the cream cheese but that sundried tomatoes come with the cream cheese. Supposedly there's vegan cookies which is nice, but pales in comparison with the tons of tasty looking meat/cheese sandwiches.

Anyway... the bagel. It was good but nothing special (like something you could make at home without too much effort if you wanted). It also was priced decently at $6.50 (especially since this is one of two cafes around this area). It didn't take too long to come after ordering which was also a bonus. We also ordered a cold brew and ice tea which were both pretty good!

The queue / wait is also super long on weekends around lunch time.

I would give 2 stars given my experience, but I remember loving the Java Beach Cafe before I went vegan. Give me one vegan sandwich and I'll be content!
author: Michael C.

description:
I just moved into the area and have been coming here to work and get lunch/brunch. It's a great place to work. Lots of outlets and a really chill atmosphere. Internet isn't bad either (although, I find the xfinity wifi to work a bit better than the java beach wifi). 

Food: I always get the veggie hummus bagel with avocado. It's pretty solid, and for $7.75 ($6.50 + $1.25 for avo) the price isn't bad. 

Drink: I'm not much of a coffee drinker, so I usually get the hot chocolate. Honestly, this could use some work. It lacks chocolate and the milk usually tastes like it's been over boiled. Extra chocolate would at least cover the milk situation.

Overall, I will probably be here quite often. It even has outdoor seating! I have yet to try the wifi out there, but on nice days, I'm sure it's great.
author: Kavita P.

description:
This is something that I almost never say, but I wish that this place didn't have free wifi.

I know, I know, you're a student and it's hard to find a decently sized cafe in the barren Outer Sunset where you can hunker down and get some work done. I can sympathize because my pretending-to-work-in-a-coffee-shop days weren't too long ago. 

The sandwiches at Java Beach aren't half bad, but you probably won't be able to find a seat if you come here for lunch because more than 75% of the occupants are on their laptops and unlikely to budge for hours. The atmosphere is lightyears away from the cozy beachside cafe it had the potential to be. Some denizens of the communal table will even have the nerve to give you a dirty look when you pointedly refer to the seat next to them where their backpack is resting and ask, "Is this seat free?" because how dare you have the audacity to want to eat the $12 sandwich you paid for. (It was too windy to sit outside -- surprise, surprise.)

The Java Club and Kelly's Cove sandwiches were sort of run-of-the-mill, albeit filling and the chips were a nice touch. But the service was slow (they didn't apologize about forgetting one of the sandwiches in my order either) and the coffee was burnt. I'd suggest a two-hour limit on the wifi but then I'd feel bad for everyone living out in the Outer Sunset because there really aren't many alternatives out there, especially by the beach. Place an order for take-out and kill time while waiting for your sandwich by frolicking on the beach because yes, it'll take that long for it to be ready.
author: Amy C.

description:
Your neighborhood café!

This is not your "hipster cafe"or Philz, but it sure makes a great cappuccino! I've came here a few times, and the froth is amazing -- I think it's better than some I tried in Italy to be honest (shhh!). 

Cool vibing café next to Ocean Beach, that's pretty busy every time I come (weekends usually). One day I came they had live music! Worth stopping by if you're not feeling the over-so-jazzy coffee drink concoctions ;). 

I can smell the coffee just thinking about it! :D
author: Giovanna R.

description:
A nice place to go to for a quick bite to eat near Ocean beach!  I've been here two times and tried the hot mozzarella, tomato, and pesto sandwich and another time the java club (BLT + turkey).  The sandwiches are a very good portion and if you order it whole, you can definitely share it with someone!

This place does get VERY busy so prepare yourself and do not be surprised for the long lines!
author: Dominique L.

description:
I came here on a Saturday afternoon and was able to get a table outside with my pup. Tied him to the table and ordered a grilled cheese with bacon instead of ham and a latte and was charged almost $17. Which I think is ridiculous. 

Almost a half hour later a sandwich comes out and I thought I heard my name and took me about 5 minutes to finally be able to pull staff aside to confirm it was mine. Turns out I was charged that price because the gentleman who took my order charged me to add bacon ON TOP of a grilled ham and cheese instead of replacing it. 

They said they'd fix my order and that took another 10 - 15 minutes and even then it was basically an open face sandwich with melted cheese and bacon kinda thrown on top. Looked nothing like the grilled cheese I saw come out while I was waiting. 

The cashier was friendly but everyone behind the counter just seemed to be in a bad mood.
author: Ann M.

description:
I have always been a fan of Java Beach. I live in the Marina and enjoy taking the drive, esp. at night, to relax with a drink, dessert and book. Sometimes, they even have a guitar player on occasion. i love the vibe and the service is great. looking forward to seeing y next Java Beach experience. 

Allan
author: Allan B.

description:
If I'm here, it's for the cozy atmosphere devoid of any frou frou notions. It's a little ocean side beach house, small, with simple food and drink. It's rather out of the way for most, unless you live by the ocean side. And to think that this little cafe keeps buzzing throughout the days and nights, throughout the year, is an interesting notion. Do people come from afar or are the patrons all locals? Regardless, I'd make the trek here perhaps a few times a year. It's a great work spot, conducive to productivity but also relaxation.

Sandwiches and bagels seem to be the staples. The subs are solid, meaning not skimpy on ingredients, meaning good quality, meaning the usual concoctions like a club sandwich, ham and cheese, or veggie. There's coffee, tea, and non-caffeinated beverages.

There was an elderly gentleman singing live the evening I was there. He did a few runs of Journey, which was lovely.
author: Cici T.

description:
Came here on a weekday for lunch and so glad I did! The matcha latte and caramel cold brew were delicious pick-me-ups for my friend and I :) 
I also order the bonfire delight and it was definitely a 5 star sandwich 
 
Parking: We found parking relatively quickly on the street

Environment: I saw a lot of people sitting there with their laptops and sipping their drinks so it may be a study area for some. Personally, I feel it's a quick food stop before or after you check out the beach which is right in front of the restaurant. Food seems to take awhile to prepare but drinks are fairly quick. 

Price: It's a little pricier but the food/drinks are pretty good so to me, it seems worth it to treat yourself once in awhile :)
author: Jennifer K.

description: Love the coffee and hot chocolate!  The variety of sandwiches are awesome. We ordered the pesto mozzarella melt. Family friendly !
author: Debbie M.

description:
Great place to unwind after work. Has a nice outside area to chill and the weather is always nice right here. A warm spot .
Coffee is always delicious and smooth.
Staff is nice and fast with your order.
author: Kenny M.

description:
I fell in love with this little cafe. It reminded me a lot of the cafes in Europe (including the lack of A/C). There was a man playing folksy music and the barista was nice. I normally don't drink coffee, but I was tired so I went with their Colombian blend. I really appreciate that they had a jug out for soy milk! A lot of places only offer skim milk and half & half, but not here! They also had hazelnut syrup that I took advantage of. 

Absolutely love the charming atmosphere of this place. I recommend stopping by before heading to the beach.
author: Karen R.

description: Fresh coffee and delicious food!!! Great atmosphere! Staff is friendly! This is my go to place and right by the beach.
author: Jaxxxie P.

description:
UPDATE:
This update is for other customers (original review below was for the owner)
The owner called me shortly after the review below posted and not only apologized and offered a gift card, but also said she would take action so that this establishment could continue to be enjoyed for what it is; a cozy cafe by the beach for a nice cup of Joe, some amazing chocolate chip cookies, and what turned out in the end to be remarkable customer service from the ownership level.

ORIGINAL REVIEW:
The cafe itself is nice enough so I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1. This review is essentially for the owner rather than other customers. Mr/Mrs owner, your employees are showing up wasted to work and making a mess of your establishment. 


Today the girl running the cash register was high off her mind and was messing up everyone's orders. Here is how my interaction went.

1. I placed my drink order and she ran my card and then dropped what was the tip change from the previous customer towards me instead of the tip jar.
2. It fell all over the counter because I wasn't expecting it and I put it into the tip jar for her. She apologized and placed a to go coffee cup on the counter saying that's what she meant to give me (which made no sense either, but at this point I was still giving her the benefit of the doubt so ignored that comment)
3. After waiting 12 minutes for my drink, I went back to the counter to ask her what was up, but she was already being asked by another customer about an order of theirs that was missing as well.
4. She finally got that other customer their drink and then fumbled through the iPad to look for my order and concluded she forgot to put it in for me. 
5. I said ok never mind and left only to check my bank activity once outside to see that she did charge me. 
6. I went back again  (past a new customer line now out the door, and a shorter queue of confused customers that didn't have their orders for a while) to tell her she had charged me and she then made up a different story, that she had heard "coffee" instead of "iced mocha."
7. She made my drink while holding up the line, which is when I heard other customers saying to each other "she's so high" and "that girl is so wasted" which is when I realized what was going on. 
8. I called the cafe later to let the owner know what was going on and I'm pretty sure it was the same girl who answered and told me she was the manager. I asked for the number of the owner who I tried calling but found a full voicemail box and so leaving this message here instead. 

Just in case you didn't know what was up mr/ms cafe owner.
author: Afaan N.

description:
After a long day of touring San Francisco, we ended up nearby and needed a pick me up.

On a Sunday afternoon, the café was packed and busy.

We just ordered some drinks for the road. I had an Iced Almond Milk Latte, and it was good. The espresso was good but unfortunately wasn't strong enough for me. Should have added an extra shot. 

Service is good.

Prices were reasonable.

Great neighborhood spot!
author: Natasha S.

description: Compared to the JBC on Sloat this one is more crowded and I dare say...worse. Both places have very slow WiFi BTW. But this place is just a bit darker, wetter, and I once possibly got mild food poisoning from their soup. Still, it's not a bad place to grab some drinks and sit while you're nearby.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: Nice place to grab a sandwich after a hike along the coast before heading to ocean beach for a relaxing day. They have a good variety of sandwiches choices, sweets, coffee and teas to drink as well. Their serving portion are more than enough, even to have left overs. Inside/Outside seating is available. Deff recommend to check out.
author: Kristin L.

description: Nice dog friendly spot close to the beach.  Really friendly service and yummy food and coffee. We will be back!
author: Jennifer R.

description:
This is a hard one cuz I really want to give a good review.

I will start with the first impression. The place is dirty, the staff rarely empties the garbage cans (I ebussed my table but the trash can was so full the trash ended up on the ground), the layout is awkward, the outside seating area is pretty run down and finally nearly every indoor seat is monopolized by people staring into their frickin laptops sipping their herbal matcha lattes for three hours. I know this review is pretty bad, especially by my standards, but strangely I keep going back. What they have going for them is a kick ass location and some pretty good cafe food, a few items slightly overpriced but good nevertheless. My kid loves the pesto, tomato melt so much he constantly begs for me to head out to the beach for his favorite sandwich this side of Ike's. The hot sandwiches are toasted just right and they pile on some tasty chips but I must say the beers are measly (what's up with the little cups?). Finally I challenge you to leave the counter without one of their decadent chocolate chip cookies, good luck! So, for now, get a sandwich and a cookie and head over to the beach and hopefully sooner or later they can do a remodel and also find an exterminator to relieve them of their annoying table hogs.
Also the Sloat location has pretty much the same food but I also found it dirty. I will say that one of the women who worked there thanked me for bussing my table and was very polite.  Another big plus is they have far fewer people on laptops at that location so there is a more social vibe.
author: Ralph S.

description:
Came here with best friend after walking Ocean Beach - least to say we were hungry!

This placed offered refuge from the cold Pacific Ocean breeze; proceeded to take shelter, lol. The location had a beach vibe and the people working here were hella chill. We wanted to order individual sandwiches (good thing we did not!) but decided that one would suffice. We got the turkey BLT, which was delicious and came with a side of chips (just the correct portions). We split this big-ass sandwich and paired it with great cups of coffee. 
Having taken refuge and bellies full, we then proceeded on our adventures in San Francisco. ^_^
author: Luis A.

description:
I LOVE the vibe here. So mellow. It's right across from Ocean Beach & the dunes. Barefoot surfers grab coffee while locals study on the patio.

I had the San Patricio (chicken, jack, avocado, honey mustard) and Kelly's Cove (turkey, swiss, pesto) sandwiches. Both were about $9. They were huge & very tasty! Service was friendly.
author: Shannon C.

description:
I do adore coming here. The staff are friendly, there's free wifi with lots of seating (indoors and out) with good food. Well, most of the food is good. I'd stick to the sandwiches and pastries, but the granola bowl was just a handful of granola, drowning in milk with some semi-ripe fruit. I love the vibe and the location. It's a good place for studying/working or for grabbing a coffee before taking a stroll on the beach.

The bathroom situation irked me. There were unnecessarily gendered bathrooms with a baby-changing station (which is a plus) situated in the ladies' bathroom (a negative). In SF, I think we can expect this to change. My suggestion: call them both bathrooms and mark the one with the baby-changing table.
author: L F.

description: Great cafe for breakfast/lunch. All the food was amazing! However if you order the coleslaw, know that it's not a traditional slaw and wasn't my favorite. It was very busy and service was a little slow, but overall a great experience.
author: Madison W.

description:
I ordered a hot sandwich with a coffee. Good was good and the coffee was tasty. Coffee was done in a reasonable amount of time but the food was terribly slow. I'm not sure what was going on...it is just a sandwich. My friend and I got ours at 20 and 25 minutes respectively. Then my other friend got his at 45 minutes and went up to them twice to see what was going on with the service. 

I think it was a rush of people that they didn't know how to handle. So if you see a long line I would eat elsewhere. If it is calm and there are two to three people I'd say go for it.
author: Matthew G.

description:
This is a great place to see California eccentric characters. Sometimes playing music. It is Right at end of Tramline  so great to Pop to the beach 

Food is expensive $12 for veggie sandwich. Service is at counter and they don't bother calling you when sitting outside even though you tell them you are there. 


Come for atmosphere and music. Food and service pretty poor
author: Phil W.

description: Love their coffee & my husband loves their sammiches! Reccommend! Very cute atmosphere, as well. It can get really full/line out the door, but the line moves fast! If you get Gabby at the cash register, you're guaranteed a big smile and a happy hello!
author: Dana W.

description: Very cute cafe along ocean beach. Great customer service and the staff is really friendly. Only had breakfast here. We always stop here in the morning to grab coffee and a bagel or some sort of pastry and sit on the beach.  Great location to the beach.
author: Newonda N.

description: Stumbled upon this gem thanks to a friend today. This place is amazing. Great friendly staff. Nice outdoor seating. And the sandwiches seem delicious. I grabbed a BLT.. the bacon was thick, juicy, yet had some crispiness at the edges. Very much recommend it!
author: Nicholas M.

description:
Looking for a sandwich lunch spot after going to CorgiCon on Ocean Beach -- of course we went to Yelp and found a few options. Knowing it was Saturday and lots going on in the area we knew we were in for a wait. We waited about 10 minutes in line and another 25 for food 

We ordered the Club Sandwich with turkey and it was supposed to be toasted -- it wasn't. We also added sprouts and pesto instead of mayo -- they forgot the pesto. Overall it could of been a really good sandwich but they forgot a few of the extra things that would of "made" the sandwich for us. 

Also ordered the Arnold Palmer and the ratio of tea to lemonade was more so lemonade - might have more so ordered lemonade. Where was the tea? Could have been better 

I'm not sure if it's because they were incredibly busy that their lack of attention to detail came in, or if that's how it always is, but we were hungry and made the best of it. 

I would try somewhere else in the area if I had an option to next time. If this was my only option next to a fast food alternative I would choose this place.
author: Clint P.

description: What the hell, Java Beach? I know you were busy on the hottest day ever, but you choked under pressure.  Ordered two subs. They were out of French rolls so I ordered one on Dutch crunch and one on ciabatta. They said they were really busy and it would be 35-40 minutes. Cool, I live down the street. Showed up 40 minutes after calling and they said it would be a few minutes. 40 minutes after that I get my sandwiches. But as bad as that is it is not the worst part. It was not on Dutch crunch. Not on ciabatta. They were both on two flimsy pieces on bread. $25 for this? I get that you were in over your head today, but here's an idea-- stop taking orders. And if you do take an order be sure that you have the materials. And if you don't have the materials how about communicate that. I feel completely ripped off and betrayed by this neighborhood institution. Get it together.
author: Phil B.

description:
Went here with my boyfriend because I had been here before and absolutely loved it, so I wanted him to experience too. Got there, ordered, and then we tried to sit down. There were no tables available. The ladies at the bar were sitting in the middle, so me and my boyfriend could only sit on either side of. All the tables were taken by people on laptops, even four person tables taken by one person. So we had to sit outside, and it was freezing cold outside! Obviously they can't control the weather, but maybe put in some bar space, or rearrange to fit more table or ask single people to not sit at four person table and sip coffee all day. 

I couldn't decide whether I should have gotten the veggie sandwich or the pesto tomato sandwich. I got the latter and it was a bad choice. You couldn't even taste the pesto!!! 

Also, we couldn't hear our names called because we were outside, so who knew how long our food was sitting on the counter. If you have outdoor seating, you should probably get a speaker or run out and check with the people outside. 

We ended up eating in our car because it was so cold, and it was just not a very good experience. Probably won't be going back, which is a bummer because I really liked it the first time.
author: Meghan H.

description:
The food is pretty good. Especially the hot sandwiches are unique choices you don't find at restaurants. But the quality of its preparation is lukewarm.

Their variety of espresso choices are sub-par. Seemed like they were lackluster prepared that I could've got better at a local Starbucks..

The service are young people with a bit of an attitude. Down faces who remind me that hourly people work just to get to that last hour with sometimes shitty service..
author: T K.

description: A regular place for us. Salads and pastries are very tasty and the vibe is what you expect from a place near the beach. Great place to sit and read or work (free wifi).
author: Tran N.

description: This place seems like it has a lot of hype (always a line, etc) but I've been twice since I moved to the neighborhood and never been impressed either time. They either get our order wrong or take a long time or hot drinks come out lukewarm... I don't think I'll be back again anytime soon...
author: Angela O.

description:
I find the food here quite delicious, even though theyre things I could easily make at home. But I enjoy getting out of the house. I enjoy the trip down there and being outside. That of which I like the outdoor seating. I do wish the tables were a little more personal then how they are now. It is always filled to the brim which is good for them, but not so good for us. 
We come into a huge line, already discouraging but because I like the food, I tolerate. Order a latte and the yummy tomato pesto mozzarella melt. It seems to take ages to get that latte. Once your name is called only have your satisfaction is met. You have to wait for your food. Which is another ages of waiting. I have consumed almost my whole latte, am losing my appetite from waiting and from the drink, and by the time you are starting to get curious and angry, your name is called and you have a tasty meal.
author: Kristine B.

description:
Worst service ever, guy working tonight was super rude.

Also, each table has either a homeless person waiting to do who knows what in the bathroom.  Or some up tight tech kid on their laptop who is there for hours. Culture is far from doing justice to my neighborhood... what happened to the outer sunset!!! Who are these people!!!

Also, super overpriced I got 3 little pieces of meat in my arugula salad and spent 21 bucks for a salad and a coffee.
author: Robert S.

description: Awesome sandwiches, yummy house made potato chips and super friendly staff that BUST THEIR BUTTS!!! They seriously work so hard and always have a smile on their faces.
author: Stephanie W.

description: The staff is friendly, they have a nice selection of drinks, and the atmosphere is always crowded and joyful. However, sometimes the crowd that gathers outside tends to harass young women, so I recommend visiting in groups.
author: Jenifer J.

description: Great place to go before a hike. They have some really awesome toast. It has a mixed of arugula, cheese and apples which I didn't expect to blend so well. The coffee taste great and the place has a cozy atmosphere.
author: Thomas B.

description:
I've been coming to the Java Beach Café for years. To me they are one of these San Francisco institutions that somehow nicely combine the hippie generation with the hipster generation: examples of both "species" can be found here!

It's situated right at the end of the N-Judah line, so most of the time I come here when I'm about to go for a long stroll at the beach; loading up on caffeine and buying a sandwich for the "road" ahead.
author: Uli B.

description:
I loved this place! 

Le fiance and I came here after a volleyball meet-up at Mission Beach. We were super hungry but didn't want to get too far into the city and face traffic the whole way home. Cute little beach cafe to the rescue! 

I'm gonna be honest, I had pretty low expectations. I figured it was mediocre sandwiches and burnt coffee. But I was pleasantly surprised! 

Le fiance got a mocha hot choc thing, while I opted for an iced coffee (still my thing, even when it's cold and rainy. Must be a SoCal thing). We split the tsunami sandwich, which has ham, mortadella, salami and melted cheese and the Caesar salad. All of it was super fresh and tasty! I loved the vibe of the place too, just very laid back and beachy but still  very comfortable. If we're ever in the area, we'll definitely be back!
author: Courtney C.

description: Cool place to chill after walking through Golden Gate Park and Ocean Beach. Conveniently located right next to the beach and the N Muni line.  Good coffee and good times.
author: Jessica H.

description:
We stayed at the hotel next door. Stopped in to grab something to drink and a snack. The girl at the register was really rude. Got a soda and a bottle of water and a cookie. Wish the beachside cafe had been open at this time so we hadn't been stuck here with staff who didn't want us there. Three stars feels generous.

Editing to update that the owner reached out and was really kind. If we were in town longer, would definitely have given it a second chance. Will keep it in mind for the next time we're in town.
author: Taylor J.

description:
If you want to meet the kindest people in San Francisco go here and order a coffee and you'll be talking to them!
The staff here blew me away with their friendly demeanor.
And, if you want hands down the best latte this is the place to go.  The caramel latte with macadamia milk I will miss so much!! It's a clean little cafe with Street parking and vegan and gluten free options.  Oh!! And, don't even get me started on the handmade caramels for sale on the counter. Mmmm.
author: Victoria R.

description:
Much enthusiasm for the Bonfire Delight sandwich, but the true piece de resistance was the bacon potato soup of the day, especially on a cold summer day in SF. #SFsummers

Three stars because it was crowded on a Saturday at 3pm with a fair amount of folks who were using the free wifi (i.e. not there to eat), and because it's a tiny space, it was difficult to find seating. It also took 30 min for our sandwich to arrive.

I'll probably come back as it's oh so close to Ocean Beach.
author: Steph L.

description: The very first time I went there I got an iced vanilla latte and it was SO GOOD! Honestly, it was perfect! The second time it was honestly really gross, like way too sweet. So I've been afraid to give it a third try. However yesterday I got one of their sandwiches which I believe is called Stern Cove? It was really tasty! They were kind of busy so I waited for about 20 minutes. I work at a sandwich place myself and know what it's like to be SWAMPED so I didn't mind! The employees are very friendly and welcoming and it's such a great location!
author: Deyanira O.

description: Wonderful sandwiches. Large portions, good choices. Outdoor seating available. Though you can't see the beach it's nice to sit outside and enjoy the weather.
author: Jen E.

description: I don't relish giving bad reviews, and this is definitely a cute cafe with an ocean view that probably has good things on the menu, but I was disappointed by my boyfriend's $3 cup of regular orange juice and my $5.75 "frozen mocha" that had only the faintest traces of ice, lots of icky foam, and I guess was vaguely sweeter than a latte but I didn't taste any chocolate or see it reflected in the broth color. Also, for that price, shouldn't it come with whipped cream??
author: Martina H.

description:
Excellent small java cafe near by San Francisco Zoo. Staff are friendly, coffee beverage and sandwiches good quality. Good price for the food and beverages served. During sunny day you can seat outside and have a nice view of ocean beach. 

Would come back here, recommend to my friends, family's and people who enjoy quality coffee and cafe.
author: Gruber T.

description: This use to be my go-to place for great sandwiches and nice outdoor seating...However, my most recent visit was very disappointing. The tables outside were not cleaned with dirty dishes etc. My tuna salad sandwich wasn't as ordered although they kindly fixed the bread issue... when I got it back the amount of mustard could have choked a horse. For starters who puts mustard on tuna salad....but, ok maybe someone.but the copious amounts dripping through the bread to the other side made me wonder if I was being  punished for asking for toasted bread...like I ordered!  In addition the edges of the cheddar cheese were dry, calling into question the storage of the food in the kitchen. I WON'T EAT HERE IN AWHILE.
author: Charlie M.

description:
I've been here quite a few times, this place is great when you want to study or hunt for jobs in peace since it's right by the beach.

This time around I got a hot chocolate, I also got one of their pilsners (yes they do serve beers on tap, pretty cool) and my fiance got their matcha latte and a pesto bagel with avocado.  Let's start by saying that we were pretty disappointed by the hot chocolate and matcha latte, the hot chocolate wasn't thick at all and not sweet, and the matcha latter had just a hint of matcha flavor.  Why the 4 stars you may ask, well the pesto cream cheese bagel was good, the beer was pleasant and I've had their coffee and it's pretty decent, however you definitely can't beat this location and laid back ambiance.

I definitely recommend this place if you're trying to get some school work done or if you're just at ocean beach and need to grab a bite or a brew.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description:
If you like boring food and jam bands (gag) go here i guess.

I dont understand why this cafe is so popular. I have been here a bunch of times and it has disappointed me every time.
author: Selin A.

description: Cozy place for morning coffee or tee with ocean breeze. Pleasant costumer service but my morning croissant was a bit burnt out)
author: Anastasia Z.

description: Nice and fresh coffee and croissant. Nice chilling here. i found here by accidently because i want to go Golden Gate Park. I recommend this place.
author: Tommy L.

description:
I love this coffee place! It's big enough that there's plenty of seating but it's smalll enough to have a good community vibe. I got the white mocha and it was very delicious, I highly recommend. And my fiancé got the chai tea, which he finished in a matter of minutes because it was so good. 
This place is a win!
author: Liz J.

description:
Good parking, decent food. 

I ordered the Tsunami sub which was pretty good but nothing special. 
The quinoa porridge was pretty bland and I ended up putting some syrup and cinnamon in it. We also ordered the arugula salad but was not a fan of the dressing. As for drinks, I ordered the white mocha which was pretty good!
author: Denise J.

description: The location is very strategic accross from the Ocean beach walk. I went there to work and get away from the city, but the wifi didn't work out.
author: Loh A.

description: The food was AMAZING!!! But the service was VERY slow and the staff took forever to take our order! Definitely worth the wait, but not too good of a place if you're in a hurry.
author: Luba K.

description: Usually love this place, however the cashier tonight would NOT stop flirting with what I assume was her boyfriend at the counter. She made eye contact with me multiple times while I was waiting in line as she told her boyfriend "I'll give you a massage later." Weird. She continued to shirk her responsibilities to flirt with (and give free food and coffee to) her boyfriend who was seated at a table, while her coworker handled everything else. I think she's new, but like...common courtesy and customer service isn't hard.
author: Lauren T.

description:
JBC is across the street from the beach and definitely brings a laid back kind of feel to the neighborhood.  I lucked out and found a parking space nearby, waited 30 minutes in line and 10 minutes for my order.   I immediately chomped into my Tsunami sandwich and side of chips.  The sandwich tasted great and I enjoyed the freshly toasted sourdough bread.  If you are with a friend, consider splitting a salad and sandwich for a lighter meal.  

Overall, if you are not in a rush and have over an hour to kill, this is a very chill place to kick it for lunch.
author: Andrew H.

description:
I love this coffee shop- coffee is great , staff is great- it's the laptop customers I have a problem with- no matter what day, what time these nerds are there with their laptops occupying almost every single table and they are there for HOURS. I don't know how the management allows these table hogs to occupy the entire place leave little to no seats or tables to customers buying food and drink.  

I respectfully suggest they follow other coffee shops- disconnect the wifi to drive these table hogs away so that paying customers can sit, eat and socialize with the locals. At the very least make them either pay for the wifi, ban laptops or restrict wifi connection for a maximum of 30 minutes.

This is a gem coffee shop- too bad it's being abused by antisocial laptop nerds who stare blankly at their laptop screens and nurse a medium coffee for 3 hours!!
author: A P.

description:
It is located right next door from ocean and their sandwiches are great-! 

It is always crowded with people especially on weekends-!
author: Jang R.

description: Quiet amazing place! If your lucky enough try the pies! The blueberry warmed up with the whip on the side is delicious. My drinks was pretty cool too.
author: Kylie L.

description: Been here a bunch of times, each time it's been a good experience. Staff is friendly, food is tasty, and I like getting it to-go and eating it on the beach! Can't beat that.
author: Emma B.

description: My favorite hangout in SF....good internet connection...diverse crowd...really nice employees...Kinda laid back so dont come if you are in a hurry
author: Gary E.

description:
Line is a bit much and the wait is a while - which seems kinda crazy when you're just getting a sandwich and coffee. Ordered the tsunami on French roll. 
A bit disappointed since I tasted no "special sauce" and the bread was super crunchy. Ingredients tasted fresh and shredded lettuce is a must for a sandwich. Like the vibe and area though.
author: Danielle H.

description:
So sad. 

My husband and 14 month old daughter stopped here on Sunday 5/27/18 for a quick bite before we were going to play on the beach all day thinking this would be a great quick thing.

This is our experience: 

2:01pm: We arrive and see there is a line of about 10 folks but figured it must be good so we decided to wait and order.

2:26pm: 20 mins later they have taken the 10 folks orders and got to us

We find a seat right next to where they are calling out the names for folks and ....10 mins...20mins...30mins... nothing. We see folks orders coming out so think ok no biggie and are enjoying the day. 

3:21pm: Its now been a full hour after we ordered and at this point my daughter is losing it bc she is super hungry and you know you need to feed toddlers on demand. I ask the staff if there is any way to speed up her particular order (of freaking grilled cheese...not rocket science there) as we are fine waiting for ours but we need her food right now. She asked what I ordered and I told her and she goes 'I think that is your sandwich...and points to a wilted sad looking veggie sandwich that has been on the counter sitting there for at least 35 mins. (sigh) Ok but what about the rest of our order? I explain that we ordered 3 sandwiches and she says 'I have no idea' .....uhm ok? At this point my toddler has had enough and we are all starving and there are not a lot of other food options in the area. I explain look what can we do here? I need food for my daughter. She apologized and then said they would figure it out right away. 

3:35pm: Finally we get the food and she explains they have no idea why but our food was never ordered or placed. (Ok but yet that was my wilted veggie sandwich?) She said she has no idea what happened. (sigh for real its been over an hour at this place now) Told her fine just happy to have the food....1.5 hours after getting there. She apologized and let us know that she refunded our entire order and then the nice guy who was also there gave us two beers "on the house". Ok cool. Fine...things happen and we are all good. 

Now today I look on my credit card statement and ....not only did they not refund us for our sandwiches as she stated. They also charged us for the 'on the house' beers. Ha, you've got to be kidding me.

What a joke. I will make sure to never come back here and also let my friends know as well. This place really could be quite profitable if they put maybe an ounce more effort into their customer service. Lessons learned for us. 

I just read another review from this same wekend of another customers experience about the girl being high. So I'm not sure if that was the case here or what...but seriously. Feeling a bit sad on this outcome.
author: Christy P.

description: Purchased something and it was awful so I took it back to the counter and the girl offered to refund my card. She said she put the refund on my credit card by pulling up my last order. Didn't use the physical card which I thought was weird. I asked her twice if the refund went through and she said it did. Well it didn't. I would give 0 stars if I could  just for lying to me. There's a way better coffee shop up one block on Judah called Beachside. Only reason I didn't go there in the first place was that they were closed.
author: Shelby S.

description:
Amazing sandwiches & salads. 
Also, pastries run out about 11am, so just keep that mind and go earlier.  Also, big fan of the vanilla lattes
author: Saideh H.

description:
$12.00 dollar turkey sandwich.......... 

Beautiful everything else, but a $12.00 dollar turkey sandwich????? I just can't. 

But it is a beautiful cute place.
author: Carlee M.

description: Always pleasant and friendly workers but their sandwiches aren't as tasty as it used to be.  The cold slaw is a healthy side added to your meal.  The coffee wasn't anything wow.  The sanitary situation can improve though. There are flies in the dinning area and the counter where the condiments are is pretty sticky and dirty all the time.
author: Janita s.

description:
It's like having coffee in someone's treehouse.

This place is so tiny.

The singer was so bad that I wanted to grab the microphone from him.

I could do a better Pearl Jam song.

Decent coffee, crowded spaces.

People crowding around as I'm trying to talk to my date who, after having a beer, we both realized this wasn't going to work.

I live a very boring life. Work. Occasional travel. Hanging out with friends watching the latest blockbuster film. Fine dining. Any dining really since I love food.

My date's only goal in life is to be a beach bunny.

I'm not exciting, I realize that, and I'm not into lounging around at the beach or clubbing.

No match.

Much like this coffeeshop, just not my style.
author: Jack R.

description:
One of my favorite cafes in all of San Francisco. The vibe reminds me of a pre-gentrified Sf my parents told me about/ the vibe I briefly experienced during early adolescence. The tuna melt is one of my favorites and the cappuccinos are 5/5 exquisite. 

Thank you for existing Java beach, you have given me so many beautiful sunny memories since the age of 7yrs old to my current 21 years.
author: Natalie M.

description: Got a delicious salad here and hoped to use the wifi for some homework, but the tables were all full. Instead, took it to go and ate it on the beach right across the street. Still, very happy and satisfied with this place, no matter how busy it gets. Service is excellent, food is fresh.
author: Nicole H.

description: We had to wait 1 hour for 2 sandwiches to go. No info on how long it would take, only " the kitchen is backed up ". Very disappointed.
author: Marguerite F.

description:
I accidentally discovered Java Beach Cafe during a long walk along Ocean Beach and what a lovely surprise too! I love love love this place. If its a sunny Saturday or Sunday this is definitely a go-to spot for me for a coffee and a snack. Located just steps away from Ocean Beach, Java Beach Cafe makes for one poppin' spot. With their outdoor patio, yummy grub and relaxed beach-vibe it is definitely a restaurant I would recommend to those who find themselves in the Sunset district. 

Food-wise, Java Beach Cafe serves up some mean sandwiches. Anything from bagels to BLTs. Today I had the pesto veggie bagel on Asiago and booooy was it good! The pesto cream cheese and fresh veggies were precisely what I needed to wake me up...the cappuccino definitely helped there too. Alongside the sandwiches they also have great pastries, including scones, muffins, croissants - you name it and it's fresh! 

If you make your way out to Java Beach Cafe on a beautiful day, don't be surprised if there is a line. My suggestion: WAIT! Line moves quickly and the food it worth it. You'll probably end up waiting for about 5 - 10 minutes for your drinks and food once you order at the counter, but the staff really work hard and do a great job.
author: Aletta B.

description: Haven't been here in a while, but I still don't like the drinks here. I can't speak for the coffee, but a drink like lemonade isn't good here. I spent $3 on a small lemonade and it tasted stale. You know that nasty sour bad taste lemonade gets when it's not fresh or stale? That's how it tasted...what a shame. I like the character of this shop, but the drinks have failed me time and again.
author: Denise C.

description: I love this place. Amazing food. Nice relaxing place to hang out. I'd say it's one of the best sandwich places in SF.
author: Sophie R.

description:
Okay, its got a great patio right on the beach. 2 stars for that. 
Usually when I go, its for a quick coffee and bagel to go to take to the beach. Ill leave my order that simple from now on.
I ordered the veggie sandwich which doesn't come with avocado. No bigs. I ordered it with avo and the counter person assured me that it comes with it. Awesome. It is also supposedly "stacked high" with cheese of your choice. I got pepper jack. BF ordered the chicken club. 
We ordered it to go. Bf waited inside while i sat at the patio. 10 min go by. Then 16. Then 20. He then asked about the order and it had been sitting at the pick up counter with no announcement. By this time im legit hangry. We take our sandos to the beach. I bite in. No avo. No red bell pepper. 1 slice of cheese. So basically $13 for a pretty simple veggie sandwich on sliced wheat with sprouts, onion,cucumber, 1 slice of cheese. A $6 sando at best. 
The thing is, the menu is NOT THAT HARD.  Im not giving slack bc they were busy. They are always busy, so the staff should be used to it by now. Calling orders loudly is important in a crowded place and so is getting an order correct on a pretty straightforward menu. 
Boo.
author: Nitalia P.

description: As a space to just relax and knock out some casual work, the Java Beach Cafe is really awesome. The coffee is solid, the wifi is consistent and the interior provides a homey balance of chatter and people grinding away in their notebooks and laptops. I hear on different nights live musicians come out and perform which is always a plus. The cafe is open until 11pm -- much later than most cafes in the city. The best part about this place is that it's located right next to the beach. When you're grinding away on work and need to take a break, it's really special to be able to step outside, smell the ocean and allow its cool refreshing breeze to clear your mind.
author: Max S.

description:
its been almost nine years since my review and now ....an update

request revocation for their permit to operate as a bona fide eating establishment ...

not so good, recommend elsewhere ...
author: tim y.

description: This place is not that great. Trust me. They barely put any beans in the Mexican salad. Cream cheese isn't organic.  No offering for vegans who also want a good amount of protein. Sorry. No. Go to Judalicious up the street. Vegan friendly. Also they force you to tip them even if you don't want to. Food took over 30 minutes to get to us. They charge way too much for a sandwich that's doesn't even have organic meats in it. This place grossed me out SO much. It's lame and I won't be back and neither should you. Unless of course you want free open wifi so others can pirate your private data. I saw 12 laptops there. Sadly these people have no idea about who can be spying on them. Don't go here. It is just gross.
author: Mary P.

description:
Came in for lunch on valentines day after biking all the way across the city and didn't feel like waiting at Outerlands for food. I ordered the Kale Caesar salad + chicken (they were out of Caesar dressing, so subbed italian). Luckily the italian dressing was pretty good, but not massaged in or evenly coated at all.  The BF got a sandwich with roast beef, which he said was pretty good.  However, the espresso was TERRIBLE-tasted like burnt sludge and we only received one when we had ordered two..we didn't want the second one because EW. 

The service was REALLY slow for the quality of food that we got, but the guy ringing us up did give us advanced notice that the sandwich was going to take 15 minutes, so we definitely appreciated that. 

Another odd note-this guy decided to site in between us and another pair of diners on one of their small benched tables, which was awkward but ok.  Then we noticed that he wasn't wearing any shoes (EW) and he kept saying how bad the salad that I ordered normally was. Getting more awkward.  Then- he asked if he could have my roll from my plate, which OK i wasnt going to eat, and then in a really self-entitled way said "hand me your butter".... SO WEIRD/STRANGE. He didn't order anything for himself by the way...just there for the WiFi and to significantly creep people out.  Anyways, won't be back because the food was just OK and I dont like feeling judged/creeped out/gross when I'm dining.
author: Raina D.

description: Good for a quick pop in for a coffee when you need some caffeine to face traffic on the bridge back to the East Bay. It's a serve yourself situation for the drip coffee, so no telling how long it's been sitting but it's decent enough. Really the best part is the proximity to the beach......If you have a moment go across the street and take your shoes off, spread your toes in the sand and touch the ocean waters. Suddenly that cup of coffee is the best one you've ever had, and life is good!
author: tami b.

description: Good place to get a sandwich and drink to enjoy at the beach. Sandwiches are pretty big and filling  . Perfect place to stock up before you head out to walk the beach .
author: Michael G.

description: Coffee was fresh and they had a great selection of sandwiches. Loved that it was staffed by all ladies. Really sweet location near the beach.
author: Betty D.

description:
TLDR: Great coffee and great place to study or have a nice conversation with a friend, too small for groups of more than three unless you want to sit outside

Environment: Java Beach Cafe is a wonderful place to study or complete work, which is the main reason I come here. It a small beach cafe vibe that is similar to one you might find in Santa Cruz. The music isn't too loud, perfect level to have in the background while conversing with someone. 

The coffee: very good. I'm a fan of Coffee Bar and Blue Bottle and I'd say that Java Beach is on par with both of these places, but no better. 

Food: I'd recommend the chicken club. You get a lot of sandwich for your buck and will probably have to take some leftovers home

Service: friendly, welcoming, not much to say here
author: Cesar S.

description:
Great place - love it to meet with a friend to talk - the infamous Don C comes here to mentor his followers, eat Tsunami Sandwiches (one of the best in town), drink delicious coffee and sometimes have a nice glass of vino or a brew in the evening. 

This place is a treasure but it does get busy. Fortunately they have outside seating. Sometimes  people will be SRO out on Judah Street - hanging out, 'standing', and eating or enjoying the good java.
author: Rew C.

description: This Java Beach became one of my favorite coffee shops to hang out with my friends over the weekend. The coffee shop is located close to the ocean beach, very nice location and the environment. Not too crowd at night. Feel relaxing. They offer pastry, sandwiches, soup, salad, coffee, tea and beer. I really enjoy the outdoor seating a lot. The restroom is considering clean to me. The cashiers are friendly and helpful. I love to order Latte there cuz it is always so smooth. : )
author: Katherine L.

description:
Populated, but not crowded on a Tuesday lunch time.  Nice menu, enjoyed my roast beef sandwich, certainly the juiciest I've ever had... maybe even too much so.  On a beautiful day it's a tremendous spot, with dog-friendly tables outside and the beach a five-iron away.

You don't even need a wedge to reach the Doggie Diner head in the middle of Sloat, which I have to say has been kept up stunningly well. 

Free open wi-fi... good because it's kind of a dead spot on the Verizon map.
author: G M.

description: This place has a cool vibe and a great location right next to the beach. Their sandwiches are definitely above average, but I recommend this only as an eat-in option, not as a place to get a quick sandwich to take down to the beach. I waited about a half hour for a single take out sandwich, and at $13.50 the sandwich was at least $3 overpriced for what it was. They could benefit from increasing staffing levels in their kitchen to turn around the large volume of take-out orders from people interested in taking food to the beach.
author: Derek F.

description:
Conveniently and excitingly located right next to the beach. Came here early morning to get my caffeine fix. Was able to try their "Carmel Latte" and a straight "Brewed Coffee"

- Half the people there in the morning appear to be regulars. Several newspaper vending machines right out the shop, so you'll notice half the room occupied by daily newspaper readers!

- The baristas are chill and laid back. They called everybody by name which added a special touch. Unfortunately I am not a regular yet, so maybe after a few more visits, I'll become more familiar with the baristas. 

- The Carmel Latte I ordered was alright. Standard coffee. A bit too foamy. Will have to try something else next time around.

- The pastries all looked delicious. The black current scone was decent. Nothing extravagant, but a pastry nonetheless .

3 stars for now, but will update after a couple more visits. If ever I go for a jog along the beach, I'll drop by this place again!
author: Jim G.

description: If I wanted some bread and cheese I would walk to my kitchen. But it came in a to go box so there's that... not sure the box was worth $8 dollars tough...
author: Júlia C.

description:
Perfect for a quick meal or bite before you head to the beach. Just a walk across La Playa and parking seems to be plentiful.

Got a blueberry muffin which wasn't anything special and a warm apple spice. My boyfriend got a bbq chicken sandwich that was missing the bbq sauce but it wasn't a complete disappointment.

I would come here again but get a bagel sandwich, those look like they are promising
author: Audrey L.

description: Awesome for a little while in the wall!!!!  Coffee is great!  Salad was wonderful. Service was quick. Just needs more seating. I'm a fan.
author: Steve J.

description: This place is amazing! Ive been ordering a white chocolate hazelnut mocha with macadamia nut milk. Sooooo amazing! Perfect in every way.
author: Ann W.

description:
I really liked this place! 
Very good for breakfast (fresh made Bagels and other baking goods, hot coffee, tea, chocolate) and also for a drink in the evening when it gets too cold at the beach. 
The tram stops right in front of the building, the beach is just over the street and our Motel was next door, so it was the best place to enjoy some food&drinks :) 
Would definitely come back again, the staff is also very friendly, young and alternative. 
Oh, and there is free wifi ;)
author: Corinna S.

description:
Great little restaurant conveniently located near ocean beach and golden gate park. This place has awesome ice blended coffee drinks. It was 90 degrees outside for the first time I can remember in SF and the mocha I got was super refreshing and delicious.

Also had an open faced grilled cheese with green apples and spicy mustard. It was interesting and overall I enjoyed it.

An issue with this place is that it can get very crowded and people awkwardly hover in random places while they wait for their food or drinks. It was also very warm in the restaurant. 

Great location, would come here again.
author: Albert E.

description: Nice, low key place with a great menu selection. Food was good, not spectacular. Ambiance is super chilled and staff is very friendly. One con for me was the way food was given. If you have multiple items, they come out one by one, and the staff yells out your name to pick up at the counter. It's a bit chaotic because everyone is hovering around that area. Wish it was "number" method like Crepevine or the Grove. Nonetheless, still a great joint.
author: Lucas L.

description:
This will be a short review because I only stepped in briefly. We got there a little before 10pm looking for a late-night snack. Upon walking in, we were notified by an employee that "There's no more food. We're all out." I was a little confused. As it turned out, they had no food left, only coffee. 

Very strange, and very unacceptable. To be offering no food options over an hour before closing isn't cool. We walked out and took our business elsewhere.
author: John B.

description:
I was looking for a hangout place on Friday evening to meet a friend after long long time. Found this place on yelp and decided to try it out based on reviews. No doubt it is a good place to meet friends and spend time chit chatting.

Good food at reasonable price and Live Music
author: Pranshu A.

description:
post 4th of july run in these beautiful SF hills was starving and needed coffee! 
went around the corner and found this gem. Crew was accommodating, long lines but now I know why. Prices were descent, but prob not worth $12 salads idk I will go back and try it though. 

I opted for the grilled tomato sandwich w/ arugula instead of the feta...but my order came with both :/ i mean I don't eat dairy but ok guys? lol its okay though we just took some off...

I ordered a latte w/ soy and omg that coffee was mindblowing! no splenda needed! 
we easily got a table outside as people were leaving. talked with people who sat with us aka the VIBES were awesome! 

cant wait to go back
author: Ruby S.

description:
Maybe it's the nostalgia in me, but I came to this spot at least a few times a month while in high school and it hit the spot every single time.

The sandwiches are fresh, filling and flavorful (look at that alliteration). All their sandwiches come with kettle cooked chips which provides a nice little crunch (and maybe you'll slip a few into your sandwich); the drinks are good and you can't beat the location. 

Mozzarella, tomato, pesto melt - 5/5 an open faced sandwich with white pesto, hearty slices of tomato and globs of melted mozzarella. One of my favorite sandwiches on the menu that'll make you forget you ever needed meat on bread

Kelly's Cove - 4/5 for those of you that need a little bit of meat, this is a classic turkey and pesto sandwich on multigrain that'll satisfy you every single time

Tsunami - 4/5 and then this tops it off for the meat lovers. 

Frozen Hot Chocolate - 5/5 the perfect drink to get and take a stroll on the beach on a nice, hot day (hot for SF that is)

They've got great indoor AND outdoor seating; additionally they sometimes have live music playing (on Thursday nights if I'm not mistaken). A truly amazing, relaxed atmosphere with super friendly staff and all around stellar food + drinks
author: Jay P.

description: Worst service ever. I waited 35 minutes for 2 sandwiches. I saw the girls place what looked like my sandwich on a plate, which I had a to go order. It sat on that plate for 25 minutes. Then they decide to put it in a to go box and gave it to me after they finally finished my other sandwich. Obviously they forgot about our order and I got to eat a 25-30 old HOT sandwich. The girls making sandwiches were awful especially on a busy Saturday.  For this incredible land mark it was such a disappointment. 35 minutes for 2 sandwiches when one of them sat there for over 25 minutes before the other sandwich was made is  pretty pathetic.  It's a sandwich shop not rocket scientist. I will keep reposting so they get a low score & improve the shitty sandwich service.
author: Amy D.

description:
Prime location for a relaxing day to get some work done at a coffee shop. They have a good amount of tables, a bar area and a few tables outside as well. It does seem to be quite busy most of the time but never crowded. They offer free wifi, however the day I was there it seem to be down. I asked a worker to reset it, but still had problems getting connected. I'm hoping this was just a bad day...definitely a place I would like to comeback to eventually if I can actually get wifi service to work. 

All of their food selections looked delicious. They have a range of baked goods, bagels, sandwiches and salads. They also offer a few beers (some that were even on tap), if you're looking for an extra lax afternoon. 

For how busy it was while I showed up, their staff always seemed welcoming and worked hard to get orders made quickly. 

Overall, I'll definitely be back to give their wifi another chance. Was probably one of my favorite coffee shops I have found in SF so far. Great atmosphere, great food/drinks, great service.
author: Christy C.

description:
Came in wanting just a cup of coffee for my stroll down the beach and ended up buying the Tsunami sandwich for the road too. Both were a whirlwind of flavor and pleasant surprises in different ways.

Bernie's Blend Coffee: Saw that it was a house favorite on yelp and wanted to give it a try. It was truly distinct and bold in flavor. Strong and intense, especially since I had it black. Got me wired after a couple sips!

Tsunami Sandwich: Another recommended try and it did not disappoint! Sandwich had ham, mortadella, salami and cheese of choice (I picked provolone). Crunchy bread with each bite with a juicy drippy combination of salty and sour flavor. Huge sandwich, so feel free to share.

The dining areas are usually crowded, but if it's a nice day, I recommend just taking your food down the road and enjoy the backdrop of Ocean Beach for your meal. 

Note: Credit card is accepted. But $5.00 min.
author: Vincent L.

description: Great spot to grab a bite to eat before headed to the beach. Friendly and quick service. Got the hummus veggie bagel and omg these bagels are bae. They are small but you can tell they are homemade, fresh, and perfectly toasted. Highly recommend if you're in the area .
author: Kelsey B.

description: Very good coffee. Made locally and small batch. Quaint coffee shop right across from the beach. They keep the windows open to let in the ocean breeze. It's obviously a very popular place, as when I went near lunch time the line was out the door. If there's no outdoor seating available because it's full, take your to-go cup and enjoy your coffee on the beach :)
author: Allen L.

description:
Near the beach, warm and sunny vibe, free wifi, great subs, what else does a person need?

It has become a yearly tradition that I come down here for a sub in November and the sunny vibes that radiate are more than enough to attract me back every year. The free wifi is also very useful and even if the inside seats are filled up, the outdoor seating is always amazing!

There is a selection of subs and sandwiches usually around $8 to $10 to choose from and drinks are available for purchase as well.

Another good thing is that you can hop off the N-Judah right in front and order a sub and head to the beach.

Best sub place ever!
author: Junming G.

description:
Java Beach is a comfy little neighborhood cafe that whips up a mean sandwhich. I'm talking about the famous "tsunami" sandwich! No joke, this is one of the BEST sandwiches in San Francisco. Just as a quick summary, the bread is perfectly toasted and fresh, a good amount of meat, along with some shredded lettus, and some peppers. You must try this sandwich!

The atmosphere of java beach is relaxed with everyone reading, on their laptops or engaging in friendly conversation with others. This is a perfect local cafe. Typically all the outdoor seating is filled on a beautiful sunny day. Dog friendly outside. 

Bottom line: Try the tsunami!
author: Jaime W.

description: This was a diamond in the rough! Husband and I went out there for the first time and ever place else was packed. Found this little place and food and service was great. The place was slammed! They do however need to do a deep cleaning, but staff and food was amazing!
author: A P.

description:
Guys, it's been an evening of highs and lows.

Get off the train, starving.
Head to Java Beach Cafe and realize at the door that I forgot my wallet at home.

Dig in my pocket and realize I have $13 plus a Discover card I hid in an extra pocket for moments like this.

My favorite barista is there! The one who makes untouchably perfect drinks.
It is nighttime but you better believe I am about to drink 16oz of caffeine.
No, Kasia, eat food first, priorities, focus dammit.
Ok fine, make me a sandwich.
Who else brings me my dinner than my #1 dude?!
Gush to him about his skills while he laughs and assures me he'll be here for a few more hours.
Scarfed that sandwich DOWN.

Time for the drink.
Order at register, ask the woman taking my order for The Chosen One to prepare my drink because he does it best.
Maybe she is slightly offended, sorry, it's not personal, and besides, we can't all be The Chosen One.
She looks at my Discover card and asks if I have another card.
Flashbacks to paying for my stupid sandwich with most of my cash.

Devastation.

Umm, I'll check, but in my heart of hearts I know.
Slink back to my seat where I tear my bag apart in vain.
Sitting there thinking I should probably go because this place is just a bitter reminder of all I'll never have.
It's ok, you'll come back, I console myself.
Console myself for longer than you'd guess I'd need to.
Almost over it, but not quite yet.

I look up and he is standing there! How did he know?!
"Here you go" he says quietly, and hands me one on him.

Not all heroes wear capes.

TLDR: Good customer service
author: Kasia H.

description: It's so hard to enjoy eating here or hanging out. 90% of the tables are occupied by laptop users that there's never a table open to sit down and have lunch or coffee. Not to mention I feel like I'm disturbing people who are working or studying just because I'm having a conversation in a coffee shop.
author: Giselle B.

description: My favorite place to grab a coffee before or after a beach walk while in the city. A must stop with great food and a wonderful bustling atmosphere.
author: Eve V.

description: Great place to do work. Also had non intrusive live music (I visited on Saturday night). Quite charming.
author: Amir s.

description:
Usually a good spot to go to. I had to drop a star for their bar tender. 
 Didn't even help me, just directed me to the front counter to see the menu. While sitting at the bar, I watched him cater to a couple by offering samples and preparing their drinks. I didn't even get that much.
