 Otherwise, the owner has ran an excellent establishment for as long as I could remember. The Baristas are always chill, descent atmosphere excellent espresso drinks and food. Finally, I usually find some cool people here to converse with. 
 Java Beach Café for the longest time has been a staple for me that I grew up with.
author: Merisa R.

description: Lovely quaint place . We stopped for coffee and a lovely wedge of Irish Soda bread w butter on the side . Yum
author: Angela S.

description: Really cool cafe by the beach. Great vibe.  Haven't tried their food yet but I had a vegan cookie and some tea, both excellent. I want to go back soon!
author: Mitch A.

description:
Food - ok, not bad, salads are a 4/5.
Love the beers in the back. Nice thing to have outside on a nice day. If only...

... I have never seen a place more crowded with laptop table hogs. Seriously, I am talking of the 15 or so tables, on a busy Sunday, line going out the door, people waiting around tables with their food eating it standing up, because a ton of not or barely paying customers are using the place as their personal office.

Owners of Java Beach, get some stones, and start actually removing people that abuse the space and make it nearly impossible to do business with you. Seriously.
author: Aaron E.

description: Great coffee, super fast service and extra nice personnel. Recommend to visit if you are passing by.
author: Davor B.

description: Authentic and cozy little cafe by the beach. It's so close to the ocean you can almost hear the waves crashing while sipping your coffee. Try the baked berries scone bread, it's massively delicious. I've been here twice, and you will see me again.
author: Lara K.

description:
Expect to needlessly waste 30+ minutes waiting on your food. First time I went I thought here was an issue, so I went back. Seems like it's the regular thing, people didn't seem apologetic at all both times. Many people were just hanging there waiting for their food for ages, not knowing what to do with themselves.

Seems like charging $11 for a sandwich won't allow to pay for enough cooks not to leave your customers waiting like idiots.

Food is good, but not worth the wait (even more so considering the price).
author: Rudy R.

description:
Great cafe with really good coffee and awesome sandwiches, all in a convenient location next to both the beach and the mini. Feels like a local, low key cafe and both the food and coffee taste amazing. 

They also had lots of bagel options for bagel sandwiches or just the basic bagel and cream cheese, hot or hold sand which options, and baked goods. For the sandwich options, choose potato chips or a fresh coleslaw for the side (I think this coleslaw might be without mayo, a bit different than traditional coleslaw). Several coffee choices, too. Then cross the street to check out the beach!
author: Sinead K.

description:
Cutest little coffee shop on the corner! One of our last stops on our way out of San Fran and I'd be sure to come back! I ordered a caramel latte which was bomb! And the people I was with ordered the mocha, raspberry mocha and hot chocolate. None of us were disappointed. 

Plus! It's right next to the beach so you have the best view and nice ocean breeze if you sit outside.
author: Courtney T.

description:
Java Beach, how I love thee. From the mouth watering food to the incredible service, this place is by far my favorite local eatery/coffee joint.

Do your mouth a favor and order the turkey club... or the kale Caesar salad... or even just a simple bagel with cream cheese. You will not live to regret your decision!

Side Note: Sometimes this place gets a little too crowded--but hey, that's when to-go orders and the cafe's proximity to the beach come in handy. When you do get a chance to hang out inside though, this place is the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of the city.
author: Sam D.

description:
Webster's English dictionary defines hospitality as  " generous and friendly treatment of visitors and guests : hospitable treatment. : the activity of providing food, drinks, etc. for people who are the guests or customers of an organization. I.e Java Beach" 

This is what Java does best, it makes you feel good, it's makes you feel warm, and most importantly the place cultivates your deepest most intrinsic pleasures and dreams. But who cares, whats this review all about, I'll tell you about my experience and why Webster himself believes Java beach to be the definition of hospitality. 

I walk in around 10pm, I'm hungry I'm tried and irritated. I walk up to the counter and immediately I hear a familiar humm. The homies in the back are playing "purple rain" by the artist formally known as prince. It takes me back to the 80s and it reminds me of my past love. Her name was Lucy Ann and she loved doing recreational drugs in neon lit buildings (RIP). Also RIP to The artist formally known as prince. Back to the story. My homie Bryan or maybe his name is Ryan.. Idk. But he's a good dude and he tells me about the day and hooks it up with some warm coffee and a takes my sandwhich order. The coffee was fire and the sandwhich was consistent. I mean for ducks sakes they put three slices of bread in there BLTs and you better believe that shit was grass feed organic and seasonal driven. All is well in my life, then suddenly a wild homeless man appears. 

He's belligerent; drunk and wet with who knows what. The place is starting to reek and I start to get uncomfortable. The homeless man is bothering everyone making a mess and trying to cause a casual ol fashioned ruckus.  Then Ryan or Bryan walks up to the homeless man and elequently calms him down. First the homeless man is in his own blurred world, but eventually Ryan's or Bryan's soothing and calm voice gets through the man. Amazingly the homeless man walks out, almost calmer and more silent than before. 10 outta 10 would dine again. 

The only thing I don't like about the place is the lack of paper towels in the bathroom. But pretty much it.
author: Milad E.

description:
Stopped in here after working up a hunger from a trip to the zoo.

Food was amazing, for what looks like a dive-in/dive-out coffee place in the relative wasteland that is Sloat near the beach.

Usually these coffee-type places don't have very good food unless they're in tourist-y plazas, but this place is perhaps the exception, as everything was ace, from the sandwiches to the baked goods to the coffee-type drinks themselves.

If this place was in my neighborhood, I'd go here all the time. Sadly for me, I live on the opposite coast!
author: Quincy T.

description: Great location! A block away from the beach, right next to the N-Judah train stop, and decent amount of parking! Good amount of seats with wifi and apparently free bocce ball rental!? The cafe is pet friendly and has seatings outdoor as well. Great variety of food and drinks, including beers!
author: Shogo T.

description:
My friend and I wanted to go to the beach, and he had to buy something as an excuse to use their restroom.

Mmm hot chocolate with whipped cream... it's so good that I think I may come back whenever I'm nearby :D
author: Michelle K.

description:
Golden! No words can explain how awesome this coffee shop is. I'm a student, a coffee fanatic and I love coffee meetings with friends and Java beach cafe just hits the spot for all. Ok, given that it is a bit noisy I need to count on my headphones to concentrate, but the coffee is amazing, wifi is fast, on Fridays they have live soft music at about 7pm (perfect for those days where you just get done with homework and need something more lively or to spend with friends). They have great food and snacks, the soup of the day is healthy and delicious. You can walk to the beach from the coffee shop and it's never hard to find parking so no stress at all to grab a coffee and run. It is full of locals and always has a nice warm vibe to it which is probably why I was able to retrieve my computer charger I forgot a couple days ago. Love it! 
Btw you gotta try their latte!
author: Tania M.

description:
Seeking a change of scenery on our regular Sunday startup work days, we decided to train down to Java Beach Cafe for brunch. Their sandwich menu looked yummy and there's tons of seats and decent wifi, so it looked like a pretty good spot to work from for the day.

I ordered the 9 inch Bonfire Delight, hot roast beef and cheese on Dutch crunch. I loved the crunch of the crusty bread with fresh ingredients, with the perfect combination of flavors. They've got lots of other delicious-looking sandwiches to try and I'll be back to try them all!

They've got a small patio outside where you can enjoy your meal with your dog, and the ocean breeze blowing through your hair. This place is crazy packed and busy all day long, so getting a table can be tricky. The only big downside is that the N-Judah turns around here, making for an ear-piercing experience every few minutes. Service can be a little slow but considering how busy it is, it's actually not too bad.

Food: 8/10

Service: 7/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Not the best and not the worst place I've dined at in the Sunset.

I think the 5-star reviews here are skewed by the long-timers who nostalgically remember when there were no other options. 

The coffee is average, the pastry is average, the service is average. The menu is very 1990s.

I appreciate the history but wish they would make the menu more interesting.
author: J. M.

description: Went to this cafe during my brother's lunch hour and we had some tasty sandwiches. He ordered the Tsunami and I ordered the Pesto Tomato Mozzarella Melt. Everything tasted good and the place was nice and open with fresh air. Only down-side is that the lunch rush made the wait pretty long for both of our orders. Still -- worth it!
author: Kris P.

description: Nice spot to grab a coffee & pastry. I love that it's steps away from Ocean Beach. Surprisingly parking wasn't too hard to find. The line can get a bit long but it does move quickly. Since it was quite busy on a Saturday, I opted to grab my caffeine to go. I enjoyed sipping on my white chocolate mocha and heading off to Ocean Beach nearby to sink my feet in the warm sand as I dogwatch -- so many dogs running around in the beach, scratching their backs in the sand, and playing catch with their owners.
author: Ruby C.

description: The food is good. However I see a lot of unsanitary things behind the counter. Work on your food handling skills please!
author: Brittany A.

description: 4+ for a very comfortable, local coffee/sandwich/etc. place near the beach and the zoo.  Staff was friendly and the food was good.  Didn't try the coffee, but it looked like they had good variety and people seem to come in for them.  We had the BBQ chicken sandwich and the red pepper bisque soup.  Tasty and a good place to sit down for lunch or a snack.  Not a big place though, so you probably shouldn't plunk down with one cup coffee and a laptop for several hours.
author: Ronny T.

description: Worst place ever, food taste so so, nothing special but acceptable. BUT this place is pack with laptop people, was with a toddler n ended up having to take the food in the car, on top saw 3 senior without seat n ended sitting outside in the rain, ps parking is not easy unless ur local
author: Dan Y.

description: Cute little spot ! Would come back to do homework outside. Nice seating area. Only got hot chocolate and it was pretty good but I wish it had more cocoa taste to it !
author: Carmen V.

description: We like coming here. The food is just okay but the main reason is the location by the beach and the atmosphere which is very surfer-oriented. Also there are outdoor tables usually available and you can bring your dog (everyone might want to wear coats since the ocean breeze is chilly).
author: p v.

description: The hippie chick in the Patagonia is theeeeee best! (Miss Heather) she always makes me feel good. :-) brew me up a late girl xx
author: Chelsea E.

description: Mediocre sandwich for $11.50 stale chocolate chip cookie for $3 wth.... this place use to be a nice spot to grab a bite in the neighborhood but guess Ill head over to yonkers cafe.... atleast they know how to make a sandwich.
author: Michael W.

description:
I'm wavering a bit between a 3-4 here. Internal debate... 

PROS:
 - The food is above average (the sandwiches, salads, soups and homemade cookies have all been delicious)
 - Balance of healthy/unhealthy (indulgent) items, important
 - Friendly staff
 - Great beach atmosphere
 - Often have live music 
 - That soup with a sourdough roll, tho

CONS: 
 - Menu doesn't have a ton of variety (it has decent variety, but I might get bored coming here more than once every few weeks). 
 - The price. Although cheaper than their neighboring cafe, it's still going to run you $15  - $20 per person for "good" beach food.
 - No free refills on drinks. Boo. 
 - There could be more/better seating. 

Net/Net I think this is a great option if you're near the beach in Judah and hungry - but not a place you'd really seek out otherwise.
author: Catie F.

description:
..stayed down the street from here for Outside Lands and was so glad we had such a reliable food option so close to us

My friends and I had to have tried 3-4 different sandwiches and they were all very good. My favorite was definitely Kelly's Cove (Turkey, pesto and swiss on multi-grain).

Aside from the sandwiches, the service was super friendly every time we went. I will not hesitate to go back if I'm in the area again.
author: Bob Q.

description:
This place is amazing. I love the vibe and the people who works in it. Thier prices are good. Cheaper than starbucks for sure. Everytging they have is homemade. They even make homemade chai! I have tried thier teas and lattees. I love the yogurt bowl its to die for spacially after a long walk on ocean beach. 

If you like your drinks hot make sure you tell them in advance, thier drinks are not hot for me.
author: Warda D.

description: Their potatoe soup or curry with bread hits the spot on a cold day.  Sandwiches and coffee is ok.  Its a nice location but can get pretty packed sometimes.
author: Chelsea D.

description:
Location is lovely, I mean it's sandwiches not a dinner out so there ok,coffee always hit n miss, slop or just ok. Staff nice. but the price are these people high. $12 for a sandwich and apparently half of 12$ is $7.75????? This place is honestly a rip off
Also it's worth reading the filtered reviews at bottom of page there less than flattering
author: obgyn K.

description:
Love and miss Java Beach so much!!!! Great service, delicious food and relaxing ambiance - thats the place you want to enjoy your cup of coffee. My favorite is Raspberry Latte and Tsunami sandwich.
Thanks Pat!!!
author: Olga A.

description: This place is great! My friends and I came down here every morning while we visited SF. There coffee was my favorite on the block and it definitely did the job. The place was pretty crowded (which is a good thing), but the service was hit or miss. Due to the fact that it was so crowded all the caps/napkins at the coffee area (where you jazz up your coffee) were emptied. It took a while for us to flag down the busy baristas to refill it.
author: Jordan W.

description: Lets start off with just the set up of this place, not tooo crazy about it, the tables are placed just not in a sufficient way and then you have the counter that people form a line in front off that goes out the door between the tables, so basically you have butts and people standing very close to you while you are trying to have meal and then the little area that you get your food from is in the back next to another table...it just does not work for me. The Kelly Cove sandwich for $10 was ok, the crunch bread was hard and I was not impressed, the cabbage was drentched in oil, I will not be returning.
author: Magda G.

description: One big drawback about living on the other side of the pond is the lack of proper sandwiches. It was a great treat to sink our teeth into Kelly's Cove, a turkey and cheese sandwich with a smear of pesto and a massive pile of greens squeezed between two slices of whole wheat bread. Yummy!
author: Ada C.

description:
Fantastic laid back surfer cafe with great sandwiches and pastries.

Java beach is a sunset institution. There are two cafe's in the chain, one by the zoo and the other closer towards the cliff house, just off of Judah. Both near the ends of muni lines and perfect for grabbing a little picnic to eat on, or to relax in after a little stroll along ocean beach.

I love both cafés. They have relaxed atmosphere, are light and airy and ooze personality. 

I have to say I prefer the one just off of Judah, but that's because there are more places to sit outside and it's got the park opposite, so feels more load back than the one by the zoo which is on the main road.

However there is friendly service, great food and consistency across the two locations, so there is little between the two locations and I would visit either.

Perfect for a brunch, or using their free wifi, to sit and check your emails.

I absolutely love the tsunami and bonfire sandwiches, made fresh and rammed full these are huge!

And whoever thought of the beef and ginger sauce combo for the bonfire sandwich is a genius.

Although I would recommend that you go for the mixed salad rather than the chips however with your sandwich order. I find them a little plain and lacklustre - and personally I am a huge fan of rocket (arugula here I the US).

Also check out the pastries, the croissants aren't half bad, I found it so hard finding decent ones in the US, and whilst these don't live up to the ones from France, they are some of the best I found. I really liked the grilled ham ones.

Cookies, muffins and cakes are also good and you get a good sized treat for your dollar.

My only criticism is that I really am not a fan of their coffee. Have a taste yourself, they'll let you sample. The French roast I found to be the best, and they have pretty much EVER type of milk and sweetener that you could think of, but I just never really enjoyed it. They seem a bit raw and burnt to me. Also no free refills!
author: Ray C.

description: The food is good and staff is friendly. We eat here with our dog and we love the fact that there is outdoor seating. It is important to socialize our dog and sitting with her outside helps make that happen.
author: Jinnie L.

description:
Huge shout out to Dana.  I accidentally called in my order to the Judah location and instead of leaving it to me to call Sloat location, she called it in for me.

Thank you, Thank you, Thank you!!!!  

This is why I ALWAYS come to this place!  You are all awesome :-)
author: Scott H.

description:
A caramel latte and an apple and cinnamon muffin... So nice! 
To finish a stroll down the beach, thanks Java Cafe
author: Rad D.

description:
This place has really gone to the dumps. Giving it one star for the beer selection, but the cashiers don't seem all there. Ordered a hot roast beef on a sourdough roll with mixed greens instead of their normal lettuce, got asked if I wanted it in the side, (why the f*ck do I want it on the side), anyways that passed, figured all was good. Sandwich came and was not worth $10.50, was the skimpiest amount of roast beef(guess roast beef prices are up...?), and on sliced sourdough bread. Meanwhile my friend has a sandwich 3 times the size of mine... On top of it all the sandwich was Luke warm and cheese slightly melted on the edges... What an upset. Will not come back. Guess I should remember years back when the place was still good...
 Have a pic of anyone cares to see what $10.50 buys...
author: Brian F.

description:
Come here when the sun's out. Breezes flow through the open windows, and outdoor patio seating is available, though often crowded.

As my schedule gets busier, I value anytime I can spend being productive. Places like Java Beach Cafe make productivity a little more bearable. If you have to spend a working afternoon somewhere, make it here. There's free wifi, outlets for plugging into, and enough room for your laptop, drink, and snacks. I'm sure the coffee's good, but I'll admit, there's nothing like a sunny day and a pint of cold draught beer while reading and catching up on email.

The draught beer selection's got your usual suspects, including Lagunitas IPA, Shocktop, Guinness, Stella Artois, etc. The food is pretty good, and generous! Nice, solid sandwiches.

Cool service. No one bothers you here. And it's nice to be able to take a quick stroll on the beach to move your legs around a bit. The fact that it's right there as soon as you step off the N-Judah helps, too.
author: Jade V.

description:
What a nice and cozy coffee place. I came here after a day on the beach.. So close, just across the street from the ocean. 
I had the BBQ chicken sandwich, even though the chicken was a little cold, the sandwich was delicious! Hubby even wanted to eat the other half.. But I only gave him a couple bites. 
He had the Tsunami sandwich, the bread was so crunchy and tasty.. I took a bite to try his sammy but we liked mine better, and so did my dog. 
The coffee at this place is great! I had the French roast and is strong just like coffee should be. 
I love that they have beer on tap, this time I was in the mood for a nice coffee.. Next time I'll enjoy the beers in the nice outdoor seating area!
author: Taci O.

description: At $4.25 for a tall Burundi, this place is definitely not for the average coffee consumer. That being said, I'm 3 sips in and can say with confidence that this is anything but an average cup of coffee. Full flavor served at a surprisingly low temperature creates a unique flavor I have yet to come across. #The best $4.25 I'll spend today.
author: Zach E.

description:
The farthest cafe out in the outer sunset area, literally next door to the ocean beach. The storefront photo for their yelp page does it justice - in the afternoon as the sun is setting, Java Beach gets a good measure of direct sunlight, so it's always warm and sunny on the inside. It's has a very beach-y SoCal feel to it. (Step outside and the cold beach air and strong winds remind you that you are indeed in the cold land of Sunset San Francisco ;)). 

FOOD
-Mozzarella, Pesto & Tomato Melt. Hot, toasted, and freshly made open faced sandwich with alozzzaaa mozzarella, hardly any pesto tho. Tomato slices yes. Pretty tasty and very filling. Sandwiches also come with a side of house-made crispy salt and vinegar chips. Crazy burst of sour and salty. (A little too much salt for my taste). This is a meal worthy of many napkins from all the cheesy meltage oozing and bread crumbs.
-Sandwiches are hugeee with several layers, specifically if you get anything with the dutch crunch roll. (Try fitting the whole thing in your mouth without making any crumbs). All delicioussss :9

PROS
-Free wifi! Nice place to study for students. Lots of outlets for plugging in laptops, etc.
-Quaint surfer cafe at the edge of Sunset :)
-Clean bathroom! 

CONS
-Pretty small/crowded space, but very popular for students. (Direct sunlight in the afternoon too).

Overall I'd say the food is tasty. The vicinity is small and crowded. It's a popular place to eat and lodge for a few hours. My favorite part of the experience was probably that it gave off a nice SD vibe.
author: Grace J.

description:
Java beach is always there to get a cup of fresh coffee, some pastry, a breakfast bagel... And enjoy it down on the beach! 
I walked in today and got a veggie sandwich. The cashier was super nice and she told me that my order will be ready in 10 minutes. Turned out my sandwich was out in 3 minutes. I went back to the beach, opened the bag and found out it was cold:( the Dutch crunch was chewy, not crunchy at all, and the deli cheese was just there (not melted not warm). Very disappointing. 
I would rather wait for my food to be fully cooked and enjoy it.
author: Katie K.

description:
I was torn between 3 and 4 stars.  Generally the place has a 4 star vibe... but for ME.. it missed the mark.

Really nice tea selection, there is wifi there, but it was a little spotty for me.

It stays VERY crowded throughout all of the morning. Which wouldn't really bother me if the layout funneled the patrons better.  Not really their fault, but due to the layout of the space, the long line crowds the entrance/exit. Then most people wait right by the counter for their coffee creating a bottle neck between the space and the restroom which is constantly causing people to ram into the table that I happen to be at. 

I would go more so to read a book than work in the future, just due to space. Also found parking easily outside.

Food looked really good, although I didn't try it.
author: Kat R.

description: Great food and ambiance. My go-to place when I don't feel like cooking or need a break from home tasks. I love the atmosphere of this place. Small inconvenience: sometimes is hard to find an empty space.
author: Leticia R.

description:
Crowded on weekends. The whole time we were there for brunch, there was a steady line. Pretty cramped inside - the tables are quite close to each other.

Enjoyed my sundried tomato bagel.

Service was OK. Not a cafe I'd go out of my way for, but would pop by if I'm by the beach.
author: An Y.

description:
As soon as the sun goes down, it becomes with and quite chilly at the Oceanside beach.. Perfect way to warm up? A cup of soy latte at this place. Haven't tried their food yet but looking at trysting it must be as good as the lattes. Second time here and it did not disappoint, although wish their sizes are bigger.

Value 3/5
Atmosphere 3.5/5
Service 3/5 on the slow side but can't expect much from this laid back beach Town
Quality 4.5/5

15/20
author: Nina S.

description: My rating comes from their prices...get real, are you gonna charge $5 for a mocha in this neighborhood? My car stereo was stolen while the barist was making my coffee...and it did not end up tasting good...maybe it was soured by thr stereo incident or maybe this mocha sucked. Either way I would not come back not even if they were offering free coffee.
author: Ruben M.

description:
Great location.

Local feel.

Awesome place to listen to your Chica rock the airwaves, sip on an Arnold Palmer while also people watching and exchanging "really?!" glances with my Chica's boyfriend.

Win.
author: Steven G.

description: This spot is relaxing. They have beer on tap which is nice. The menu is nice especially their sandwich selection. The seating is small and a bit cramped but generally speaking a good spot near the beach to and sip on some drinks. The also have a lot of syrups so your choice of sweetener for your espresso drink is from many. Yeah. Just come in here on a Wednesday or Thursday morning or afternoon, it's cool.
author: Robert F.

description: Good coffee and delicious croissants, especially the almonds ones...the real treat of my youth in France! I ll remember this place even if those ends up a bit pricy... :(
author: Fabrice L.

description:
+this place is across the street from the beach
+I like that they have live music regularly so that the establishment doesn't turn into a complete library
+I get consistently friendly service from the cashiers and staff
+free WiFi
+beer and wine options in addition to cafe libations

5 stars , yay!
author: Jaclyn L.

description: This was my to go spot every morning for coffee n a ham n cheese croissant Sammy! They make a really darn good blended ice latte.  It's the best I've had. It's not too sweet n don't taste chalky artificial.  The croissant do good.  I have them microwave mine for a few sec or so.  Just wish they put some cushion on those hard wooden Sears they have.  I don't know how ppl sit on it for hrs, my butt gets numb n it hurts.  Just not comfortable .  Vibe is good.  Staff super friendly !
author: Tee K.

description: Eh. I ordered a hot chocolate because it seemed like the kind of place that would do it right. But I'm pretty sure it was just the chocolate syrup that's used to garnish drinks and steamed milk. It tasted mostly of milk and cheap milk chocolate. I added a bunch of cocoa powder and cinnamon which kinda helped. My boyfriend ordered some blackberry Irish soda bread which was very good. And I ordered the Italian chopped salad without garbanzo beans. Which came out and was quite disappointed. I paid $12.50 for romaine, and 3 tiny artichoke hearts, a few strips of meat, and pieces of cheese. Boring and bland.  Totally not worth the money!!  I could have gotten something better pre-made at the grocery store.
author: Taylor C.

description:
I have to give the restaurant 3 stars due to the tables being sticky and the food served cold. Eggs should be warm at least and syrup shouldn't be coming from the fridge. Be polite and warm the syrup and have your runners bring the food out quicker the person working the register already has so much going on! 

All in all, I LOVE the coffee and siting out side. The coffee is served in a huge coffee mug with a very cute pic made from the foam. Cute touch. I would go back.
author: Colleen K.

description:
Seriously the best cup of coffee I have had in a long time. A very intimate location, doesn't seem too pretentious, and prices are on spot. This place saved us from our nasty hotel next door and wish we had one in our neighborhood.
Original review: 7/25/2014
author: Joshua H.

description: Huge line on a Saturday afternoon. There is nothing much to do other than wait in line. 5min away from the counter to order we are informed Kitchen is backed up by orders, atleast 25-30min wait on sandwiches. Oh well. But, Bagel sandwich has just 5min wait. Yey! we don't have to go elsewhere. I order pesto veggie bagel. Standard size bagel, lot of pesto cream cheese, tomato, onion, lettuce, sprouts etc. Was very delicious. Will be back to try the sandwiches again in future.
author: Shreyas P.

description:
Visiting SF for the weekend and have come here twice already! The service was friendly, location is right near the water and the coffee tasted fantastic. Would have given this a 5 but a few things stopped me: no free or discounted coffee refills, wifi connection is spotty & their large coffee has the same # of espresso shots as the medium. 

Still a great place overall!! I would be a loyal customer if I lived near by
author: Alex E.

description:
You ever have that "I sure could use a good coffee to go with this long walk on the beach feeling?" 

Not anymore.
author: M C.

description:
Every so often I'm in SF and looking for some quiet time to hang out with my laptop. I know, talk about first world problems. Anyway, this spot is legit. 

They have a huge list of giant hot sandwiches and they serve them with potato chips. I have tested the bounds of their small but mighty tea list, and they aren't messing around. Delightful herbal refreshments served in cute mismatched mugs. Their free wifi works well, even on their patio. Their patio faces the beach and brings joy to my heart. 

Once when here I saw a father homeschooling his kid while he was in a wetsuit. This was quite the sight, and apparently par for the course in Outer Sunset, but this little Canadian was floored.
author: Evelyn A.

description:
This was place is just amazing. The cafe on the corner and right across the beach that has amazing food, and great customer service. It really can't get any better then this. They have a giant menu filled with many tasty sounding sandwiches with a unique name of each sandwich. Of course they also have build your own sandwiches. The place is packed to the point where you might need to sit next to someone you don't know, or take your food to go. They do have outside seating as well which was both convenient and nice because you can hear and smell the beach. The employees were awesome. Really making you feel welcome. 

I ordered the Tsunami with the works. Salami, Ham, and Mortadella. I had it with Swiss cheese, pepperoncinis, pickles, tomatoes and mayo on Ciabatta bread. I ordered the Large which was more then plenty of food for anyone. Absolutely packed to the max with amazing ingredients. It melts in your mouth with every bite. Everything comes together perfectly in a symphony of flavor. I love the fact that they give you homemade chips with the sandwich. It is the perfect lunch. I am already craving more.
author: Jonathan R.

description: I thought it was to expensive. But that is what u get for dining by the beach. Other than that. Great service, clean, great quality of food.  Loved it. Didn't think they could make a good oatmeal since u know its can be a very boring dish, but they got it down on point of here. It's like they know there brunch! Great crowd. It was a bit crowded but I found a seat to sit once my Oder was ready and the line moves fast. It is cheaper and faster than the tavern and beachside cafe plus this one is right in front of the beach.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I think this is the first cafe in San Francisco that I felt at home.  I like this side of town much more than my side of town (South Beach) because it's less commercialized, less industrialized and peaceful.  I'm not saying that I could live here, but this side of town + Java Beach is a perfect getaway to have some time for yourself.  It's a nice change of pace.

1) Although it's next to the Pacific, Java Beach is always really toasty inside - even if you sit by the door.  And I don't actually think Ocean Beach is as cold as everyone thinks it is.  It can get awfully windy sometimes, but most of the time after studying, I'll either go for a run at OB or just dip my feet in the water (:

2) Their white chocolate mochas are SO DELICIOUS... and I don't even usually order them at cafes because I can get snooty about what constitutes "good" coffee (sue me, I'm in law school).  I can't say the food is that good, though.  It's whatever.

3) Sometimes on weeknights, there will be live music from local musicians who will play covers to all your favourite oldies!  

4) My favourite part about coming here, however, is the people I get to meet.  I was reading Kerouac's "On the Road" once when someone came up to me and told me how that book was difficult to find when he was younger, but that it made him move to San Francisco.  Another time, I was studying, and a woman came over, told me about how her kids went to law school and encouraged me to study hard... and that it'd all be worth it.

5) More practical matters: So easy to get to because it's at the end of the N line.  I take it all the way from near the Ballpark and will just read on the Muni.  There will always be parking if you drive, too.

6) It also gets really busy.  So come early if you want a seat!  There are also a lot of outlets, so no worries there.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Everyone's super friendly and the ambiance is great. If you order a no foam latte, they're going to give you a cappuccino. Disappointing.
author: Miss L.

description: There's usually a line but I like the coffee here. It's right next to the N-Judah turnaround and right across the beach so it's super convenient. Also good for dog and people watching.
author: Sherry L.

description: Had great lemon tart pastry and coffee today, stopped during my bike ride. Was excellent :)
author: Sergei Z.

description:
Drinks:
Coffee 

Service:
Friendly order at counter. Self serve coffee 

Atmosphere 
Kinda basic nothing fancy. It's only coz its conveniently close to the beach and SF zoo.
author: Angela L.

description:
I rolled in around 7:30am to grab some hot chocolate and read a bit that morning. I ordered a hot chocolate without whipped cream and gave $20 cash.

The lady (Lin) took my $20 and rang it up as a $5. After being shortchanged $15, I told her she rang it up wrong and Lin said she would call that afternoon if "they had too much". Left my name and number on the receipt. She never called back. Also my hot chocolate came with whipped cream despite me requesting a cup without it.

Worst experience ever. Essentially $20 for a simple drink that did not meet my basic specifications (just don't add whipped cream). I suggest to take your money farther towards the inner sunset for better service and customer service that listens and knows how to read money and do basic math.

TL;DR:
This place basic. Avoid at all costs.

EDIT:

Complained again and the lady decided to refund my money and give me a free drink the next morning. Remorseful service but still wholly unacceptable.
author: Ryuta O.

description:
Very trendy and easy going cafe with delicious sandwiches, outstanding lemonade, and a bunch of teas/coffee for the yuppies types out there. 

The sandwiches a fairly priced for the area  (it being San Francisco aka where did my paycheck go USA). That being said, if you're in the area it is def worth a try and I think you will leave satisfied considering the portions are pretty big unless you eat like a hippo which in that case don't come here =D

Highlight of my time there was the beautiful cashier in daisy dukes!!! Jesus Christ it doesn't get any better than her!
author: Eric S.

description: Expensive, small bowl of cheap granola with yogurt and a little fruit thrown in top.. $7.25??
author: Eric R.

description:
Great variety here in a perfect location. Get some food in you before or after heading to the beach. Indoor and outdoor seating. Great, diverse menu. Nice selection of sandwiches, salads, espresso drinks, baked goods, wine and beer. I'd order anything from the menu with confidence. Most recently I sat outside and enjoyed the turkey club (with deliciously fresh crispy bacon and thin sliced toasted sourdough) and a Lagunitas. 

Tip: if you like the idea of hand-feeding potato chips to tiny fluffy adorable birds, sit out on the patio and do that.
author: Ben S.

description: The Sunset would not be the same without Java Beach. I simply cannot give them enough praise. Delicious food, friendly staff, comfortable atmosphere, and killer live music on Thursday's. Can't live without their: homemade soups, fruit & granola yogurt bowl, sandwiches and fresh coffee.
author: Lindsay M.

description: This restaurant had me curious, I do not live nearby so when I first heard of this place my instant reaction was to go out and try this "(hot) Tsunami" that everyone was raving about in their reviews, and to my surprise I was not disappointed, because of Java Cafe's close proximity to the beach (a literal 1 minute walk west) I assumed the prices would be higher than most (as it does not say on yelp), and the sandwhich lackluster. However I was instead greeted by an amazing staff, relaxed decor, and delicious food. On occasion it was nice to stop, sit, and listen to this place come to life, the couple on the side giggling away, the man a few seats down only focused on his food and nothing else as if his world had only become his sandwhich and his coffee. I am excited for my next visit to try new food and drink. This place is a must eat!
author: Max L.

description:
Good location, friendly staff, decent coffee and sandwiches.

However, a few things were seriously lacking. It usually takes forever to get a sandwich here. The prices seem a little steepish for what you get, honestly. Their coffee was good, but not super hot, which I can't stand. Every time I've been in their soup of the day has some sort of meat in it, which is a bummer for those of us who don't eat meat. 

Service was very friendly and courteous. Place was fairly clean, but I wouldn't eat off the floor or anything.

It gets very crowded here and the tables are arranged in such a way that you are always either bumping into someone or being bumped into. 

The live music is...interesting. I will leave it at that, since this has nothing to do with their food or service.
author: Bianca U.

description: Yesterday was my first time there and I was blown away by the options and friendliness of the staff! I order a delicious wheat bagel with sun dried tomato  cream cheese and raspberry Italian soda. I stayed for an hour or so enjoying my meal and getting work done on my phone. I'll definitely come back!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
One star goes to the location closes to the beach and N line terminal. It's a plus that they have outdoor seating. 

One star for delicious sandwiches

One star goes to having draft beer available

Minus one star for no so good service from cashier to the ones in the back stage. You get much better services from the one by the Zoo. 

Minus one star for the overall cleanliness.
author: Lianna D.

description: Nice place to get some work done  (seriously, you can sit here for hours - bring some earphones as it can get loud) - solid WIFI, good choice of Sandwiches, Bagels and pastries. I love the big toast with Nutella..! I didn't like the dressing of the Aragula salad at all, but that's fine, I normally get here for breakfast :-)
author: Vanessa S.

description:
The iced mocha is worth a repeat visit. 

Normally, I'd give a three-starred place two stars since I likely won't return. The reason is convenience and duplicity in this instance, as its sister cafe is nearby on Sloat Ave (http://www.yelp.com/user_details_review_search?q=%22zoo%27s+side%22&userid=09T1oyi6c-9lvyt7gQCD2w) and both cafes are relatively close to one another. But, this location has a comfortable interior design, the couches, the outdoor seating (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/7SRJWnPVRxwqke3d82qefw?select=SV8rw2gehrZRemBNQrwL8w), the wines and the beers on tap (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/7SRJWnPVRxwqke3d82qefw?select=4DGEQVkBBn1zQd5YupOoyw), the Pacific Ocean waves as background noise. Hence, the four stars instead.

Did not get that last star due to the difficulty in finding parking very close by. Not their fault, but it's a dealmaker, though there is a lot of parking parallel to the Great Highway=Hwy 1 (not the side where you can see the ocean, but the other side - between the highway and the apartments and houses). Also, there was a strange smell either due to the salty air, or some of the patron(s) when I was there on a Sunday night. Ack! A panhandler was right outside as well.
author: Peter L.

description: Great place to relax near the beach, meet new people and have interesting conversations.
author: Nancy F.

description:
Needed a place to study in the Sunset district of SF and found this nice joint in the Outer Sunset. They had everything I needed--power outlet, coffee, and food. I had a good 3 hour study session here. Be prepared to get cozy with other people when its busy. This cafe is literally right next to Ocean Beach so expect surfer crowds inside and ocean winds when you're outside. A proverbial walk on the beach is warranted here during study breaks.

I ate this here:
tsunami hot sandwich - ham, mortadella, salami and melted cheese
It was juices-drip-onto-your hands good.

Highly recommended place to study for its food, internet service, and proximity to sand.
author: Marlon T.

description: After waiting for 45 minutes at the beach chalet down the street I walked to this place and what a great find it is! The food was excellent. I love the fact that they have soymilk almond milk and such great choices for breakfast. Their cakes are so fresh; they bake everything in house. And the service is outstanding!
author: Digna R.

description:
Great salads and sandwiches every time!!
I love the fact that everyone who work here are all friendly no matter how busy they are. I don't drink coffee but their tea selections is great too.
It gets busy on hot sunny days so getting a table outdoor can be a challenge, I usually ride my bike here and park it right in front but I can se parking can be challenging if you are driving. 
Pastries are always fresh too!
author: Ty N.

description:
I've been to Java Beach Cafe *several* times since moving to San Francisco three-ish years go. It's right near the beach, has big windows that let the light in, and it's staffed with awesome baristas who definitely deserve their tips (tip, people! -- you think working minimum wage and slaving over our coffees and latte art all day is actually paying the bills? Someone awesome with a great personality poured you that perfect cup of joe while standing on their feet all day and ruining their back, so throw a dollar in the tip jar, ya' cheap-o!).

Here are all the reasons one should go to Java Beach Cafe:

* Planning on laying out at the beach all morning? Java Beach Cafe is located right off the sandy strip and is the perfect spot to come grab a tall iced tea with lemon after you've soaked up your vitamin D for the day.
* There's nothing better than a triple-stack toasted sourdough sandwich with three layers of chicken, bacon, avocado, tomato, and more, all sitting pretty next to an overflowing pile of salty potato chip goodness. Mmmm.
* Talk about a perfect latte! Just the right amount of cool latte art laying over warm espresso and milk. When you take that first sip, your lip piercing the foamy cream, the rush of hot espresso washing over your tongue after is -- ugh. Just. So. Good.
* Working on a manuscript? Need to get through the last few pages of your favorite novel? Want to zone out in front of your computer for a few hours just surfing Reddit? Feel like whipping out your sketchbook and doodling during peak people-watching hours? Java Beach Cafe has *tons* of table space, lots of outlets, and available Wifi with decent speed (though not speedy enough to, say, run Netflix).

I've been here early in the day to snag a coffee before taking walks along the beach, and it's always swimming with people. Folks *love* Java Beach Cafe, and peak people-watching time is definitely from noon to 5PM.

I've also been here late at night for meet ups with fellow novel writers, as well as to simply relax after a long day and get some reading in, jacking my adrenal glands with caffeine despite realizing I shouldn't be drinking their tasty soy-milk lattes right before bed. Things get pretty slow and quiet at night -- the baristas more friendly (now that they have time to chat with the customers individually) and the people more quiet (folks in San Francisco generally respect that others are trying to get actual work done if they're at a cafe this late at night), but the food and coffee stays just as delicious.

Basically, if you're looking for a nice, chill spot that is sometimes peppered with surfers but mostly visited by the locals (this is *not* a "tourist" spot, though it very well could be), this is the place for you. It's one of my favorite cafes in the city, and for good reason.

I can't wait to go back for another latte!
author: Sherilynn M.

description: Hands down best vanilla latte I've ever had. I'm not from SF so I checked the Yelp reviews and decided to give this place a try. It was delicious! A little pricy but sooo worth it. Don't let the long line outside fool you, it moves quickly. I'll definitely be back!
author: Alyssa Z.

description: My favorite neighborhood joint! I love coming here on nice hot days. They make the best chefs salad I've ever had! And their ham and cheese croissants are pretty addicting as well.  They also have a nice assortment of beverages, including espresso drinks, blended ice drinks, wines and beers.  My go to is the Yerba mate- chai.
author: Linz C.

description:
Love this place!!! It's a very cute and homey little coffee shop. The workers are extremely friendly. I like how customers can get very comfortable and actually come here to study and do work on their laptops. They have a great setting outdoors so you can bring your dogs too and relax on a beautiful sunny day.

My all-time favorite snack that I usually get here is their Pesto Tomato Mozzarella Cheese Melt. Absolutely delicious!!! It takes about 15 minutes for them to make so in the meantime, you can grab a beer, wine, or coffee. Yes, they serve alcohol here. That's pretty cool especially since the beers are on tap. The beach is also walkable distance (literally across the street) so it's super convenient.  

The only things I don't like about Java Beach is that it's cash only and there are flies in the middle (kind of annoying). Other than that, this place is great for a hangout, to study, or to grab a snack. Again, the service here is excellent so I would recommend stopping by.
author: Monica C.

description: We walked here after completing the Kaiser Half Marathon.  The line was out the door (good sign in my book) and moved quick!  Customer service was top notch and the coffee was great too!  We grabbed coffee only to-go and there was a miscommunication in our order and this was fixed seamlessly and quickly.  You cannot beat the location with close proximity to the ocean.  I will stop by when ever I am in this area.
author: DeliaDana Z.

description: Best cafe in the outer mission. Best cafe next to a beach. It has a great atmosphere and they are open late for a late night study. I always came here to study in college and now I still come by from time to time. Great outdoor seating plus a two min walk to the beach if you need a break.
author: Mario R.

description: First time trying this place. I told the cashier that I was ordering for here, so I expected a plate. My friend received a for here plate for her order, but I didn't. The bagel with cream cheese was all messy in the bag they gave me . It was pretty gross. I ended up asking for a plate but it was just gross taking it out of the bag . Even I asked the cashier for a plate she kind of stared at me rudely as well.
author: Melanie T.

description: Solid food at really good prices.  Sandwiches are really tasty and you can create your own if you don't want one of their on menu specialties.  I was there today on a rare beautiful February day when it seems like the whole city went out to the park and the beach.  Java beach was packed with a continuous line out the door.  Whereas a lot of places crack under that pressure, the staff here were still super friendly and had everything under control.  Well done!
author: J P.

description:
For some reason on an afternoon walk, I decided that I wanted coffee but once we got here, I realized that I didn't actually want coffee. But hold the phone, they have HOT APPLE CIDER. This drink that I've been craving for months, they just happen to have. Silliness aside, it's a cute place that gets packed quickly but with it being right across from the beach, it's no wonder why. Great service that was fast, and delicious vegan cookies for sale, it's no wonder why I'll be coming back. :) 

Okay no, it's not just because of the hot apple cider.
author: Shauna S.

description:
Of all the places to eat in San Francisco I just can't recommend this one. First it's just not that clean, food and flies are an unappetizing mix. Maybe it was just that I was there on a very warm day but still... The service was lackluster, I felt like I was an inconvenience interrupting the counter worker's private conversation, the wifi was spotty, and the feel of the place overall was pretty average. 

Little sandwich shops have a lot of competition in SF and you really have to be on your game. While the food was good it wasn't all that, and so I won't be back.
author: Addison M.

description: 5 stars for the delicious coffee, 3 for the price. This is a small cafe with a few breakfast options. I got oatmeal - it was extremely overpriced and not very good. I wanted a cookie - it was $4. However the coffee is wonderful! It is a very small place with no room to move while you wait for your food. The people behind the counter were not friendly, but they were packed each time I went and perhaps they were frustrated.
author: Katelyn T.

description: We walked by around 2pm and the line was around the building... we moved on (to a place up the block that was really sub-par).  Later on during our San Fran visit, we took a leisurely long walk at sunset from the Golden Gate Bridge, through Presidio, Lincoln Park, and then along the coast...  We walked into the cafe around 9pm to the sound of Stella Blue being played by an old hippy with an acoustic guitar.  We had a sandwich, chicken coconut curry soup, a glass of red wine, and a pilsner on tap...  It was literally perfect... like angels singing (if angels sing Grateful Dead)... never wanted to leave perfect...
author: JaKelly V.

description: Comfy-est place to get coffee next to Ocean Beach. It's nice to have a warm cup of coffee in your hands when you walk down the sandy beach. I've only came here for coffee, so I can't comment on their snacks. The coffee is so-so. The staff are always the friendliest of people though, and I love that about this place.
author: Jennie T.

description: Love this place, but on the sunny days is too busy and there is no spot to sit. Anyway you can always grabbed some sandwiches and take a walk to the beach
author: Alina Y.

description: Nice spot in a an amazing location. Indoor and outdoor seating. Good food and drinks. Staff is always very friendly and helpful. Recommend the BBQ Chicken or Tsunami Hot Sub.
author: Kirill P.

description: I absolutely love Java Beach! I've gone here at least a half dozen times in the past few months. They serve some of the best coffee I've had in a long time and they serve vegan cookies! One time a had a drink called a depth charge. It was two shots of express and coffee. I chose the French Roast and it was the smoothest coffee I've had. There is usually a line on the weekend, but Java Beach is worth it.
author: Thomas J.

description:
I had an unremarkable lunch here today. Some highlights/lowlights:

The restaurant was very crowded with a long line out the front. Normally a great sign, but it led to a couple problems: chiefly a fairly long wait (~30 minutes) for a couple simple sandwiches, and a cramped dining room. I lost count of the number of times I bumped into others while waiting in line, walking to get something, or sitting at my seat. I get the need for tables to handle all these people, but in some ways wish there were less so it wasn't so cramped.

I was mildly annoyed when I ordered chips in addition to my sandwich, only to find they came for free with my sandwich. Thanks for the heads-up, menu board and cashier that didn't say anything about that...

Food was pretty good, mainly due to excellent ingredients. Had the chicken club sandwich. Great sourdough, avocado, tomato. The chicken was a little peppery but still okay.

Amazing location right near the beach. Can't beat that.

All in all this place was fine. Given all the other options the city has to explore, I likely won't be returning anytime soon.
author: Greg K.

description: One of our local places. Friendly & reliable, but do expect a queue and a bit of a wait. The sandwiches are gargantuan and really tasty. Coffee is pretty good too, and it's open until late.
author: Fi M.

description:
This coffee house is BUMPIN' baby!  Possibly the most popular Cafe along Ocean Beach.  This stop on my President's Day Date/Adventure was a lot of fun.

This cafe has a beautiful location with a bright, warm, and homey atmosphere.  The energy here fits Ocean Beach like a glove and I'd say it is a must if you are visiting Ocean Beach.     

Sandwiches (I know. I know.): My date seemed to really like his though ^_^

Spinach Feta Peasant Pie: A wholegrain biscuit like thing, hollowed out and filled with spinach and feta.  It was amazing and very well balanced flavor and a very pleasing texture.  Served hot and surprisingly filling. 

Chicken Wild Rice Soup: Perfect on the pleasant but cool and foggy SF day.  Warm, creamy, and very homey.  I did not once think of canned soup, and instead wondered exactly what went into it to make it so incredibly comforting to eat.

Jasmine Green Tea:  Who can mess up green tea?  Nobody in my experience in 23 years.  Java House is no exception to this trend.

The only problems with this place are a really a result of it's popularity.  Very limited seating, very close to overwhelmed staff. Pleasantries were not a priority, neither was picking up all the "for here" dishes.  They seemed to be out of a lot of pastry items and specials, but I suppose we did get there a bit after typical lunch time.  They still did not seem totally prepared for the volume of business (line out the door.)  I think ideally one would do take-out and eating on the beach but we were a bit too cold to do that on this day.
author: Susan C.

description: Horrible roast beef sandwich, the Bonfire Delight.  Each bite tasted vaguely like lighter fluid. I at maybe 3 bites before I gave up. I can still taste it. The meat had a grayish green tinge. I'll post a pick. Only plus was a friendly staff.
author: Bo W.

description: Great spot for a coffee and a bagel! I love the pesto veggie bagel. Coffee is always great and the staff is super friendly.
author: Joe K.

description:
The best sandwich i can ever have!!!

Get the customized 

Toasted, Whole grain bread, no mayo, no cheese, pickel or pepperchini, but have extra avocado, tomatoes, cucumbers, lettuce, sprouts, fancy italian dressing, and with cherry tomatoes instead of fatty fries etc.. and you will never forget the taste of this thing!!!! who needs meat if vegan food is tastier right?
author: Nihit S.

description:
On a nice sunny day Java Beach is hard to beat. They offer good food and a nice outdoor seating arrangement that overlooking the beach. It's more of a view of the sand dunes that guard the beach? But you'll still get those nice beach vibes. 

I'm a fan of their club sandwich and the open faced pesto sandwich. Order those. The breakfast offerings is ok. They have oatmeal. You can try the oatmeal. 

One thing I woudn't recommend is trying to come here to get work done. The internet cuts out frequently, which is frustrating but understandable; I wouldn't want a bunch of people squatting in my place all day either.
author: John B.

description:
Cant believe i haven't been here earlier and i live so close.

awesome food.

great service.

their brunch menu is pretty good.

i recommend the bacon and waffles and breakfast burrito! 

i need to try their sandwiches because they look so good!
author: Carol Y.

description: A neighborhood staple with a great location near the beach and park. Java Beach is known for good quality and reasonably priced coffee; I also enjoy their sandwiches and quiche. The staff is very friendly and quick despite how busy it gets. The atmosphere is great, but sometimes it can be hard to find a seat. I was happily surprised to see a local beer selection, too! I recommend trying their Irish Soda Bread.
author: Jedd B.

description: Cute little place with great coffee! The only cons are, how crowded the cafe is, and how noisy it gets inside! (To the point where you can't even hear your name being called.) I definitely will be coming back!
author: Alejandra P.

description: This is a fantastic little Cafe and Restaurant at the foot of Judah. Waiting for the Metro? Run in and grab a coffee or an Italian soda. If your hungry, the food looked absolutely amazing but I didn't try it. There's a nice little outdoor seating area and the staff is ultra friendly.
author: scott h.

description: Great neighborhood spot. I usually order the veggie sub or bagel with humus and has been consistently good. The service is fast enough even on busy days.
author: Sheila N.

description:
Legit cafe. Legit location. Decent lunch. 

They have everything and more than you would expect from a cafe(beer+sandwiches+salads). Its not 5 stars because the food isn't mindblowing good. just above average cafe sandwiches.
author: Blair A.

description: Since my last visit & review on Aug. 15, 2015, Buffy, the owner personally tried to make my bad experience better. After speaking to her, I genuinely felt that Java Cafe had an off day for their customer service & food, & that their standards are set high. I look forward to my next visit & a better experience. At Java Cafe, they care about their customers & they value your business! And that feels really nice.  :)
author: Vi H.

description:
Most everything at Java Beach is on par with practically anyone's expectations of a café.
However, the donuts are pitiful. Stay away from them, especially the old-fashioned glazed.
My old-fashioned glazed donut had a squishy spongy consistency and a lemon zest flavor, why?
FAIL
author: Mathew R.

description: This place is alright. I can here with my group from Arc of San Francisco. This place is not the place I would go to for hot chocolate or a choke or a chocolate muffin. I came here for a muffin or a brownie. What I had was ok. I would like this place to become a Philz Coffee. Sorry I have to say that.
author: Isaac H.

description: I think this place has the potential of being really good and that's why I give it 4 stars. My white mocha with whipped cream on top was delicious so in the coffee department it was a success. When it came to food I think I just made a poor decision. I ordered the open face pesto tomato mozzarella sandwich and it was just that: pesto tomato and melted mozzarella. It is just way too much bread and cheese for the morning. I wish it would have come with more on it. But like I said, they delivered exactly what I ordered so it's hard to complain. I'm just glad it came with a little side salad. I think I would give this spot another chance and just make better decisions.
author: Laura K.

description: This cafe is conveniently located right next to Ocean Beach, only a short walk away! Because it's so close, it gets crowded whenever the weather is nice. Sometimes the wait for food can be up to an hour... but it's really not worth that long of a wait. Their sandwiches, salads, and breakfast foods are good but not anything I would go out of my way to get. Fortunately they have a decent amount of seating and free WiFi! I'm sure this is the perfect cafe to frequent on quieter days, but it's just not for me.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
This is my little neighborhood place! Forever!
Incredible food options, best coffee around, right by the beach... dirty surfer men, happy little joggers. you really can't ask for something more special!

Prices are a bit high, though. Salads are almost $15 (kind of ridiculous).
There's also one really bad person who takes orders and always gets it wrong.

Love the hot veggie sandwich and Mexican salad.

It's nice to grab a sandwich and bring it to the beach and relax.....
author: Carleen W.

description:
Open to 11pm for a cafe/coffee shop - a godsend in SF. 

Walking distance from ocean beach, beachside cafe, trouble, AND wastelands. 

Relax here. Catch up with friends. Do some work.

Have some hot cider, a cup of does-the-job coffee beverage, a sandwich, and you're well on your way.
author: Danny Y.

description:
Food is ok priced and ok in taste.
Awesome location

BUT 
I would love to sit down and eat there, unfortunately 50% of the tables are taken by people with laptops or that are using tables as a office. I get that it's a nice area to work in but some of us would like to sit down and have a nice lunch.
author: Cortney c.

description:
pros: ok coffee, good sandwiches
Cons: noisey, hardly any seating, and if you want your coffee/snadwiches to be any good be sure to bring a cute guy friend otherwise you are invisible.
author: Karin B.

description: This place is amazing! Open late and their lattes are to die for!!! Sandwiches are cheap and you get a ton of food.
author: Taylor M.

description: I've been going to this place for years and I'm finally writing a review. Friendly staff, chill environment. Love this place. Perfect for studying / working on the weekend. It can get a bit crowded on Sunday afternoons , but otherwise can't complain!
author: Amber K.

description: Nice neighborhood cafe. There is a lot of local flavor, and it's right near the beach. They make great doughnuts. Sometimes it is a bit crowded/rushed, and they often forget or mix up your order.
author: Audrey W.

description:
Mocha was just ok.  So yeah, "Meh, Ive experienced better" which is equivalent to 2 stars.  What annoyed me most was the barista thought it was ok to text in-between making coffee orders.  And she did this while we all stood and waited.. she even made eye contact with me a few times and proceeded to text and drink her soda.  Then she took a phone call and walked away while I and a few others were waiting for our drinks.  I just don't think it's professional or hygienic for a server to be handling my food while touching their dirty cell phones and/or help him or herself to soda while we all wait for our overpriced coffee drinks.


UPDATE:  The owner sincerely apologized for my experience.  I can appreciate it when owners care about their customers and business and for this I feel my original 2 stars should be increased.  I will give them another shot.
author: A T.

description:
I come here to get coffee every day, unless the line is out the door. At that point it's not worth the wait. Because you *will* wait. No one is in a hurry to get through the line, or to get your order to you, so come expecting to spend as much time as it takes for everyone to be helped in a calm collected manner. No matter how busy it is. 

When they make mistakes on the order and you ask them to make it right they give a little attitude but they smile at the end so whatever. 

In the end it's not gonna change, so deal and enjoy your tasty $10 sandwich.
author: Miss N.

description: Fantastic place! I had the tsunami sandwich and the bread was delicious.  Its one of those places you walk in at a busy time and wonder if you'll get a seat after you order, but it always works out :)
author: Patrick O.

description:
My favorite neighborhood coffee shop. Affordable, delicious and the staff are friendly. 

Pesto veggie bagel is my favorite.
author: Devin C.

description: If you intend to eat there during lunch, you should get there a tad bit early cuz the seats fill up fast via students or customers. Stacy's Mexican salad is a must try. Sandwiches coffee also good, not to mention a few beers in Tap. Outside front patio is also great.
author: Jrod Y.

description:
Immediately a fan. The people and location make this place. Great customer service. Laid back, easygoing crowd. "Beachy" environment. (Are you surprised?) I love that they DON'T charge extra for extra espresso shots in the Americano, unlike its bigger-named competition and counterparts. 

For instance, a medium can hold up to three espresso shots at no additional cost. Whereas at Peet's, the small and medium each contain only TWO espresso shots with an increase in price from small to medium. (I can't quite figure out why - Are they charging for the cup or for the additional hot water? Even the cashiers can't explain it to me...)
author: Chris S.

description:
We went on a sunrise walk by Ocean beach and was happily surprised that this coffee shop was already opened and running at barely 7am.

You can tell by their mocha that it is more heavy on the quality of the coffee than the sugar and chocolate which I appreciate. You know you are drinking some real good coffee because you taste the aftertaste of coffee.

They had tasty cranberry muffins and chocolate croissants. I appreciated their large selection of pastries after a long walk from Outer Sunet to Outer Richmond. So delicious.

Just remember to order somewhat on the top of your lungs as the coffee makers are loud and it makes it difficult for the staff to hear you/ take orders.
author: Doriancita X.

description:
Anyone who lives in the Sunset knows about this place. Even after moving, I still make sure to get me a sammich and a hot beverage here on my way to the beach. The sandwiches are decent, the outdoor seating is lovely (if you can find a spot) and the place is full of great characters. They also have live music often and a lil bar section in the back. I was once casually approached by a magician who was waiting for his food (the wait is always at least 15 minutes) who dazzled me with some tricks and asked for my number. 

The only thing that does irk me a bit is the wi-fi hoggers... but then again, why fret about not finding a place to sit when you can just walk across the street and eat at the beach with a view of the ocean?! 

And for the person who said "A tomato, basil, mozarella sandwich should not have cream cheese on it" pfff I beg to differ...
author: Ariana O.

description: The food is good but pricey and sometimes the cashier is rude. But some days are good
author: Kristine C.

description:
Oh Java Beach! The local stomping grounds for ladies in puffer vests, dirty surfer men, and laptop intellectuals. The crowd here is surprisingly consistent, which makes the space a bit cozy (read: crowded) at times. 

That being said, Java Beach is a true treat along the coast. There is plenty of seating inside and outside on the patio, so even when it's busy, you can manage to find a seat eventually. On weekends, lines are out the door, but they move very quickly, so don't be disheartened. 

The lines are there for a good reason! This place knows how to make a great soy latte. The pastries (croissants, bagels, muffins) are tasty, and the baristas will warm them up for you. Their sandwiches are just what you want for a foggy, mellow sunset lunch. The bread is delicious (I like Dutch Crunch), and the sizes are extremely generous! My favorite is the **HOT VEGGIE**. So delicious, cheesy, and crunchy. Chips are included if you get it "for here" or ask for them with your to-go order!

Overall, I highly recommend Java Beach... although I secretly hope that the lines don't increase. It is a great place for a satisfying lunch and brings a lot of much needed character to the outer sunset. 5 Stars!
author: Jasmine M.

description: This is my go to place whether I am alone or with my bf. I especially come here when I feel bleh. I tend to order the caramel latte when I need a pick me upper and I switch off on the choices of sandwiches they have. I love the service here and the chill atmosphere. I can relax here for a bit and enjoy my sandwich. Then I walk across the street to take a stroll at Ocean Beach to embrace it all as I continue to enjoy my cup of joy. I love Java Beach Cafe because it is simple, great service, and it is right next to the beach. =)
author: Anji W.

description: Great spot for basic American breakfast and cafe food right in the beach with outdoor seating. It can get very busy by 9:30am on weekdays!
author: B S.

description: Cheap, fast, friendly and charming kick it spot. I like it :)
author: Kristy F.

description:
Sandwiches are my second favorite food (first is spaghetti) and this place serves some low priced, delicious and large portioned goodness. Outdoor seating is lovely but does get crowded during lunch hours. The lunch line can also get long but don't fret - it moves fast. 

On warm, sunny days, take your sandwich and walk right to the beach for a wonderful lunch.
author: Devy E.

description: It's nice to find a cafe that has actual character, not trying to be foofy, but just a good neighborhood cafe.   Good mocha's and retained its "look" since I met the place in 2004.
author: Gregg L.

description:
Hot Tsunami. I never thought I'd be able to say those two words in public, out loud, and consistently. And, have it be a restaurant order, too. 

The only place that's worth a stop west of Stanyan for a late night sandwich. I've tried them all. Out of the dozen or choices, this is the only sandwich that's served 'til 11pm every night, whether you take it to go or sit in, that's reliably good. 

This space is really diverse and typically full. It's both neighborhood locals, people from the city that take that one outing a year to the beach & college students. With a back bar of a few local beers, indoor booths, and an outdoor patio. The menu being a long list of solid deli sandwiches SF style -- with dutch crunch. 

I really don't know what else you would ask for in a cafe like this? Craft coffee? It's two doors down at their other cafe, Beach side, and you could just bring it here? It's at the end of the N Judah line, too. The late night viability of this place is a major stand out part of it all, and my late to home work nights are thankful.
author: Jon A.

description:
I love this coffee shop. It's the perfect spot for food after a long day of surf !!! It can get busy sometimes.

They have really good cold or hot sub! Oh, and hot Apple cider is pretty good!
author: David L.

description:
This place is pretty good. I ordered the pop by special, which is just the spinach salad. My friend ordered a small apple cider, and the cup is smaller than a Starbucks small! There about the same price, so I was appalled by the smallness of it.

Finding seating can be a challenge, especially since people decide to bring their laptops in her books and read and only have a small mug on the table. Hopefully someone taking up a table will offer the chair next to them or in front of them to you, but if you're here with the group or something... Good luck.

But the food is pretty good. I just wish the sizes were more appropriate and fair.
author: Jade F.

description: Amazing coffee and a wonderful place to stop in where you are headed to the beach. I make a point to go here every time I come to San Francisco.
author: Kimberly W.

description: six stars!... based on 7+ years of visits to this joint ~ reliably excellent cappuccinos. I wish they were open 24/7 ...and had a better variety of beer. this place truly has that *local* feel
author: Loren B.

description:
Please do some housekeeping by the draft beer area, too many 
Fruit flies there! There is no EXCUSS for poor housekeeping.
SF environmental health inspectors would not be pleased.
author: Robert L.

description: This was a really nice cafe. The tsunami hot sub was very big and tasty, hit the spot for a hungry traveller! Their coffee is also very good quality with fast and friendly service and a nice atmosphere. Would come back again!
author: Bryce J.

description:
I was gravely mistaken when I thought that Java Beach offered serve yourself free refills on Coffee...

 Java Beach is convenient, one of the few cafes close to Judah and Ocean so you sort of have to pop in. Nothing spectacular or too memorable about any of the many times I have visited this cafe apart from a good place to go in for a coffee, the food looks ok, salads and sanwhiches.

It would be nice if they made pretty looking designs in their Lattes and free refills would be even nicer.
They have wifi which is quite convenient and outdoor seating. This place can get a bit busy with lost tourists cos apart from going down to the ocean, Ocean Beach really isn't that spectacular and neither is this cafe.
author: Julian I.

description:
The food is decent, and so is the pricing.  I would give it 4 stars, except I think there are a few things that they should work on.  

Their staff is not very friendly and it is a little unorganized.  You order at the counter and the food gets brought out to you, unless it is soup, then you have to wait for it at the counter.  You also wait for any drinks at the counter, which is normal, but the soup thing is strange.  They yell out your name in order to find you and bring you your food.  I think they should invest in some numbers that us customers can bring to the table or something so that we don't have to constantly hear yelling while we are eating.  Also there isn't much indoor seating, which is a bummer because most of the time, the weather in SF, especially by Ocean Beach, kinda stinks.  Maybe they can install some heat lamps outside?  Of course, on a warm day, this isn't a problem, but we all know how often that happens.

Even though there are a couple things that need work, I will probably give it another shot and try their sandwiches if I'm in the area!
author: Juliana K.

description:
I love this place on a warm SF day-perfect to sit outside on one of their tables. Get a beer and Stacy's Mexican Salad!!! To die for-crunchy lettuce tossed with black beans, tomatoes, cheese, dressing, and chips!

It's also cozy inside with a nice cup of cap (I've added 2 extra shots on the house before)-who can beat that?
author: Cora M.

description: Friendly and helpful staff. Excellent service and my sandwich was delicious! I would definitely come back here.
author: Victoria L.

description:
I really, REALLY love this place. The food is tasty, and the people are cool. Even after moving to another neighborhood I still find a way to make it out to this chill place for a bomb sando.

My only issue with this place is the seating situation. Java Beach offers free WiFi, which is great, but it also encourages people who only bought one apple to sit on their computer and hog a whole table. Leaving no room to sit for us poor people longingly looking at our delicious food.

So: some of the best food you can get in the Outer Sunset. BUT, don't come here expecting a restaurant that allows you to easily sit and enjoy. Get it to go and explore the neighborhood.
author: Marissa A.

description: This is an interesting place. The espresso drinks are O.K..  The atmosphere is alright.  It would get four stars if it wasn't _SO_ over crowded with people sitting with their laptops for hours on end. With so many people connected to free public wi-fi with no password protection, it has to be a identity thief's dream
author: Menlo K.

description:
Great place to come and study while drinking a decadent almond milk latte.

I walked in a few months ago and told the woman that I was new to the neighborhood and she was so welcoming and gave me my options.
I love when the customer service is as awesome as it's coffee.
author: Eff B.

description: This is a Cali favorite for me. Very friendly, easy going atmosphere. Good food, great drinks (the best I've had at a Cali coffee shop) and plenty of indoor/outdoor seating. Right across the street from the beach so the scenery can't be beat either!
author: Monica B.

description:
love this place! it's bright inside, they have outdoor seating and the parking isn't difficult. the staff were friendly and there was a good variety of sandwiches and salads on the menu. the sandwiches are huge and reasonably priced! my roast beef was really good but i could only eat half for lunch so i got two meals for the price of one - bonus!

i'll be back now that i know where to find this place...!
author: Tera K.

description:
Really cool little spot by the beach. Love to kick it there and just relax with a coffee. They also have some pretty big sandwiches decently priced. 

Hope this spot is here for years and years to come.
author: Nick O.

description:
I don't think I would come here if I didn't live in the neighborhood, and I find the interior to remind me way too much of my troubled mid-twenties when I spent way too many hours having espresso-induced anxiety attacks in cafes with chalkboard menus, but Java Beach deserves recognition. 

Why? Because they are open till 11 pm. 

Yes, here, in this strange neighborhood, we have a cafe that serves actual food till a normal hour. This is great. You hop off the N, the friendly proprietress (who actually remembers you after you come by a second or third time) is nice to you, and you get decent food at a normal price. The cafe is full of all kinds of people at all hours, because most people have lives that dont't stop at 7 or 8 and isn't it nice to have a place open till 11pm? 

It is nice. Thanks, Java Beach.
author: Maria D.

description:
