Without a doubt, the best damn BLT I have ever had - I get it every time with the cole slaw and an arnold palmer.  Those chocolate chip cookies are a little bit of heaven btw.


ps.  whoever is in charge of picking the music needs to be changed because that is the ONE downside i've experienced the last three times i've been there.  just terrible.
author: stephanie e.

description:
Hey, fellow cheese addicts: Java Beach has a THREE-CHEESE SANDWICH (your choice of cheese) with cucumber, avocado and sprouts. Tip: Eat on the premises to get free chips. Also, order a small even if you're hungry -- the portions are monstrously large.

Stacey's Mexican salad with black beans, avocado, corn, Dorito chips and cheddar cheese is a good option if you're in the mood for salad. 

Prices are a bit high, but the restaurant is overlooking the ocean and the vibe is very hippie/relaxed. The coffee also smells intoxicatingly good.
author: Tiffany W.

description: Sandwiches are good to take to the beach. Often are out of a few items. Good beer on tap. Wifi is slow. Always busy!
author: Virginia C.

description: It was my first time here and so I had a lot of questions on what was a good choice. My friend had ordered and was waiting on me to make a decision. I asked the cashier girl about some latte choices, and she sped through the options as she had a rbf while answering my questions, in which I felt obligated to quickly make a choice. I ended up getting a latte with almond milk, and upon receiving it, my latte came out lukewarm. My friend and I were not impressed with our drinks at all. As I already mentioned, my latte came out lukewarm, and it tasted quite watery, his chai latte was too overpowering and didn't suit his taste buds. To top it all off, the service was terrible and didn't feel welcoming.
author: Kass L.

description: This cafe is an awesome space with a unique menu in highly trafficked area right by the ocean. Your selection of soups, sandwiches, and salads are all home made and coffee, beer, or smoothies are offered so many people can get their fix here. The close proximity to the train and the beach and being open from dawn to nearly last call make it incredibly easy to patronize here, don't let the crowds scare you away from a great meal on your trip down Judah St.
author: Darren F.

description: Oh how I miss you, Java Beach Cafe.  While residing in San Francisco, this was most def my go to bagel spot.  I've had some of my best bagels here, no doubt.  I also enjoy their slow drip single brew coffee.  Doesn't hurt that they are right next to Ocean Beach! Their menu is also very extensive & in the late afternoon & evenings they serve beer! Awesome beach spot.  What are you waiting for? Grab a sweatshirt, get your bagel & hit the beach!
author: Jennifer J.

description: Amazing sandwiches! I think I found my new go to sandwich spot in the sunset (not to mention their cholcolate milkshakes are to die for!).  We sat outside and had a perfect shot of the water. The place wasn't too crowded, the service was great and the location is perfect - just steps away from Ocean beach! This is a must try!
author: Nehal P.

description: Every time I am in San Francisco I make sure to stop by Java and get their iced caramel latte! So good and they are right next to the beach on the corner of the street! Love their location and shop definitely a fave!
author: Samantha J.

description:
This place is ridiculously packed....... But it was worth the wait! I had a chicken salad with avocado and pesto on dutch crunch roll and it was amazing! I thought it would be a tiny sandwich but it came out as a huge piled sandwich, which hit the spot! 

This is a perfect spot to start a nice day at the beach, parking is easy and the beach is just across the highway.
author: Gordon O.

description: Very very VERY disappointed in how my mother and my son was treated here today. They were kicked out because my child was being "too loud" for some customers there. My son is two, two year olds are loud and active. Such a shame I thought San Francisco was more open and accepting.
author: Karina F.

description:
I'm still happy with the taste of everything here but I thought what happened today was odd. I ordered and paid for a LARGE white chocolate mocha and received a Regular 16oz size. I asked the 2 people at the register is this a regular or large?? The guy said you are correct it's not a large, then the lady told me the 16oz for a mocha is considered a Large mocha?? WHAT??? Makes no sense and I think she is wrong. Did anyone else order a large and get a regular size? 

Response from owner:
"Hi there,
Thank you for your Yelp.  I apologize for the confusion.
We have 4 sizes small, medium, large and jumbo.  A large is 16oz and a Jumbo is 20oz. (As a point of interest, a regular at most coffee shops is 12oz.)
We recently adjusted the menu and there has been some confusion on the sizing of Iced Drinks.  I want to thank you for shedding light on this matter.  We will correct this as soon as possible.
Thanks so much,
Buffy Maguire
Buffy"

I appreciate her quick response, yes most other places have smaller sizes for "regular" but for less money, but that's not the point I choose to pay more to support a local cafe. What was advertised was, "Regualr" 16 oz and "Large" 20oz, that was what confused me, maybe change the display Large 16oz and Jumbo 20oz.
author: Karen T.

description: For the price and the hype, def not worth it. Food is mediocre but the vibe is pretty chill.  However, this is still not enough to make me give it more that two stars.
author: Nick S.

description:
The muffins.  Sinful.  The toasted bagel sandwiches, the croissants, oh man. Breakfast here is heaven.  The coffee is probably some of the best coffee I've had.  It's strong.  It's delicious.  It gets you MOVING.

And their sandwiches are incredible.  Hot is better, but cold is just as tasty.  Lines are common, parking can be rough, but you circle that damn block until you find a place, get a coffee, and some food.  Thank me later.

This was right on the way to work from my place in outer sunset, and it was hard to pass it without stopping.  It's not cheap.  A coffee, a soup for lunch later, and a veggie bagel would set me back about $10-12.  The soups are hit and miss.  Some are great, some aren't all that good.  Stay away from the bisque types.  I have had poor experiences with those.

All in all, the staff are really chill and friendly, an ATM is inside, a lot of pet lovers around, and great for breakfast or lunch.  Seating can be hard to come by when it's busy, and there's always at least two people taking up an entire table each with a laptop and a backpack just surfing the internet for hours.  **obligatory get off my lawn comment**

And if you're able, try the Guinness Shake.  Holy mother, it's delicious.
author: Hope O.

description: Their coffee is really good! However, their food game for GF items is seriously lacking. For breakfast they have fruit. Otherwise there are GF cookies (which are pricey but pretty good) or perhaps some salads depending on the toppings. Their sandwiches and salads are priiiicey. Overall, definitely worth checking out... also they have wifi :)
author: Megan M.

description: I absolutely love this place! So much so that we came here both Saturday and Sunday to get some work and studying done. Though it can get a bit loud, the vibe is chill, seating is plentiful, and most importantly, there are outlets galore! :) I loved their vanilla latte blended drink, and the sandwiches they serve are pretty good. Alright more important than the outlets - the beach is literally across the street, and they have live music pretty regularly. Doesn't get much better than that!
author: Jamie B.

description: Get the hot chocolate with whip, it is amazing!
author: Sarah S.

description:
Meh is pretty right for this place. Ok the location is good but to order a sandwich at 1200 and still be waiting for it at 1240 in really not good. 

There are so many problems with this place it just isn't funny. By the time you get your food , your coffee is long gone. You're lucky to get a table to enjoy your coffee at while you wait for your food. 
When you get your food, you find it pretty dry but lord, after 40 minutes of waiting, you just aren't going to get anywhere complaining. 

Better to go to the other end of the block and take the wait for the beachside cafe.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
Located way out in the middle of nowhere, it is truly the beacon of self reliance and sustainability for people turning blue from the cold dropping temperatures of Ocean Beach, looking for that final hit of hot liquid so that we can turn the keys in our hand to unlock our cardoors.

The denizens of this place fit in, as do the shodden walls and somewhat weather trodden feeling.  But when I am so cold that my teeth actually chatter, this establishment is as good as any.

I order the usual.

A double cap.  And it warms, to the bone.  I'm not much of a beer person  ;o)
author: Miika M.

description: Excellent sandwiches, huge too! I could only finish half my Kelly's Cove (turkey pesto), which was sooo good. Also serves beers. Lots of seating though they fill up quick. Steps from the beach so you can just get that sammy to go and have a picnic in a pinch!
author: Vivian H.

description: I randomly stopped here because the restaurant I was headed to had already closed. What an awesome surprise, I was serenaded with dinner! Had a wonderful soup and salad. The guy that took my order was not only friendly but very good looking. Doesn't get better than that.
author: Jessi M.

description: Beautiful spot, next to the beach, feels good. I had Java club with turkey and I liked it. It was a big portion and several layers. Sit outside and enjoy your food with the breeze from the ocean !
author: Majid D.

description: Great place! We went here a few times to eat and chill out on our trip to San Francisco. The first time we went because it was close, but we fell in love and went back several times! My husband and I both had The Tsunami sandwich, delish! I also had some great coffee, but they had a Chai Tea Latte to die for!! I would have licked the cup clean if I could've. In the evenings, there was always live entertainment and a fun crowd! It's right across the street from Ocean Beach, so make sure you pop in for a great food, a warming drink, and fun times!
author: DeAnn R.

description: Tasty food, good latte. I personally think the coffee/espresso is a little bitter. But it's very tasty. :) GREAT customer service.
author: Kate B.

description: This is my favorite coffee shop with wifi in San Francisco. I found out about this place when I moved to the Ocean beach. Its location by the ocean, the crowd, the food and the happy vibe here, makes me commute one hour to come here from my new neighborhood. I LOVE this place!
author: Duygu G.

description: Let me start off by saying I used to come here all the time. I loved the location, food, and service. However, over the past year the place has gained in popularity, the prices have increased,  and its pretty difficult to find a place to sit.
author: Lisa E.

description: If I lived locally by here, I could definitely be a regular.  As it is, we were on the coast, heading south from Golden Gate park at lunch time and looking for a local quick bite.  Java Beach Cafe came us nearby as recommended, and it turned out to be a great choice.  It was a Monday, and I actually got a street parking spot right across from the cafe - score!  Inside is a cozy, laid back surfer vibe.  Quite enjoyable.  But the sandwiches cinched it.  They were huge.  They were tasty.  I only wish the previous bathroom patron hadn't spent 15 minutes polluting the air.  Ugh.  Anyway, a simple review - for a simple but good good place.
author: Doug M.

description: I am a local so it is convenient for me to go to this cafe, HOWEVER they get my order wrong in some way every damn time! I am not fussy and will eat practically anything but people...I don't want mayo on my sandwich or onions or mustard. Listen to me when I am ordering. REPEAT back my order o clarify what you heard me order. Twice I have gotten a touch of food poisoning after eating their sandwiches. And forget about calling in an order. I have tried to call in an order for pick up, they put me on hold and I ended up driving down with my cell phone on speaker, standing in line and when I was in the front of the line, said, "Hey, the person on hold....THAT'S ME! You can hang up the damn phone now for my telephone order!" Get it the hell together people!
author: thea v.

description:
Great place.  Amazing food.  They have music on certain nights (not sure which ones).  We are moving out of SF and I am going to miss this place.  We can walk here from our apartment right now...

OB's hot sub is great.
author: Jeff W.

description: This place is super cute. Great tea selections and pastries. Away from all the usual SF tourism. Love the atmosphere, the outside patio is a great place to enjoy a coffee.
author: Beth R.

description:
Definitely one of the most reputable cafes in the entire sunset ~ a nice local gathering spot with pretty good coffee & eats - their sandwiches on dutch crunch look killer (didn't try, just looked on at other peoples' tables)!!

One thing I really appreciate also about Java Beach is the fact that they offer a 10 oz size cafe drink - a nice, slightly smaller alternative to a 12 oz, yet not as small as an 8 oz where you feel like you only get two sips of the drink! In my book, a 10 oz double latte is the right espresso to milk ratio - I HATE a weak latte!! 

Now that we're having nice weather in SF, i may be making more ocean beach runs & stopping in here!
author: Shannon R.

description: Lovely cafe near ocean beach with surfer dude vibe. Nice latte and excellent lox bagel. Sidewalk seating on a sunny January morning made for a lovely respite after fort funston walk.
author: Brad B.

description:
How do you not love a place right by the beach with great food, coffee drinks, and beers on tap! I love going here with friends to grab lunch. When the weather is nice this place is packed! For that matter this place usually has people in there. They have wifi and I always dream about doing work there but whenever I go with my laptop I never get an open table :( 

The sandwiches make up for the no tables. Any sandwich on their dutch crunch is worth the inconvenience!
author: Sandhya R.

description:
You're probably wondering why you'd be out here at the end of the line on the West coast, but this would be my go-to spot for a great lunch on a sunny Saturday, if you need something quick after work, or if you need to pack something for a great picnic in the park.

Let me start off by saying: Get the Hot O.B. Sub. Hands down an amazing sandwich.  It's a warm sandwich, with toasted bread, several layers of delicious sliced meat, melted cheese, and fresh vegetables on it. There's a great sauce on it, which I think is only an italian style dressing, but I'm not particularly sure. I typically get salami and provolone with everything but jalapeños on it, which something I HIGHLY suggest.

Coffees are typical, not the best or worst in the area. I do enjoy the Caramel Latte, which is just delicious. I add a scoop of brown sugar to make it a bit sweeter, but it's already sweet as it is. 

If you're looking for breakfast, I'd suggest the Pesto Bagel or the Hummus Bagel, both delicious and will make your breath smell like onions for hours. Something so tasty must have downfall, right?

The cafe is pretty small and compact in terms of seating inside. I love that there's outdoor seating, but it tends to be too cold to be out there sometimes. There's FREE WIFI, which is amazing! I can get work done and have lunch at the same time. That's a plus. But I guess a negative could be that there could be a long line on the weekends depending on when you go. Sometimes it's out the door! Either way, they're pretty quick, and I absolutely LOVE that they announce your name with a "Please!" at the end when it's ready.

"Andrew, please!"
author: Andrew T.

description:
Nothing too special about this place.  Its not a tourist trap, so I'll give it that. But the coffee is nothing to write home about and the "free wifi" has no good connection. So good luck trying to use it. 
Also, credit cards have a 5$ minimum fee. 
But it is conveniently close to the beach and offers nice outdoor seating.
author: Laura D.

description:
Oh Java Java, Oh how I love you!?! 

It was love at first sight!
The kind of crush where you look at him/her all dreamy-eyed and think he/she is the coolest cat around. 

So this is how our love affair began:
One day on my way to work I stopped in here and grabbed a Kick-a** sandwich the size of my forearm for 7 bucks made EXACTLY the way I like it. 
*Java caught my eye.

The infatuation continued after a 12 hour night shift, when my roomie and I pulled up a couple of bar stools, vented about work and polished off a few drafts before 9am in our scrubs.
 *Java made my heart sing. 

The next day I showed up with my hangover hat & dark glasses just to hit their ATM & get change for my laundry.
*Java stands by me.

Lastly, on a happy, sunny afternoon I swung by for a chocolate flavored frozen mocha and chatted up a 70 something year old man about Charles Dickens.
*Java keeps me interested. 


Please don't steal my Java away but when you come to visit, know that this place has everything one could ever want. This was the master-mind idea that so many coffee houses missed.....a bar-cafe that serves OUTSTANDING food & randomly has live music. The atmosphere is cheerful & comfy.  They are across the street from the BEACH, a block from my current home and they have outside seating. 

Yes, the place gets crowded frequently with a line that stretches outside the door....but I don't care. I love my Java. If you're in a hurry, go somewhere else. 

Java Love!
author: Barbara D.

description: Great for sunday morning.. Read a book and enjoy their espresso
author: Bonnie W.

description: Got a salad from here. The service is nice and friendly. The salad is okay. Nice location. I walked over to the beach afterwards on a super sunny day.
author: Nona T.

description:
Great sandwiches, friendly service and walking distance from home. 

*tsunami and club sandwiches are a must.
author: Wei W.

description:
We ordered coffee, which was okay but nothing special.  Go up the street for Trouble Cafe for better.  We also ordered a sandwich, which is the reason for this review.

When we showed up there were about 4 other parties waiting for their sandwiches.  Some people were getting angry.  3 bikers said Forget It and left.  After 25 minutes, we asked where our sandwich was.  It's coming, they're backlogged.  No apology.  Nothing. 35 minutes into waiting, I'm shivering outside because my coffee is long gone.  I walk in and ask where our sandwich is.  There are 2 parties ahead of us.

I ask for a refund.  The cashier doesn't apologize, she says, "Uh, what?"  I tell her I want my money back.  There's no way I'm waiting 45 minutes for a sandwich and paying.  I get my money back after she runs to the back, gets a manager's initials, and comes back out.  No apology.  Manager? Nowhere to be seen.  

Would I come back here?  Not a chance in hell.  I've had better service in third world countries and honestly there are better, more friendly businesses up the street.
author: D. T.

description:
A quick way to offend a consistent and regular customer who purchases a very reliable amount of food and beverages:

Walk up to them and ask them whether they have bought anything yet.

Then comment to them that you need them to buy something.

If I wasn't a regular, I'd get it.

If this person didn't know my name, I'd get it.

If this person hadn't taken my order countless times, again, I'd get it.

However, this person knew my name, has taken my order countless times, knows that I order more than the $2 cup of tea and is aware that I regularly "consume" at Java Beach Cafe.  What she may not know, but others do, is that I often make purchases at Java Beach at the Zoo, that I frequently grab dinner type food at Ocean Beach and I likely do one or the other of these things at about the rate of 2 times a day.

My comment to Java Beach - think about this and suggest to your supervisors that offending the regulars is not good for repeat business.



Update: Don't bother trying to email the owners at info@javabeachcafe.com - the email address is rejected immediately because of quota problems on the email account that receives info.
author: John-Michael S.

description:
Got the veggie sandwich on ciabatta and some kinda blah blah coffee. I was expecting a long wait so i got the coffee to pass the time. The coffee was the worst i've had in a very long time. The sandwich was ready alot quicker than I expected and took it to go. Walked up to 47th and noticed someone hit my new car and destroyed the bumper. Sweet baby jesus the cussing started and I threw the sandwich in the street in a blind rage.

After sitting on the curb for 10 minutes staring at the bumper full of hate, I see my sandwich a few feet away. So, being a strict believer in the 5 second rule, i pick it up, dust it off and commence eating it. I mean, how dirty could 47th really be?

It was pretty tasty.
author: Grrlgenius M.

description: Nice little cafe located a stones throw from ocean beach, a world away from the grime of the city. It has a real community feel and is quite popular with the laptop crowd, so it does get packed. Good food and service here, and they feature live music on Thursday and Saturday evening. The outside wood hutch seating is a good bet when it gets crowded inside. Enjoy the sunset!
author: David B.

description:
Delicious Pastries! Fun beach atmosphere! They make the cutest designs in the drinks and all of the staff was friendly. 

The Blueberry Muffin with Sugar on top was amazing!
author: Katie K.

description: It's a really cute place with one of the best sandwiches I've ever had! I got the Java Club and it was so good! You should definitely come here for a good sandwich, it's worth it!
author: Joey D.

description: I've been here twice so far and I like it! My boyfriend and I usually get sandwiches to go and eat it at ocean beach. I like how they not only have sandwiches, but also bagels, salads and coffee. I've tried their BBQ chicken and Kelly's cove sandwiches, which I enjoyed with a side of chips. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Rachel B.

description: Friendly staff, yummy coffee and pastries. I was only here for a short time but the coffee (white chocolate mocha) was definitely worth it! Yum!
author: Erica Z.

description: Stumbled into this place while looking for beach cafe lol. Thought it was odd that the menu didn't look like the yelp pictures. Lots of pastries and bagels but their forte is coffee. I loved how they charge by the cup and not drink type. This place seems more like an Irish pub than coffee house. In fact their is a mini bar at the back with about 5-6 Irish beers n
author: Cee B.

description: Ordered a brewed coffee & a sesame seed bagel toasted w/ pesto cream cheese, then headed straight to the beach.  Mmmmm so warm and satisfying.  Just perfect. Eating bagels on the beach= life.
author: Holly C.

description:
Here's the skinny. Pull up a chair and read. 

Java Beach is the original beach cafe in this area and still reigns supreme as the best "meet up for a cup of coffee" place in the Outer Sunset. Everyone else can put their hands down. 

I've lived in the area for 11 years, watched new coffee places sprout up, tried them, and found myself unimpressed with overall service and vibe. What I loved about this beach nook was it's unassuming, quiet energy. You can actually call this home, as opposed to a place where you rent. You know your neighbors and the shop owners.  That is being changed by the new self-important, hipster businesses. 

Being "hip" has come to mean treating customers as inconveniences; the staff at the new places in the area give the impression that they couldn't care less about your business, but damn they're awfully concerned about their clothes, hair, and tattoos. And hey--I like tattoos, but not with an a-hole attitude when I'm giving you my money. I was barked at by the crazy owner of Trouble the first time I went in for standing inside with my coffee for too long: "This isn't a hangout kind of coffee shop!"--I was there for all of 10 minutes when no one else was in there. I'm not kidding. WTF? Who  treats their customers that way? Of course, like any normal customer, I never went back. 

At Java Beach, I've always been met with a courteous counter person who seems to know that an important aspect of their job is to greet the customers. The coffee is what coffee should be; flavorful and hot--nothing exotic that you have to wait 15 minutes for. Plenty of tea selections and lots of baked goods and meal items--reasonably priced and tasty.  I used to love their toasted Italian sub with provolone and hots (gawd, drooling thinking about it), but since giving up meat I now enjoy a savory tuna salad sammich. :) The bran muffins are delish--with coconut and raisins, they are super chewy and HUGE. The oatmeal cookies are pretty stunning, too. Never been disappointed by any item off the menu, really.

There is ample seating both inside and out, and if you feel the need for an afternoon beer, there are many on tap at the traditional style bar off to the side (I prefer a Black and Tan or Guinness). There is wifi and they don't hassle you for patronizing their business--because who would do that?  Whenever I have an Outer Sunset meet up, we hang at Java Beach. 

It should be said that the owners, Pat and Buffy, are two of the nicest business owners in the neighborhood. They are locals who have always respected, supported, and given back to the community, by hosting block parties, beach clean-ups, and landscaping less than attractive parts of lower great highway into lush mini parks, that don't require building parklets in the street. Yeah, parklet--nice in theory, but at night, when no one is using them-- including the homeless because there's no comfortable place to lie down-- we locals are still trying to park our cars, thanks. I've seen the owner of Trouble park her freaking Vanagon on the sidewalk at night when she can't find a spot. I guess she doesn't know we actually have a couple of local wheelchair users. She also double parks it on Judah. Good thing we have that parklet now... Java Beach thrives without taking away from the mellow local beach vibe, which is definitely being drained. They have always been kind to and supportive of local musicians, artisans, other businesses, their customers, and the good-hearted public servants that call the sunset home. 

Java Beach is a classy coffee shop that serves its hardworking, beach demographic well. Bang for your buck, filling, and yummy, courteous, spacious. No bizarre menus, no obnoxious pretense. An Outer Sunset institution that deserves your business. Period.
author: Caliope S.

description: One of my favorite, simple not pretentious coffee shops. I live only 10 mins away and the occasion I need to do some work on the weekend you'll find me here slaving away. Sandwiches are simple, coffee taste good and it's a perfect location for a quick meet up or first time coffee date.
author: Antonio I.

description: I am just sitting here chilling watching every person'a face light up like it's Christmas morning when they hear their order come up. One woman actually just yelled "YES!" And did a fist pump. This is an accurate depiction of my feelings as well.
author: Cassie B.

description:
So I'm going to jump on the hipper than thou bandwagon and say this place used to be a lot cooler a few years ago. I remember the good ol' days when you could roll up to Java Beach, actually get a seat and get your order in under 10 minutes.

Maybe this was when I was young and idealistic and didn't know any better, but I remember this place being a lot less crowded. And really, when all I want is a place to sit with a bagel and some coffee, I don't want crazy crowded, all I want is a seat.

Since I have moved to the Outer Sunset, I try to come to Java Beach as a local, but the line and crowd always trumps my interest in staying. I mean, I don't want to pan a place for being popular, and in many ways getting the popularity it deserves, but for CHRISTSAKE CAN'T A GIRL GET A SEAT!

Now I just walk up, survey the line and assess the situation. It often means taking it to go and sitting on the beach (not bad at all, pretty awesome if I do say so myself), or taking it back to my apartment. 

So, all in all, good food, ok coffee, crazy lines.
author: Liz I.

description: Cozy coffee shop, nice place to grab a drink do homework or read. Only gripe is I always seem to get a sticky or dirty table.. Wipe down the inside and outside tables more often and it's a 5!
author: Legendary W.

description: I had a 3-cheese melt and a tomato pesto mozz melt, both were so delicious!  The french roll was so good.  I'm already plotting what to order on my next visit.
author: Jessica N.

description: This shop has been a mainstay for me for many years! Great coffee and super friendly people! -Neil
author: DarkAngels P.

description: I. Enjoy the coffe and th tisunami sandwich  the good weather and the wooden surf board shaped tables friendly stuff. Always brings a good vibe making me always have a good time there .
author: Western Window E Gutter E.

description: This was a surprise find for me. My friend and I stayed at an airbnb a couple blocks away. Cozy place with live music. I'm still tickled by how their espresso drinks have such a strong almond flavor. This place definitely adds to the neighborhood.
author: Gene L.

description: We went there after a hike to get refreshed. When we entered, we noticed that there was live music. It was really crowded inside but everyone seemed to be enjoying their time. We ordered sandwiches and decided to stay since ambiance was very vibrant. I recommend this place to others
author: Heidi U.

description:
nice neighborhood cafe with great selections of food and beverages. 
outdoor seating is also a plus on a sunny day.
My usual orders is Stacy's Mexican Salad
simple but addictive to me
lettuce, black beans, corn, cherry tomatos, cheese and a diner bread 

free wifi, spacious seating
grab a coffee and small bite and read...so chill and so enjoyable
author: JustinE Y.

description: Great place for coffee and meals. I got a coconut latte with espresso and a veggie bagel, all were amazing !!I'll be back there again and take a picture to show you !!
author: Nick M.

description: Coffee is phenomenal. The staff is always incredibly friendly and the atmosphere inside is awesome. I've wandered in numerous times at night and there will be bands playing, music blaring, and good times to be had. Oh yeah, and they serve beer!!! Enough said.
author: Kelly B.

description:
I love Java Beach. 

Not only is it the perfect place to hang out on a nice day with great outdoor seating and sunny indoor seating, but the food and the service are awesome. 
Sometimes I'll head down there just for the chips that they serve with all the sandwiches. Which, by the way, are absolutely fantastic - thick, crispy, golden and perfect.
Recently I ordered a tuna salad sandwich without the bread (being gluten-free and all) which usually just kinda turns it into a tuna salad, but they made me little tuna lettuce wraps which totally made my day. It's really nice to see a busy place go the extra mile for its patrons. 

Oh, and to top it all off, they serve Magners AND Barry's tea. One time I asked for Irish Breakfast tea and I can't tell you how excited I was when the cashier asked if I wanted Irish Breakfast tea or Barry's tea. I love Barry's tea. And Java Beach.
author: Maggie F.

description:
With the atmosphere of a bustling college study hall, where the diligent are the minority and all sorts of business like nutritionist appointments and salacious girltalk is conducted, Java Beach Cafe provides the ultimate casual backdrop for those looking for a deafeningly silent library alternative.  

The cozy seating offers ample opportunity for accidental and subsequently intentional eavesdropping, and it is not rare for a neighboring stranger to contribute feedback amidst a previously private conversation. Adding also to the positive vibe exuded by friendly patrons and reassuringly crooked hung pictures are window-side tables bathed in waves of soft light courtesy of sunsets peeking just above the ocean outside. 

Be warned of spotty wifi, exorbitant Italian soda pricing, limited indoor seating, and endless distractions, but JBC can very well be your awaited go-to study spot!
author: Andrew M.

description: Amazing. Food, espresso, atmosphere, pricing, location by the beach, free wi-fi. I literally can't think of anything more I'd want out of a coffee shop.
author: Sonya I.

description: Be patient for a table. It's worth the wait if you're looking for a chill, laid back place to eat/work.
author: Rae B.

description:
How can you not love a cafe next to a beach?

This place serves great coffee, great pastries, and good sandwiches.  Is it the best I've ever had and would I drive out here just to eat?  Not necessarily.  Am I walking near the beach or having a casual brunch with a friend?  Then yes!  Come here and eat, chill, and just enjoy one of the rare beautiful days out in the sunset.

Chicken sandwiches are HUGE.  I really think they gave me a full chicken breast.  Giants sandwich and side of Ruffles will probably be about $8 bucks.  Add a coffee and you've just had a lovely meal for about $10 bucks.

The only downer is that there's usually a line and the seating outdoors is limited.  Best to go early or not on such a busy afternoon.  But if you're just strolling through, grab a coffee and muffin to go and enjoy it by the beach.
author: Christine K.

description: We had breakfast here a couple of times - awesome muffins (homemade most likely?) and good coffees. Only disadvantage, we found it a bit pricey, but I'm guessing it's perfectly within SF standards!
author: Marcos G.

description:
I would love to come to this place again. 
We shared a large pastrami & it came with chips. Enjoyed it so much so that I forgot to take a picture of it. 
The price was very reasonable at under $10. 
I liked how the place serves breakfast, lunch, dinner & serves beer. 
There was a line out the door the entire time we ate our lunch. 
After we ate, we went for a walk to the beach.
author: Kristie B.

description: The service is great. I had a chai latte, but it was just okay to me. It's a little small with a beachy feel. Will try again!
author: Jessica S.

description:
A and I were taking a walk on the beach one Sunday morning collecting shells for a project he was doing for work.  Afterward, we were hungry so decided to walk along Judah Street to find a place to eat.  We initially walked by Java Beach to see if there was anywhere else we could find, but everywhere else was super crowded with lines out the door.  So we decided to walk back to Java Beach.  While there were people there, it still wasn't too crowded and we were able to find a table without any problems.  I decided to get a croissanwich - turkey and cheese, I believe.  It's a giant croissant that they toast for you and it was yummy.  A got a humongosaur bran muffin that was as a big as my head.  It looked really healthy.  And no, he didn't finish the whole thing.  He packed it up and took it home with him.  I would've been really surprised if he did finish it though.  

Java Beach is a cool little place by the beach that has cool pastries and sandwiches you can eat.  Nice place to hang out and not too expensive.
author: Kris L.

description: About once a month, I make a pilgrimage out to Ocean Beach.  Just sitting by the ocean cleanses me of dating troubles, work stress or family drama.  Java Beach Cafe has become part of my ritual.  I will stop by to grab a cup of coffee or a pastry before I meander over the Great Highway and plop myself at the bottom of a sand dune.  On cold, foggy days (so common in the summer), I will bring a book and sit inside.  Even then, the area has such an "end of the world" feel that it's enough to wash my troubles away.
author: Seth E.

description: A great neighborhood spot with both indoor and outdoor patio seating, this treasure of the Outer Sunset has been here at the end of the Judah line before the Sunset became the hip place to be. This place is great for morning coffee, lunch or happy hour. They have a nice selection of different coffees (Bernie's Blend is my fav), a long list of hot & cold sandwiches, pastries and a solid list of draft beers and cold drinks. Grab a seat outside, your drink of choice, a bite to eat and just let that cool sea breeze wash away the day.
author: Jared C.

description: PERFECT spot to grab a coffee or a bite before heading to Ocean Beach or Fort Funston to stroll and/or photograph the unbelievable views. The baristas were super friendly and accommodating and the place was busy- but not in an annoying way.  I also enjoyed the veggie sandwich. A++
author: Betta L.

description:
The great thing about this place is that it epitomizes the laid-back small beach town establishment. The funny thing is that this place is in the City of San Francisco and yet you'd never know it. There's nothing like hearing the waves crashing in the background and taking in the sun (which happens a lot more in the Sunset than people think). 

The cafe has free wifi, great sandwiches and delicious drinks. Plenty of outdoor and indoor seating.
author: Rylan C.

description:
Amazing food, especially the whirling dervish and really great and strong coffee drinks. Friendly staff and great sitting area. 

Only thing I would say is that it has been impossible for me lately to find a seat and to log onto their wi-fi.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Cute cafe that serves up sandwiches/salads next to the beach. Lovely outside and inside seating area. Employees are nice and helpful. Their pastries and cookies are yummy and they usually have a boatload of of variety everyday. 

Love their hot subs. The veggie one is fantastic.
author: Jennifer T.

description: A bit over-priced (2.25 for a small coffee) but besides that, super cool place awesome staff, great coffee. Their donuts and croissants are heaven too.
author: Crystal F.

description: Wifi connection is nearly non-existent, it's not a secured network so it's bogged down with non patrons. Other than that is pretty good, but don't come here to work online.
author: Clare M.

description: I like this spot cus it's so convenient - close to my house & the beach & muni. Also, their food is not too shabby. BUT twice already I've come in just for hot chocolate & it's taken almost 10 mins for them to make. Last time I came in only one person was in front of me so it wasn't that busy. Not only that, but both times I've missed my bus waiting for my hot chocolate. Plus, service isn't too friendly.
author: Marie C.

description: This place is totally a neighborhood hang out spot! The atmosphere is comfortable and relaxed. I stopped in and grabbed a cup of coffee and a cookie on my way to the beach and the cookie was amazing and the coffee was solid. The prices are right on and I will definitely be back to try more of there stuff!
author: Trevor D.

description: Not skimpy with their meat. the salmon sunrise bagel and the bonfire delight really hits the spot!!!
author: Nancy W.

description: Fun spot- best blended coffees in town!
author: Laura S.

description:
Don't get me wrong.  I do like this place.  I like the relaxed atmosphere, good coffee, pastry, and sandwich.  I like the fact that they have Wi-Fi.  

I wish, however, they clean up the outside table more often.

Yesterday I went there with my three five years old kids.  There were no seating insie, so we tried to sit out side.  Someone left their plates out, and oh... birds were jumping onto the plates, and stealing left over.  It was very unpleasant.

I told my kids to stay where they are seated, took plates back inside, and tried to set it on the counter.  The busy girl inside shouted at me, saying, "Put dirty dishes inside the tray over there!"  I had to assert that they are not my plates, I have three little kids out side, and I really want to get back out to be with them.  (I was nervous about kids being at out side table, and really wanted to get back out, even though I could still see them from inside.  They were chasing birds on the side walk, and I was afraid that they accidentally step out to the street by following birds.)  She gave me a sarcastic look at me, said, "Thank you." in a rude way to me, as if I were her nuisance, and she eventually cleared the plates.  

I know their job is busy.  But she could still act nicely.  

On the other hand, there was another girl, who kindly brought my order out to my outside table, though usually customers need to come to the inside counter to get their order.  I really appreciated her kind gesture.  

So... there are some nice employees, and not so nice ones....

Well... I guess this is life.
author: M. W.

description: Fun place to hang with your friends, good food and great coffee. If your a sunset original, you won't, mind the cooler day we get, just good old fashion fresh air!
author: Rick P.

description: The service at this neighborhood spot has gone severely downhill- what happened? The last couple of times I've come here it has been nothing short of terrible. Today we ordered a coffee, soup and sandwich to go- took almost 40 minutes to get out of there- they called out an order which was exactly what we had but said it wasn't ours- we inquired a couple of times and 20 minutes later one of the girls says " go ahead and just take that I guess". Soggy cold sandwich and warm "iced" coffee, with crappy attitudes on the side. No thanks.
author: Carolina S.

description: the food is pretty good. the sourdough...DELICIOUS!! the only thing that I wasn't feeling was the guy performing...I dunno, maybe I wasn't in the mood but it was late and there were a lot of old people trying to "vibe" and I dunno, I wanted a more quite and intimate experience next to the ocean.
author: T D.

description: Delicious coffee just a skip from Ocean Beach. Nice selection of draft beer and food. The servers are quick and effecient and friendly. The environment is very laid back and comfortable. There's a great selection of places to sit from bar stools to indoor and outdoor tables. The train stop is literally right out of the front door.
author: Silas F.

description: Great spot to stop by and get some coffee if you are planning to hang out at the beach in the morning. Their staff is welcoming and friendly! The atmosphere is great too
author: Darrell N.

description:
Loved this place! My boyfriend and I had our day off together on a Monday today, and we both decided to drive to the city. Heard about Java Beach from a former co-worker, and since then we've been wanting to visit.

And we finally did! No regrets. Loved the welcoming atmosphere and not to mention... THE FOOD! their coffee and food are reasonably priced, and their quality is well worth every cent. 

I ordered a sandwich called "Bonfire Delight," and it was a dutch crunch roll with roast beef, tomatoes, onions and greens in sesame ginger sauce in it. I paid about $7 for a medium, but don't be fooled with their small. It may look small, but I could've been good with it. I'm happy I got a medium though, cause I'll have something to munch on tomorrow morning at work :)

All in all, we'll definitely be back, and I wish there was a place like Java Beach Cafe near us. :)
author: Rochelle B.

description: After posting my whiny, I haven't had my coffee yet so I'm gonna sound like a doosh 3 star review..... I get an email from the owner of the business apologizing for the bad experience... for one, that totally caught me off guard, two, totally un necessary.... I figure these reviews are, in a nut shell are experiences of people saying they either got something more than they were expecting, or less.... we all read the menu, check out readable details etc, then form a modest expectation and either go for it or not.... I was writing this one I guess to compare the 'local individually owned' vs starbucks... in this case I loved that it was unique, though given that morning i should have stuck to the no frills gimme the damn shot already starbucks.... but I didnt, and I suppose I might of gotten bit a little bit, but truthfully, the place looked cool, a great local beach vibe which speaks to why it was so busy.... I have no doubt 9 out of 10 days this places kicks the silly shit out of any semblance of a comparison to starbucks... so I feel compelled to reply, I'm sorry to sound so whiny (though I did preface, And leave 3 stars) but as a business owner, I would take single review to heart, I would pay attention.... and in this case so does she, and thst speaks volumes to me. Frankly, given I live so close I would gone back, but now it's a promise if for no other reason but to support local businesses.... her attention, her un needed yet greatly appreciated email....priceless. if one needs to make one last comparison to the big chains..it's right there, being listened to....not gonna find that at starbucks.
author: Matt W.

description: After a long day at work, we came here for a quick caffeine fix but wound up staying longer and ordering a sandwich with our caramel lattes, which was fresh and creamy respectively. The soothing music, bubbly servers, and bright and chill atmosphere made it a great place to catch up with a friend. There's also free wifi which made browsing the web convenient. It was such a good idea that others obviously caught on and filled up the patio seating before we even ordered. Being next to the beach made the breeze that much more relaxing. Be wary of when you hit up this place though because high winds mixed with sand can sure ruin your outdoor seating plans.
author: Nathan L.

description:
+2 for the bagels, croissants, sandwiches, pasteries. Workman and good. 

+5 for the hubris/attitude/guile folks wield to get and maintain seating. A lot like an episode of the prison show 'Oz' - only without the great dialog writing or acting. 

Seriously - next time you're in JBC - look for the self-satisfied couch/seat occupyers gloating. You'll feel like you're observing some Stanford experiment-type thing.
author: Mark S. I.

description:
it's an ok place. wifi wouldn't work on my computer though. 

Today there was a dude sitting at a table with his chair absolutely blocking the way for people to access another table. I asked him to move his chair a little and he gave me shade. apparently, asking him to be considerate wasn't reasonable. It's funny how entitled old hippie dudes can sometimes be.
author: stella n.

description:
Kick back bring your book/kindle/ipad/ laptop....and enjoy a cup of Coffee, or even a muffin/ cookie or slice of cake.  ( for those with bigger appetites there is a full menu of delicious salads and sandwiches waiting for you to devour). There's out door seating and a little "sitting flowered bench" area across the street.  Don't want to sit down?  take the coffee to go and you are a few steps away from beautiful Ocean beach.  Dont like sand? Golden Gate park, the windmill play grounds are all but two blocks away. Obviously I love this place. 

I think I just did a free advertising review for them :) 


p.s great place to take a date during the day.
author: Yennie N.

description:
I love this little cafe! 

I recently stayed at the Great Highway Inn for several nights, and this was pretty much the only place to eat nearby that I was aware of. It's right across the street from the beach, and right at the last stop on the Muni (N-line), and easy walking distance from the motel. Even if it wasn't the only place near the motel, I would still go there to eat any time I'm in town.

They have free WiFi and are pretty much always busy, so I would always call ahead and order so my food would be ready when I got there. I always took my food to go because it wasn't easy to find a place to sit at the cafe. 

They had fresh fruit, great sandwiches, and the most amazing cinnamon raisin cookies ever! And the staff was very friendly, too.

I think it will be hard for any other sandwich place to stack up to the Java Beach Cafe, and I'm looking forward to going back again!
author: Suz E.

description:
Delightful cafe with lots to choose from - you'll find everything here and in such a small space! The vibe is great - very San Francisco beach town, mix of locals and visitors makes it interesting to eavesdrop. Get a spicy chai and take it to the dunes across the street.

The server was kind of spacey on taking our order one of the times I was there, but everyone has a bad day so if I'm the only one talking about that, take it with a grain of salt.
author: Kristin H.

description: Cool little spot to grab coffee and a small bite to eat. I had nutella toast with my coffee.  My friend had a turkey sandwich on a croissant roll- to die for! They definitely didn't skimp on the turkey.  The place is pretty tiny so finding a place to sit and hang out would be tough on a busy day. We got there early so we were able to relax and enjoy our food.
author: Kahikina R.

description: Great cafe near the beach right at the end of the muni line. Visited twice one weekend. Had regular coffee one day, which was wonderful- nice, tasty. Came back and had a great late. Coffee had great taste, not burnt or sour as in some places.
author: John A.

description:
I'm not really sure what the appeal is.  I'm not even sure why I come here despite it being the only coffee shop around with wi-fi.  

Staff
-Super friendly, almost overly so but you don't mind because they aren't at all saccharine.  I don't know how they ALL generate the joy and I'm a little scared to find out.

Atmosphere (Granted, I'm only here on weekends or evenings)
-Loud
-Crowded
-Cramped
-Impossible to maneuver to the counter to get your drink/sandwich without pardoning yourself four times and nowhere to stand that's out of the way while others take turns knocking your shoulders and stepping on your toes on the way to retrieve THEIR goods. 

Food
-Sandwiches come with shredded iceberg lettuce and plain potato chips.  Ho-to-the-fuckin'-hum.  It reminds me of going to the decaying A&W drive-in in rural Montana growing up.  Do they have tater tots here, too?
-Standard assortments of refined sugar/flour baked goods.

Drink
-Extra star for serving beer and wine, even if the wine selection is "red" or "white" and there's just a few beer taps.
-Meh mochas.
-No loose tea from what I recall. 

Clientele
-Where do all the yuppies come from?  I can't figure it out. Are they local tourists?  Did they read about this place in the Chronicle? Did they get a "deal"?  It's a steady stream- they get their coffee, have dull conversation for 15 minutes, leave, and are immediately replaced by a facsimile.  
-Lots of runners/cycle folks- spandex and sweat, deftly highlighting middle-aged dudes' junk- but maybe that's a plus for you.
-Fleece.
-Babies.
-Couples who are clearly on their first OKCupid date.  Bring headphones unless you love to vicariously live awkward blind dates through others.  Actual quote: "So...how did you lose that tooth?"
-Some neighborhood locals- chill
-Jerks like me who take up space too long with their laptops, hoping the humans around will motivate them to work instead of procrastinating and writing a yelp review.
author: Marlys B.

description: The hot subs are really good, love the dutch crunch. Also, the staff is incredibly nice.
author: Morris H.

description:
If there's one thing in this world I can get behind, it's owners who are incredibly attentive to the needs of their customers. I had a not-so-great experience here the other day, and when I wrote about it here on Yelp the owners were lightening fast about messaging me personally to apologize. 

I know many of us use Yelp as a place to vent our frustration when we feel we weren't given the service we deserved, with the hope that our voices are heard by these businesses and taken seriously. Most frustrating of all is that it doesn't really seem like businesses care.

Java Beach DOES care. The sheer fact that their owners even bother to read and respond to their reviews speaks volumes about the kind of environment they aim to create, and the integrity of their business. I'm happy to come back and be part of it.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Can't tell if the sandwich was as good as I think it was or was I just so darn hungry.  The medium is much bigger than I needed but I ate it anyway.  

Was staying at Days Inn next to cafe so I didn't have far to go, wasn't familiar with the location but the crowd appears to be very friendly and just chillin waiting or eating! 

If I had a specific complaint it would be how dirty it was.  I own a small taqueria so I know how difficult it is to get stuff caught up on.  But hey, like I said it was good and yummy!
author: Rita B.

description:
The owner reached out to me to understand the reason for my bad experience better and to offer a full refund.

This shows me that the owner really cares and while I may not be a fan of the food here I have respect for a small business owner who aims for making their biz the best they can through interacting with actual customers.

Several stars added for respect, hoping this place only gets better every day - I truly wish yall the best with that
author: Patryk T.

description:
a recent revisit to the Bay led me to the clouds and fog of the Outer Sunset. While many are depressed and few seem to have much encouragement around Ocean Beach, this is a pleasant surprise for anyone. They have one of the tastiest black americanos that I have ever had thanks to great espresso (others seem to disagree, but each of my experiences proved to be great).

A recent update of seating helped create some more space for visitors, with only a slight disruption upon arrival while waiting in line. The outdoors patio is perfect as well, suited well with a pint of  beer or glass of wine around happy hour.

They serve a stellar cold sandwich, but be sure to try out one of their specialties, which may include avocado or pesto. Servers are consistent and willing to help out. I have stayed away from the pastries to avoid addiction, but everything looks incredible.
author: Nathan O.

description:
This place is the closest place to Ocean Beach that you can grab a nice warm hot cocoa or a coffee before your beach walk.

It gets super busy on sunny days, and this place has a lot of local flair. 

They have great drink options and everything I've had (including the food) has not disappointed! Very cute, charming place.
author: Theresa B.

description: I came here a few times, and I liked it. It's a very cool spot right next to the beach!! I did not have food, even though I saw it being served and it definitely looks quite good. My rating is based solely on their white chocolate mocha. They have the best I have ever had, and I am a picky coffee-drinker. They do not get a full five-star rating though because I believe they could organize better the order system. We had to wait a while just to pick up a coffee, and since it was crowded it was not easy to stick around to hear them call out names. The coffee though was so worth it!!
author: Dodi G.

description:
Just spent half the day here regrouping after my flight. 
The Mocha was awesome, the Shepherd pie was great, soup was awesome...a bit pricey but worth it. 

Suggestions: lists of ingredients in food like the pies, and maybe free coffee if you buy a latte? But I did just spend like 5 hours here, so I can't complain. I'll be back!
author: Irina S.

description:
They have the best almond milk hot cocoa!

The service is good, the wine is terrible, the wifi works, and it's warm inside.
author: Sarah T.

description: Good coffee but if you get an espresso drink it will be a wait. Simple breakfast food bagels & pastries. Always crowded w yuppies on laptops so don't plan on sitting to eat. Go to the beach across the street instead. Sandwiches are excellent and the staff is mostly nice. Takes credit cards!
author: Kalie J.

description: First time visit this past weekend. I ordered the grilled apple cheddar sandwich. I've never had a grilled sandwich served as an opened faced sandwich, but decided to taste it.  The worst! Never ordering that again.
author: Tyra B.

description:
Java Beach Cafe + sipping on rose hips and peppermint tea + weekend gossip with close friend  = 

the perfect way to spend a Sunday

That is all.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Amazing ambiance. A delicious mix of every type of nationality and style imaginable with deliciously fresh bagels and salads. The fruit cup was like pure sugar cocaine with the sweetest and most ripe selection I've had in San Francisco. The was amazing and very accommodating. A great breakfast and brunch place right on the pacific.
author: Yuliya S.

description:
I'd give Java Beach a lot more stars if it weren't for my unfortunate experience with my small cup of joe. This has never happened to me before... but I filled up a small cup of hazelnut coffee and added the typical sugar and cream. THEN - what came out of it was a foul tasting concoction... no where resembling anything close to the warm toasty flavor I was anticipating!! I was traumatized and don't think I'll be ordering coffee here again. It was a waste of my $1.75. Has this happened to anyone else? Maybe the half&half went bad? Or hazelnut and half&half is just a plain no-no...

But it was crowded with all sorts of people on their laptops, or catching up over a cup of coffee, or just enjoying something hot (it was i, i swear, like 59 degrees outside and the winds blowing). I'm going to come back and try some of those baked goods they had taunting me in the case. Same goes with the sandwiches!

See you soon Java Beach Cafe!
author: Samantha L.

description:
Great place. We were relieved to find them open and still serving food until 11PM. Friendly service. The sandwiches were alright, the soup was excellent. If I went back I think I'd get a full bowl of soup instead of the cup; it was really tasty. Nice atmosphere.

I put not good for groups because inside seems more suited to 1-3 persons; the outdoor seating is probably better if you have a larger group.
author: Amanda B.

description: I ordered the Java Club and it was huge! I got two meals out of it. It has 3 slices of bread, with 6 slices of turkey, avocado, bacon, and either chips or salad. I went with the salad, and the dressing was mostly olive oil, sadly. The ingredients were really fresh and it was all tasty. There was a line, and a wait, but wifi and friendly service.
author: Collin P.

description: This cafe has a perfect laid back beach vibe,  with good coffee and snacks. I always get their lemonade or vanilla ice cream cone after a day at the beach. They have cute outdoor seating that's perfect for lounging around or visiting with friends.
author: Katie P.

description: Super cute with a great menu! Only had coffee's and mochas while waiting for brunch at Outerlands but the service was so nice and friendly! Loved the local vibe here and can't wait to come back to this cozy place to get some work done or try their lunch menu.
author: Alexis T.

description:
Java Beach Cafe: The quintessential beachy neighborhood spot, where surfers, tourists, locals, kids, and dogs unite. 

I highly recommend the hot veggie sandwich and toasted cheese croissant. They have an excellent selection of hot tea if you're not in the mood for coffee. If you're a cheese freak like me, you can also order a grilled cheese sandwich, which is actually not on the menu, but they'll make it anyway. 

One of these days, I'll actually try one of the delicious jumbo muffins on display. (My mind is telling me no, but my saliva is telling me yes.)

Any place that offers free wi-fi gets a thumbs up from me. 

Cons: Often overcrowded. Although the coffee is super tasty, it is also overpriced.
author: Gloria B.

description: Came here the other week to work (software developer). Was a little more crowded than I like, but they finally fixed their WiFi so it's much faster and stable! Probably not a good place to go to work on the weekends as it's PACKED with people that go the the beach to enjoy their weekends.
author: Vincent S.

description: Found this place after a Sunday run along the Great Highway and Ocean Beach. Nice outdoor patio and dog friendly, couldn't ask for a better location. I was impressed with all the veggie options. I finally decided on the 'Hot Veggie' which was deeeelicious. Already planning my next run and post run meal at Java Beach Cafe with the doggies :)
author: Anna S.

description: This place has GREAT sandwiches! Seriously, really good sandwiches and super clean with fresh greens.Excellent customer service! Coffee is meh, I've had better but the sandwiches make up for it. I always get mine to go and get a coffee at Beachside (same owners) while my sandwich is being made.
author: S. C.

description:
I was here to grab a coffee after a run on a busy Sunday afternoon.

I walked in and stood in line behind two other customers. There were people coming in after me. Almost all the seating was taken, and I had to ask a studying student if I could sit next to her. Later, I migrated to my own booth seat to catch up on reading Economics; waiting for a free seat was a pain.

The ambiance was nice though. Java Beach Cafe was what a stereotypical coffee shop is portrayed to be like. It was busy, with different crowds. People were either students aiming to study, chatting beachgoers, or people in passing. 

If you plan to go there, make sure you set up booth earlier in the day, especially on a sunny day.
author: Lily Z.

description:
Java Beach Cafe may have a cozy ambiance and mouth-watering sandwiches, but that all begins to taste a little sour once the folks who work there open their mouths.

When I requested dutch crunch on my sandwich, I was met with a surly look and a sigh. Despite ordering my sandwich with "The Works", it showed up with only a couple of lonely jalapenos and a swab of mustard. I decided not to push the issue of the lack of lettuce, tomatoes, and well everything else that makes a sandwich delicious, but did ask for a bit of mayo to help it all go down a bit easier. The chic couldn't have been more annoyed. Finally, when I asked for a box to take home my half-eaten poorly-made sandwich, the gal behind the counter looked at me like I had just asked her to hand over a hundred bucks. She then decided to give me a flimsy, wax paper pastry bag instead. Seriously? 

I'm not usually much of a complainer, but this was too much to stomach. I may have made a lot of requests, but if they could summon the will to do their job, maybe I wouldn't have to.
author: Jordan W.

description:
Really yummy chicken ceasar salad! I would say their prices are decent since it is a huge salad, and in my opinion it is well worth it (about $10).  I normally sit at the bar and enjoy my lunch and see tons of people in & out of this place during the half hour - hour it takes me to eat as much as I can before asking for a container (did I mention this is a really big salad?!). Also; I hear rave reviews from my friend who 1st took me here, about their mochas being amazing and the whip cream is homemade! I am not big on the extra calories or I may have had one, but the salad is great, staff is friendly and the atmosphere is decent. I say give it a go!

4 stars!
author: Bella B.

description:
I like this place, The girls who work here are always so nice and friendly. It is comfy inside and they have sweet music too. Bernies Blend is the best coffee!!! I also like that they serve beer and wine. Sometimes it is a bit too crowded and some ppl suck at ordering and stare at the menu and just say , "ugh...is that with reduced fat cream cheese or nonfat...".
It is not too expensive, just more expensive than the chinese donut place, or starbucks. 
worth it.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
I ordered a turkey ham sandwich on a dutch crunch roll and a cup of coffee. The coffee wasn't nearly bold enough, and the sandwich, though crunchy, did not meet my expectations. its really not that hard to get an excellent rating when it comes to sandwiches. Even I can make a screaming 5 star sandwich given the right amount of materials and an oven. at 9 dollars a large sandwich, one can get a much better sandwich elsewhere at Roxys, Lou's, AK sandwich, etc quite close nearby. 

The turkey ham sandwich, though bountiful in ingredients, lacked flavor. The dutch crunch roll was really delicious, but the ingredients were bland and dull. Although it wasn't messy due to the strong structure of the dutch crunch, it just wasn't very memorable or noteworthy. 3 stars.
author: simon k.

description: Java Beach is a neat little cafe right near the ocean. It's not only a coffee shop, but they also serve sandwiches, breakfast foods, salads, and most importantly, they have delicious craft draft beer! We were going to visit the beach and my friend wanted a coffee, so we sat down in a somewhat crowded area full of chitchat and the clicking of laptop keys and enjoyed some refreshments before hitting the beach. My friend had a coffee and a ham and cheese croissant sandwich, and since I wasn't hungry at the time, I indulged in a draft IPA. Java Beach has a cool vibe to it. It's laidback, not all that pretentious feeling, and has outdoor seating that overlooks the ocean. You really can't beat drinking a coffee outside with great company feeling the ocean breeze hitting you. If you're in the area, this is surely worth a visit.
author: Bodie S.

description:
I came here one night to study and it was okay.  It was fairly small. Although they have great wifi that is pretty fast and they're menu isn't too overprice.

I don't know if I came on the wrong night or what but they had live music, it was good but not suitable for studying. Although, they say it's not every night.

I would probably give them another try on a different night.
author: Mimi P.

description:
During the years I lived in San Francisco this cafe was by far my favorite haunt. I'd spend all day at the beach, then cross over the great highway in the evenings to warm up here. I'd buy a black coffee and a guinness, then spend several hours sketching. The best thing about Java Beach is their beer on tap. Coffee is good, beer is grand. 
The food is decent as well. I LOVE the veggie sandwiches. I also loved the mozzarella pesto melt. What else? Oh- the tea is fantastic. 

It is the vibe that makes this place what it is though. The staff is warm, and they always recognize the locals (I was definitely one of those after a while). I haven't been back in ages, but I hope it is still the same!
author: Ruth R.

description: The place has everything you need. Fresh sandwiches, great espresso, bagels, you name it they got it! Always feel welcome here and love to sit outside when the sun is out. Relaxed atmosphere and free wifi without needing a password.
author: William H.

description:
Java Beach has good sandwiches and baked goods, but the coffee leaves much to be desired.

I love the Turkey on Multigrain, however it is a bit spendy for what you get.

The staff is always friendly and it never takes more than a few minutes for my sandwich to be ready.

This place is a gathering place for the neighborhood so avoid it on weekend mornings like the plague.  It also takes a long time for coffee orders to be ready which is fine since I don't like their coffee at all.
author: Andy Z.

description: Great sandwiches with salt and vinegar chips which I always enjoy. I pick up a latte every time I come by and Im never disappointed.
author: Matt B.

description:
The coffee and toast were good but not as good as Trouble Coffee Co. down the street, however the seating options are nice (indoor & outdoor) and they have many food choices.  The sandwiches looked very good.

It is supposed to have free wi-fi, but it wasn't working the 1.5 hours I was there which was disappointing.
author: Christy L.

description:
I can tell this place its a staple in the neighborhood and when the weather is nice by the beach this is a great local café where you can get some fresh and hearty brunch.

Here are my high and lows:

High: the tsunami sub sandwich is awesome if you're a fan of the original italian torpedo sub

Low: they use way tooooo much cream cheese on their bagels....let's be honest, nobody likes them with that much schmear!
author: Philip H.

description: This place is soo yummy! They serve wine, which I thought was cool. Try the Tsunami sandwich on Dutch crunch! And the curried soup! Delicious. Good coffee, too. The location is right near the beach. The staff is friendly. Free wifi! Would recommend.
author: B L.

description: Morning coffee and a pastry, and then a nice walk by the beach. A+. Also, grateful for the songwriters they feature here. Cheers!
author: Jeff D.

description:
Let's be honest, some days it takes only about 15 minutes on the beach before you're teetering on the brink of hypothermia-induced death. So why not duck into a cafe for a quick caffeine warm-up? 

Steer clear of other hipster-infested joints, and settle into the Java Beach Cafe. Take your time sipping some hot liquid, maybe indulge in one of their enormous (and delicious!) sandwiches, and just generally enjoy the laid-back vibe as a perfect end to your beach day. Great place to bring out-of-towners too; fill their stomaches with good food then blow their minds with a big Pacific sunset!
author: Em B.

description: I love the atmosphere of this place, especially on a calmer weekday. It's also a great place to people-watch because the customers are always eclectic, ranging from surfers to students to writers to women wearing bird-watching hats. Honestly, the coffee isn't anything exceptionally unique or spectacular, but their sandwiches are solid and the coffee is good. I don't personally recommend the chai; it's kinda lacking in flavor. But all in all, I adore this neighborhood spot for its ambiance and feel good vibes! A great place to study/work or have an intimate convo with a buddy.
author: Diane G.

description: The kind owner is working on the issue I raised and yes, it is hard at times to have a choice location at the beach and manage some of the challenging behavior that the beach draws.
author: Rachelle B.

description: Java Beach House, I can't get enough of your smooth and perfect coffee! It doesn't hurt that your location is close to the beach and that you have that  neighborhood friendliness factor down. Others may rave about Blue Bottle or Philz, but you are my shining star for a perfect cup o java!
author: Marilyn Y.

description:
"you want a cofee? cool. I'll go for a beer. and its just a block away"

Ok cofee. Beers a block away from the house. No complaints. Unless its too crowded and there's no seats. One of the last times i was hanging out here with a friend someone gave us their untouched pitcher of Stella - not to brag or anything.
author: Oleg H.

description:
Alright everyone, I'm kicking off my return to Yelp (just finished producing CFS2011 -- and its kept me from being up in the Yelposphere!) with a 5-star of my new favorite coffee shop!

This place has got amazing food, amazing coffee, and an even more amazing vibe. Bustling with a low-key SF crowd that is grabbing a drink or bite, this place is almost always packed. The baristas are super nice, know customer's names by heart, and are rapidly efficient. 

Also, its right by the beach. With ample parking. And reasonable prices. And I love me some coffee, so we all know its hard for my espresso-craving self to ever hate those that provide it to me...

5 Stars. And a huge welcome back to myself. :)
author: Thom S.

description:
Ok so the owner wrote me and apologized for the issues I was talking about. I'm not sure if my review had anything to do with it, but since then the points i mentioned have improved. 

bravo for listening to customers and attempting to work things out. 

thanks Java!!
author: Justin A.

description: This place is focused on locals.  Locals who seem to grab a cup of coffee and a table to enjoy the free wi-fi.  This place was so crowded that people who were ordering food couldn't sit to eat it.  Also, the food was bad.  A tomato, basil, and mozzarella sandwich should not have cream cheese on it.  GROSS!
author: JP P.

description: Great place to relax, enjoy the beach view and hang out with the locals!
author: Fanny Z.

description: Fantastic lattes and cappuccinos. I am a Baurista at starbucks and Java Beach set the bar much higher for my drink quality as soon as I had one of their breve single lattes. One Baurista (Miguel) in particular does great latte art and foam. The espresso they use is very nutty and caramel like. The location is nice as well. It's usually quiet and calm besides the muni. Very nice to go on a weekday morning and grab a small bite to eat and sip on a well made drink. 5 stars. No question about it.
author: Aaron R.

description:
Tomato mozzarella pesto melt is my favorite
The Wonder Bar is worth the calories
One of the better dutch crunch rolls I've had
Fair trade cafe
Oregon chai mix
Free wi-fi but too noisy for work
Get a real seat, maybe at the bar, because the couches are too broken in for comfort...
author: Lindsey M.

description:
This is my regular spot for the workday morning's second cup.  First, I just love the location by the beach, at the end of the N Judah line, and the easy, breezy feel of the place, both inside and out.  Yeah, we get too many barefoot types I guess and the sidewalk outside it can get crowded on nice days where the patio is all taken up.  But it rocks!  

The coffee?  Awesome.  Even their pre-brewed options are great and getting a shot added, like a Muddy Water or Depth Charge, makes them even better.  But their single pour cup is really, really fantastic.  It's Guatemalan with hints of chocolate, on the sweet side.  I haven't seen it change in about  a month, but who cares, it's an amazing brew!

I love Lynn and Catherine who are just as pleasant as they should be early on a Monday morning - not articially cheerful but warm and they know you by name!
author: Michael S.

description:
I LOVE this cafe. It's near where I live and I would usually come here with my bestfriend so we'd get our drinks for a sit down chat and take a walk on great highway!

I've gotten some sandwiches, coffee and muffins, but now I stick to chai lattes! 

First off, the service is freaking awesome. They don't try hard, they are not ever bad - they're just really friendly people. First thing you deal with getting a product is the service, and Java Beach cafe on Ocean, will pass with flying colors. 

Their sandwiches are a little pricey, but you can customize your own! Great sandwiches though. When you're almost finished with your drink, it's not cool to see the powder and leftover residue sitting on the bottom of your drink. Java's chai latte and coffee do not have that residue... which is awesome that it's not some fake all powder mix. I had their banana muffin a few times before and they're great, but I love anything banana, bias?  lol yeah.

Price for drinks (depends on what you ordered, steamed milk, chai, coffee, tea etc) range around $4 for a large and around $4.50 - $5 for a jumbo. 
Small is tiny, medium is small, large is medium, and jumbo is large - seriously. But it's worth it!

Get your order and they'll be there within' a few minutes, unless you ordered a sandwich, a lot of things or something really complicated. (not a real long of a wait)

They used to have sofas there instead of the new wooden benches and wooden surfboard-like tables. Glad they changed it! Because it was .. sometimes unsanitary and people stayed there as if they were in their homes, just chillin' away. But yes! The tables, chairs and benches just perfectly fit in and I love it. This place is usually packed. It can be hard to find a seat especially on a nice weather, wait, sorry... actually it's hard to find a seat in the morning and afternoon. Evening after 9, less people. There are seats outside!!!! Inside the place is clean and sanitary, which is good despite them having so many people coming in and out of the cafe. 

If you're in the area or going to the beach near Judah, Beach Chalet, Cliff House - do stop by Java Cafe. It's a really mellow place... and the N Metro train is righttttt next to it. Great for coming back from work, or wherever, and the last stop is 48th, and there's Java!

+ they have performances either friday or saturday nights starting at 7pm from local artists.
author: Jae T.

description: I was in love with this place the moment I stepped in the door.  It had been a long day, I was tired, it was freezing, I just got off the Muni and this place, like a beacon of warm light, beckoned me from afar.  Anyways, I went in and ordered a hot Jasmine tea and sat down on the ridiculously comfy couch they have there.  I pulled out my lap top, enjoyed some free wifi, sipped my hot tea, read, people watched and was just in heaven.  This place totally made my day.  Thank you Java Beach Cafe.
author: Kasumi L.

description:
I use to come here over ten years ago, when it wasn't crazy busy every day. The place has changed into a serious locals hang out spot. I still come here if I want to get out of the house. 

PROS:
FREE WiFi (sometimes doesn't work because there's so many people on it)

Happy hour 5-7pm. Beer only. They have good wine but happy hour doesn't cover it.

Sweetest customer service you'll experience at cafe.

Extremely bad next to dead cell phone reception, doesn't matter what plan. So most people can't hold a conversation on the phone in the cafe next you! You have to go outside and wait for your signal to get a "Can you hear me now?" Yyyyeah! :)

They also have bar seating. Beer on tap!

Their food is good. They have great big salads, soups, delicious sandwiches, and baked goods. 

Strangely always warm and super cozy inside even if it's negative 1 billion Fahrenheit outside.

GIRLS AND BOYS: Good looking fit singles come here. You can get a date easy. But beeee careful and talk it out or get to the point; a hot single guy is often later joined by his cute girlfriend, or the hot single girl you started talking to and making jokes with is often joined later by her boyfriend, and you are doused with lame putz gold immediately. I actually like to watch that happen. That's some damn good entertainment, especially a regular like me, and you know that girl has a bf, and some dude is talking her up, and I'm just waiting for the bf to come later and sit down, and watch that hidden crush of sour disappointment and sudden surprise on the dudes face as he watches the bf hug and kiss the girl and then take his seat. That is better than HBO!

Get a hot drink, and walk across the street to the beach. A tradition of most people: they get a drink leave and watch the sunset.
