TIPS AND TRICKS: Leave the beach immediately after watching the sun go down, because it gets flooded with people who just came from watching the sunset in the cold, and now want a hot drink across the street. My suggestion, if you don't need to see the sunset get there a half hour before the sun starts setting to guarantee your seat. 

CONS:
It gets too crazy busy, and sometimes there's no seating at all, and you have to sit outside in the cold, or not stay at all. Years ago it was never like this. On a sunny day though, outside is seating is great.

If it gets too busy for long period of time, sometimes the staff can get a little short ended with their nerves. Be patient with your orders, it will come, so don't keep asking about it. Always order with a smile, and another smile WILL return to you.

YUPPIES have decided to turn this place into a hang out. There's not too many but it does happen. And of course their conversations are annoying. One yuppie robot was behind me talking really loudly about his reservations for some party, so he can impress everyone who was forced to listen to him...he also had a glass of champagne in his hand. Nothing wrong with having a glass of bubbly, but there can be something wrong with the way you do it. 

Couches are getting worn down and grimy. Time to get new ones Java Beach! New couches at a busy public establishment should be changed at least every few years!
******UPDATE: June 14 2013 ******
They replaced the couches with wooden benches and tables. The cafe can hold even more people! The new seats are not as comfy for long stays, so you may have to sit on your jacket or something. But the place and layout look very nice!
***************


PRO-CON:
San Francisco's weirdos, alternatives, and senior citizen loners are here. Now this can make for many an interesting afternoon conversation, and I've had many here over the years. But the eccentrics, and half bums can also make you want to not make eye contact outside of your own table aura, or to tell someone 'hey stop looking at my laptop screen, my private business is not a conversation piece.' But it is a public cafe, and not your livingroom, and you decided to come here.

PRO-CON:
Live music Thursday-Sunday around 7:30-8pmish to about closing 10:30ish-11. Great music all the time! From folk to bluegrass, to country. This is great if you've come to get out of the house or to grab a drink with a friend. Not so cool if you have to study, listen to something on your laptop, listen to your own music, or work on a music based project, or have some serious work to do. You'll just get frustrated with the loud presence of the band, and leave. This is actually catching on, as I see less and less people coming to study around music nights. 


After you come to Java Beach a handful of times, you'll feel like it's a second home. That comfy local feeling will set in you, and you won't go to other cafes. Come a lot, and you'll see the regulars and make friends. Come a lot a lot, and the baristas will call you by name when you walk in...and you have become a serious local, and for those of you who aren't SF natives, that's as close as a feeling to it that you can g
author: Todd P.

description:
This is probably my favorite down time spot in San Francisco. Conveniently located at the beach and end of the N Judah. Great place to stop by for a delicious toasted sub, bagel with coffee, beer or muffin. I am addicted to their soy vanilla chai's. 

Great comfortable inside and outside seating, great for chillin on a beautiful afternoon or weekend. Even with the SF gloom their couches are a cozy spot to read a book, study, work, relax, or draw. A perfect post-surf spot as well. Love the service, love the crowd, and I love the location. Theres a cute community garden/bench area across the street too.
author: Nicki T.

description:
I haven't been to Java Beach in FOREVER! It's definitely been 5-7 years since the days that we would come here after school, but I have to admit - it's still money.

Today I had the Kelly Cove - turkey and pesto. It was delicious! I practically had to force myself to finish it because I didn't want to waste such a tasty sandwich. All of the sandwiches come with some pretty tasty chips. I don't know anything about the chips, but they were crunchy, yummy, and looked of the homemade variety.

I love the mix of people here as well. Today I saw San Jose Bike Police (supporting the breast cancer walk), older-aged tourists, a group of laptop-clad students, and a couple of surfers. All of the people working today were pleasant. The weather was gorgeous. I enjoyed the outdoor seating and free wi-fi on a nice San Francisco afternoon. 

I would definitely come here again!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Dear Java Beach,

I've been coming here since high school. I love your coffee and your vibe. 

But please, oh PLEASE, quit playing music on the patio. You would instantly gain 3 stars back.
author: shawna v.

description: Every other time I'm here their wi-fi is down.  Coffee's decent.  Their muffins seem to be from CostCo.
author: Craig M.

description:
Love this cute little place and all the people that were there that evening were truly enjoying themselves from the vibe.  The tea selections are plentiful and they have many options, would love to see a few more without caffeine, but thoroughly enjoyed my delicious red lavender. It was perfect and served in a nice big mug!  

We also enjoyed their large gluten-free, vegan brownies. Wish they had more options for us vegan and gluten-frees though.  Would have loved to have a big salad or some other entree that was vegan and gluten-free "as-is" and not have to bother the already very busy counter folks for substitutions.

Loved it but would love more vegan and gluten-free options 
even more and then we would go back much more frequently!
author: Beverly O.

description:
4 stars because I love the option of adding/substituting almond milk to your drink AND their white mocha with almond milk tastes awesome. It easily became a new favorite of mine. Cool that it's open late but it was way too crowded when I went in the afternoon. Everyone with their laptops inside and even a crowd outside! But I can see why the spot is so popular especially on a nice day when you can enjoy yourself outside with the ocean view. 

I'll be back for sure.
author: Valerie E.

description: I really want to like this place. Really. With the location alone I would rate this place 5 stars, however, with an unfriendly staff, mediocre coffee, and overpriced food I will not be back. Not only does the staff not engage with the customers, they act like the customer should be there to serve them. They do not fully listen to what the client wants and act like they're too busy to even smile.
author: Jillian M.

description:
I got a tip for Bruce Weber: cast your next ad here. You're welcome Bruce. 

The coffee is great, the bagels are very very good, the wifi is free, the ocean is near, the staff is a friendly bunch, the pretension level is low. 

Java Beach is my new favorite place. That's me in the corner, finding my religion.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
In a seemingly barren and lifeless neighborhood, Java Beach shines as a beacon for sandwich lovers and coffee enthusiasts. As one of the main hubs of energy in the Outer Sunset, JB can make even the foggiest day bearable, and even cozy.
 
Limited space is definitely an issue, but sometimes works out for the best, as complete strangers exchange pleasantries and engage in conversation, whilst sharing questionably close quarters on their aged, comfy couches.
 
The staff is always friendly, and noticeably hardworking (especially Debbie); laughter bellowing from the behind the bar is not an uncommon occurrence. Even walking past JB on the way to surf at OB brings about a wealth of warm memories. This place is another subtle reminder of the beauty of the highly underrated Outer Sunset district.
author: William H.

description: Great location next to the beach, at the end of the N Judah train line. Good food, coffee, beer. They have live music certain nights of the week.
author: Jeff F.

description:
The name of this place sounds like the hangout in one of those 1960's Frankie Avalon-Annette Funicello beach movies where he gets mad at her for not going to second base. Then out of the blue, Little Stevie Wonder (all of 11) comes out to sing "Fingertips", and everybody claps their hands with the rhythm.

I only come here when I feel a need for some coffee to wash down the curry and korma I just ate at Golden Gate Pizza and Indian Cuisine three blocks up the street. It's a very casual place with a crowded set-up of couches and little tables that has made it difficult to find a seat many of the times I've come here. But they do have a broad selection of coffees that you serve yourself and one of the most disorganized cream-and-sugar stations I have seen in this city.

The place attracts all kinds - some tourists who saunter in from the beach, neighborhood locals, bicyclists on a break and a lot of Asian youth. There is a WiFi set-up and even a coffee bar set-up. I have yet to eat any of the desserts here since they look pretty generic. I'm fine with nursing a coffee, looking at the local art on the wall and just people watching.

COFFEE - 3 stars...well, it's better than swill
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...hey Frankie, we're going to hang ten with Gidget and Moondoggie
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...for the life of me, I can't remember
TOTAL - 3 stars...if you find yourself at the end of the N-Judah line with no place to go
author: Ed U.

description:
My buddy sent me here to try out the highly praised sandwich.  Its the edge of the earth out in these parts; this place is at the corner of Abyss Avenue and Black Hole Boulevard.  Its so far out, that the muni train actually makes a loop and retreats back the other way if you can believe that.  Its wind swept, sandy, and all the houses are weather-beaten.  Same goes for most of the patrons in this joint, which is filled with middle-aged guys who sure look like they've had too much sun, for as infrequently as the sun actually makes itself known out this way.  Oddly, there were also a number of young hotties when I was here.  A spattering of hippies, outdoorsy couples and old russian dudes filled out the dance card.  A strange mix of humans collect at this coffee outpost on the lost frontier indeed.  

The sandwich did not disappoint.  Got the large three meat combo sandwich for $6.95 and chose turkey (fresh roasted, not that processed stuff), mortadella, salami and provolone with mustard, mayo, letoos, onyone and their special sauce on a french roll.  They bake it all melty like.  And the quantity of meat on this sandwich was impressive. Very generous actually.  Other Yelpers have commented on the surly service.  I didn't find this to be the case.  In face, for as busy as it was, they were highly efficient with getting orders processed and out the door.  The one low point was when the oddball guy next to me started sneezing.  I was up and out with my grub in hand faster than you can say "go spread your got-damn asian bird flu to some other poor sucker".
author: Rick H.

description:
Ordered the SUB with tuna n' swiss cheese. Comes toastey and with a generous amount of tuna, tomatoe and a bit of lettuce. You get a six inch sando with some crispy crisp ruffled potatoe chips. I also bought a nice bottle of Rootbeer. A reasonable $7.00 for a just made sando with a soft drink.

Decor: ok, coffee house. Free Wifi?

Vibe: easy going beatnik, rasta, surfer, business man(me!)

Location: Location, ah yes, right at the end of the N-Judah, across the street from Ocean Beach. 

Customer service: fine n' friendly.
author: Bert K.

description: I love this place, especially on a warm day where you can sit outside and hear the ocean. Tons of options for specialty coffee drinks and HUGE portions. I usually get a dirty chai and some form of salad. The service is always good and they are very helpful. Only downside is this place is often crowded. You order at the counter and then pick up the food yourself/seat yourself. It can sometimes be a challenge to find seating since many people stay all day getting work done.
author: Erika B.

description:
The coffee, pastries, and atmosphere are fantastic.

It could use a few more power outlets, though.
author: Bill W.

description:
Reminds me of the perfect blanket- warms you when its cold outside, cools you off when its hot.  They have inside (cozy) seating and outdoor tables for the rare moments in the sunset when we get some sun. Can study here for hours or just hang out. Definitely attracts a lot of surfers and babies (with their moms) which gives it a totally different vibe than other cafes in the city. I think that there are many regulars, so the owners know quite a few people. 

Study Scene: Big Couches, individual tables, big tables available to set up a study encove.  I never had trouble getting a table because theres a quick turnaround, but some people have told me they have. Its a bit noisy, so you have to be comfortable with that. Lots of outlets. Internet isn't the most reliable.

Food: Suprisingly good. They put effort into what they serve so the sandwiches and salads are not overly priced for what you get. I would say the coffee and pastries are standard. They also serve wine and beer.

Service: Generally laid-back. Sometimes I get the feeling that they are doing me a favor, (hipster/right our of college vibe?). Not so strong that it scares me away. 

There need to be more cafes along the beach, but this one is definitely quality.
author: Sirina K.

description:
I love this place! Well first and foremost because they brew a good cup-o-java! It usually has anywhere from a moderate to full house of people depending on the time of day you step in there.

Either way it's worth your time and money. No more expensive than other coffee houses BUT is quite good and you won't be disappointed. They have a reasonable sized menu of food they serve and alot of people seem to order food and it looks like they enjoy it. I have only ordered their pastries and croissants but they were enjoyable from my experience. 

It's a great place to step into when you do a walk/run along the beach! And the staff is quite friendly. My last encounter I had to order 4 drinks and dropped one and the girl was sooo nice about my accident and replacing my drink.I even saw Cody Ross in there once!
author: Ro M.

description: Great location across the street from the beach. People chillin' there early in the morning and late at night. The coffee was nice and strong, they even bring it right out to you so you don't have to stand inside and wait for it. Cool atmosphere. I was just visiting from L.A., and the energy here was more laid back than any of the cafes down south. Cool spot.
author: Matt R.

description:
Slow drip seasonal blend coffee is good.  Vibe is very nice but the food here is not.  Pastry selection is sad.  Sandwiches are just average.

Location is great convenient stop for a jolt before or after you take your dogs to Ocean Beach to run free and be a dog again.  There is a nice strip of green space with benches across the street if the cafe's outdoor space is full (often the case).

In short, the food is 1-star, coffee is 2-star for SF but indoor and outdoor space earns 5 stars so I round up to 3, assuming all criteria being equally weighted (but shouldn't be since you go to a cafe for coffee/food) but I don't like giving out low star ratings unless there's more compelling reasons for it.
author: Liz K.

description:
Java Beach, you have been a part of my life for 16 years and I hope for 16 more!

I love you!
author: LeSLiE W.

description:
I haven't been to the new location yet, but there were so many people at the old one that it just cramped my style...I didn't get a good vibe from the folks there (the customers not the staff) which really bummed me out...

Moral of the story: It was probably my first and last trip there.
author: Jennifer P.

description: A gem reflecting the San Francisco I grew up in. Drinks are good and the food/lunch selection has been expanded. The vibe is truly laid back while still retaining cleanliness and organization. It also helps that they have a decent beer selection and a outdoor seating for the recent beach goer that is still dusting sand off his or her feet. A great spot for any Ocean Beach-goer.
author: Martina R.

description:
This is a great place.  We love to walk over there all the way from the Inner Sunset and have a coffee and chocolate croissant.  

It is great to sit there and watch the N-Judah to turn around.
author: a b.

description:
Right next to the N Judah Muni train turnaround.  They have some snacks to eat too.  Sometimes the inside gets a bit thrashed because it can get quite busy.  

The appearance of the place is not the best.  It is too mishmashed, but I guess it is appropriate considering how the houses and apartments look in the area.  

A cool place to get some coffee.  Yummy and strong coffee (like my women, lol).  Very close to Ocean Beach.  Lots of surfers, stoners, families, some lost tourists and San Franciscans all together enjoying some coffee.  

If you are in the area and need some caffeine, don't hesitate.  Good vibes are around this place.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Never felt the need to write a review for the cafe as I patronize it only somewhat often. 

My last visit prompted me to write here and now.

It was a usual visit, I ordered my Double Americano and gave my name. I then proceeded to wait about 15-20 mins for my drink, no exaggeration.  There was some sort of miscommunication and the woman who took my order got my name wrong so my coffee languished at the counter directly in front of me while it waited for some anonymous "Dave" to pick it up.  Having no real reason to investigate this Mysterious "Dave's" drink, I casually approached the counter and was asked what I was waiting for, I replied that I had not been served my drink and the woman I was speaking with informed me that "Dave's" drink was in fact mine.

At this point I was actually okay with taking this tepid Americano and enjoying what was left of it, but at the insistence of the Barista, she made me a fresh drink since she felt it was Java Beach's fault that I missed out on a delicious coffee.  

So this is the point of my long description, I will return to java Beach because the staff and servers - they were polite, friendly, hospitable, and willing to address a slight miscommunication with a fresh cup of coffee.  All around this is a decent cafe.
author: Artnok A.

description: Coffee and the Hot Tsunami are a must here! Always good after a walk down ocean beach. Place gets crowded but we usually get lucky with seating outside.
author: Ro B.

description:
this cafe is awesome!  i love how it's near ocean beach and how it has such a wonderful laid back energy to it.  if you are here in the early evening, the sunlight streams through the whole cafe and it puts everything in this amazing golden glow.  i remember getting a slice of chocolate cake here once and sharing it with a good friend.  the cake was decadant.  the coffee here is good.

haven't been here for a while, but would will stop by next time i'm around.
author: Amy L.

description: Out for a nice lunch with the sister and brother-in-law. The Tsunami Sandwich was large, very good, and I enjoyed the ambiance, even if it was a bit crowded. The location is very nice too since it's right next to Ocean Beach. Prices were also quite reasonable, especially since I didn't pay for lunch. The only real downside here consisted of a couple of mistakes made on the orders, but I attribute that to the number of people ordering. I would definitely go back again!
author: Dean M.

description:
I'm kind of in shock I haven't written a review of this place yet. I've been coming here for a number of years. I lived in the Sunset for 4 years and used to come here all the time. 

One of my favorite places to stop after a bike ride, jog, motorcycle ride etc. Great coffee and they serve some tasty baked goods as well as beer and wine now. For as busy as they are I always seem to be able to get a seat on the bench outside. 

Even though my gf and I both have moved out of the Sunset we both have a soft spot for this place so this weekend we headed back. And yes the coffee was actually as good as we remember. We got a tasty sweet baked coconut, caramel treat that was delicious as well.
author: Hyung L.

description:
I got a rice krispie here once. It was really hard, sort of like a brick. I also had hot cocoa that day because it was cold and I had just gone to the beach for some reason.

Oh yeah, the people here are very friendly. Yay!
author: Erica A.

description: Great place to grab a delicious cup of coffee and a simple sandwich before walking over to Ocean Beach. Not so great for studying. It can get pretty busy, and the barista's voice seems to bounce off the walls when calling orders.
author: Sophia B.

description: This is a nice little place tucked away in the corner of the Sunset. You can grab a cuppajoe and go to the beach on the one day of the year there's actually sun. The sandwiches are big and meaty and all come with ruffled potato chips. This is a good place to do some studying or just hang out on a lazy Sunday afternoon.
author: Nat L.

description:
Four stars for the food; just less that one star for the ambiance.   Good coffee and large tasty sandwiches.   Difficult to find a place to sit, as many patrons seem to sit there all day, focused on their laptops; they seem so  lonely and depressed.   Other diners tear apart their bread and scatter the bits for the many blackbirds who crawl over the tables, chairs and ground, giving the place a dirty feel.

Cell phone conversations are active, as some are oblivous to the presence of diners at neighboring tables.
author: Terry R.

description: loved the vibe. Everyone doing their own thang, sippin' on some good Coffee while listening to live music. And it's near the beach! Not a bad way to end a date.
author: Paul L.

description: Sweet and spicy OR sweet or spicy chai latte. They give you a choice and that's fabulouls. Go for the sweet AND spicy. Nice bagel sandwiches. Fun people watching on a weekend morning and cozy enough chairs and tables outside. A chill spot for a quick bite.
author: Farah S.

description: This place is consistently good. It gets really crowded being at the end of N Judah and because of that, occasionally they get the order slightly off, but they're willing to fix it and be friendly about it. I've never had anything there I didn't like.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
This is a very cute coffee and sandwich joint that highly resembles an old surf shop right next to ocean beach. It has a mix of a laidback and crowded environment with free wifi, outdoor seating, and groovy music--most tables are usually taken by customers reading up of their news so expect to fight for a seat and table.

I always order the everyday latte or tea---nothing extraordinary but the beachy atmosphere more than compensates. Keep in mind it's CASH ONLY, although they do have a small atm machine inside but it's better to come cash ready to save yourself the $3 service fee.

Overall, getting coffee at Java Beach is like a 30 minute escape vacation to the beach away from SF city life. It's a fabulous place to catch up with a buddy over some coffee and for some precious me-time!
author: Ellen W.

description:
I like to pretend Ocean Beach is my neighborhood because it's the closest part of San Francisco to where I live and I go running there several times a week. So by this logic, Java Beach is my neighborhood cafe. 

The coffee at Java Beach is good. I'm an espresso snob--I hate that burnt sludge they call coffee at Starbucks and Peet's. And they serve it in real mugs. Drinking a latte from a paper cup is liking drinking wine from one of those big red plastic cups. It's best left to college kids. Java Beach also serves beer and wine which raises it above most cafes. Parking is great, of course, because this is Ocean Beach. It can be hard to find a seat, however, even when it's cold and foggy. 

I was grading at Java Beach Cafe several weeks ago and I looked around and saw signs advertising parties for surfers, firemen, and Gaelic Footballers. Seriously? This neighborhood might just be perfect. I am so moving here.
author: Susan S.

description: Bagels with cream cheese and smoked salmon are worth a try!
author: Paulo K.

description:
Cute place on the beach. Friendly service. Great people watching. Perfect for a sunny day, plus the N line stops right there. I will say the food left much to be desired though. I ordered the Bonfire Delight roast beef sandwich and my friend ordered the Java BLT sandwich with chicken. The roast beef had a bit of a hotdog flavor--not good, but the roll was nice and crunchy, but not so crunchy you left with a scraped up mouth. The Java sandwich wasn't anything to call home about, but it was pretty much what you'd think chicken, bacon, tomato and bread taste like. No surprise flavors there. 

They also had a nice selection of beer to compliment your meal.

I would recommend this to a friend because of the location and the fact that they serve beer and I would probably go back on another sunny day, but I'll be giving something else on the menu a try.
author: Ashley B.

description:
It was quite difficult to get to, or maybe my gps was just giving me the long route. Parking seems to be limited on a busy day.  But I was able to find a parking spot near a neighborhood 2 blocks away.  I loved how the cafe is located right at the corner of the street- a very short distance from the beach.  

Type of food: Coffee, espresso drinks, tea, pastries, sandwiches 

Ambiance:
For a Monday, late morning, the place was pretty busy.  The decor fits the beach theme and very hipster feeling.  There are big couches, tables and outside seating.  A cozy place to hangout- you get the salty breeze from the ocean. Right when you walk in, you smell the freshly roasted coffee beans.  Seems like a great place to grab a latte and a muffin; walk the short distance to the beach and read a nice book.

Service:
They have an extensive menu.  But I settled for a latte because that is the only drink to test their espresso flavor.  They have four different sizes, the medium size looks like a regular size small at other cafes.  

Taste: 
I ordered a triple (3 shots of espresso) soy latte in a medium size.  I was nervous that ordering a triple shot would make my latte super bitter.  However, call me crazy, but it wasn't that intense, but still a strong espresso punch.  Anyways, the flavor of the coffee bean was fresh and smooth.  I really enjoyed my latte, and I can't wait to try something else next time.  I definitely need to try the sandwiches, they looked scrumptious.  

Price:
There was a $5 minimum charge for credit cards.  For coffee, the price was average. When I heard that my medium sized drink had a choice of 2 or 3 shots, I went for more caffeine.  $4.20 is a pretty good deal for a soy latte with 3 shots.

Overall:
I really enjoyed the chill and laid back atmosphere.  The coffee was fresh and delicious. Can't wait to come back.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Waited 20 mins in line to order, Cashier was not friendly at all, Ordered a smoked salmon bagel, waited another 15 mins for my order, got to the beach and realized the smoked salmon was raw.  Basically, I spent $9 for a bagel and cream cheese. I Won't be returning.
author: Jasmine P.

description:
Arissa's review reminded me of this place.
There's a really weird (to me) side of SF, where you're right near the ocean.  Surfers appear from out of nowhere, there are few cars, and right on the corner, is the Java Beach Cafe.  

Fair coffee, decent looking baked goods.  Beer.  Wifi.  Even a Muni turnaround.

There seems to be a regular crowd here.  If I lived in the area, I would probably be a customer, but I don't think I'd make a special trip here for their food or drink.
author: dan s.

description:
Love that they have seasonally flavored coffee drinks - pumpkin lattes and the like in the Fall. 

I've only been to this place a handful of times, but each time I go, I always think to myself "These are some most excellent bagels I've had in a long time. Toasted perfectly and just kind of awesome." So I thought I'd put it in writing today.

Really pleasant staff and ample seating. A little gem of a coffee shop in the Outer Sunset.
author: Stephanie I.

description: I like this place. Yes, it gets crowded in the middle of the day but if you're able to find a seat and don't mind a crown then it's great. The coffee isn't bad, the food looks good, and the owners/staff are very nice most of the time. You can't blame them for getting stressed when it gets really busy. I prefer coming here in the evening/night though. It's open late. It's easier to find a seat and get work done and the drinks are just as good.
author: Dylan T.

description:
My friend kept telling me about this place...but I never did before....

Oddly, we went for a bike ride last week, and we had a small lunch here.  (And I discovered that I had been here before...like 8+ years ago, before I really lived in SF though.)

Drinks = refreshing.  They also have beer and wine.  Cool.  Not that I tried one but...hey it's here!  (It's bribery for my coffee-hating-s.o....)

Food = great selection.  We had their tomato, cheese, pesto sammich and it was hot and delicious.  Their bread is great...they make it!  

Service = fabulous.  The people are fast, friendly and just nice!  Oh yeah, don't get scared of the line, they move pretty fast!  

Decor = typical java cafe...but roomy and a bit noisy.  There are plenty of outside seating and places to stash/lock your bikes.  

Parking...well, I think there is plenty of street parking, but if you're close or outdoors anyway, trek or bike it!  Worth the pit stop. :)
author: Fannie S.

description:
The last time we visited SF, we stayed in a near motel. The Java Beach saw us every morning: a friendly place w/ nice folks, great coffee and a veryvery delicious oatmeal, which you can customize to your likings.
The coffee selection is overwhelming and so effing good - go for the hazelnut coffee and you're addicted the second you taste it.

Great for vegetarians and vegans, since the selection of non-dairy milk is amazing.

Plus:
the selection of bear claws etc is amazingly overwhelming.

You'll lots of locals here, reading their newspaper, surfing the web (yes, free WiFi).
The Java Beach Cafe is a place where we'd hang out at least every saturday, all day.

A tip from us to the owners of the JBC:
go and open a Java Beach Café in Hamburg, Germany - it would be a goldmine in an instant.
author: Dave T.

description: Writing an update because of the nice email the restaurant owner wrote me apologizing for the chili and offering to give me a refund.  Clearly the owners care about the quality of their offerings and that, in my book, deserves a bump up in the ratings.
author: Chaz N.

description:
Great coffee, great environment.

It was close to the beach, so, at least subconsciously, I felt like I was getting a constant refreshing stream of ocean air. The cafe was consistently filled up inside as well as on their outdoor patio the entire time I was there Friday late morning to mid-afternoon.  I was lucky enough to grab a seat next to power sockets, thus securing my opportunity not only to sit my ass down and work for an extended period of time, but to people-watch. And I did find a variable mix of individuals coming in and out of the place -- students, surfers, stay-at-home moms/dads, screenwriters.

Along with a latte (good), I had a spinach+cheese croissant (average).

I also noticed there were sandwiches, common cafe-type pastries, granola bowls, and beer.
author: Monica H.

description:
I love Java Beach. Despite the fact that it is pricey, everything is delicious. Coffee, tea, sandwiches, pastry, bagels. YUM.

They are always busy. Don't be put off by that. It's for good reason! They are just too tasty!
author: Jess T.

description: Passive aggressive staff. Asked whether this plate was my order and was answered by "Sure, whatever..." I was shocked by the way she said it. Another staff sighed loudly because she had to take food outside. A third staff tried to get around my friend holding dishes and said "Um, I can't get around you with THESE THINGS." My friend was appalled. Seems acceptable to be passive agressive here. If you like being verbally abused by staff go right ahead, they have decent food.
author: Ike M.

description:
Java Beach is one of the places I always visit when I go to the city. I used to live close by and now 45 minutes doesn't stop my visits. 

Java Beach has wonderful coffee and great bites. They even stay open late and serve wine and beer. Its a regular stopping off point for everyone in the Sunset and people taking the N line. Lots of nice outdoor seating to sit and drink coffee with the paper.

Will be back again very soon!
author: Erin S.

description: we were craving some sweets last night, so the boys went out on a mission. java beach on sloat has soft serve, but unfortunately they were closed. this location has no softserve, so we had to settle for something else... frozen hot chocolate. yuuuummy!!! this is a must!!
author: Ann T.

description:
Living only blocks away, this definitely MAKES the neighborhood cozy. Patio seating, great sandwiches and coffee/coco. Friendly service. 

Every so often, locals will be jamming their acoustic sounds as you dine out on the patio enjoying the ocean's cool breeze or watching the sun set. 

A must EAT: 
Tsunami Sub w Pepper jack Cheese 
BBQ Chicken Sub 

oooohh... so YUMMY!! Mimosa's, wine & beer while relaxing.. how much better can it get.
author: Sara N.

description:
What can I say, I love this place.  They have saved me many early mornings when I needed something healthy for the road, many afternoons when I was starving and needed an amazing salad, many cravings when I needed a muffin or chocolate criossant.  I love their coffee, I always get the hazelnut.  I really love that they put out such a variety of things to go in your coffee or tea- soy milk and almond milk along with the standards, brown sugar, honey, and they have these great cup toppers that close so I don't spill all over my car... or walking down the street.  Anyway!

They have a fantastic selection of pastries, coffees and teas as well as lemonades and I think they sell beer, sandwiches, salads and they always have a daily soup.  I love their fruit and yogurt bowls, they make the most delicious granola (please sell bags of the granola!!)  There is always a little wait for everything, but this is no Starbucks with their fancy microwaves, they make everything!  Plan on about 5 minutes if you order a mixed drink and sometimes up to 15 minutes for food (hey they're good and across the street from the beach so usually busy)

The nicest people work there too and a lot of them have been there for a long time and will get to know you which I think is really nice.  No new people to come judge my pastry addiction (seriously they have amazing pastries).

Lastly, free wifi.  Need I say more?

Definitely stop by if you are in the area!
author: Jessie M.

description: This place is great! The staff is almost always super friendly and the food is good. The bathrooms are surprisingly well maintained. They're more expensive than the average San Francisco Starbucks and their wifi is not especially consistent, but I like this place. I wish they opened earlier, especially on weekends.
author: Keith M.

description: i can't tell you what a gem of a cafe this is and how much i love the homey atmosphere! everyone is sooo super happy here. ryan and tristan always take such great care of me! i'm loving the live music and have brought friends here to eat the yummolicious food and listen to the live music. i love the tsunami sandwich and i'm dying to try the mexican salad since i heard it's off-the-hook. i also tried the homemade vinagrette dressing and wow-i had every last drop. tonight, i had the pleasure of hearing a new band, the mellow dudes. super cool acoustics and a fun bunch of band members! usually, i'm here for my friend's awesome vocals and strumming, joseph liston. anyways, absolutely lovin' spending any time i can here. great for my soul healing! thank you for such a fabulous cafe where you can feel the love!
author: Yan K.

description: Cool place to stop for a bite and coffee after taking a walk along the beach & the Great Hwy.  Interesting mix of people...all friendly.
author: Jeannie S.

description: This is my go to work spot, outside of my house. Free fast Wifi, good reasonably priced coffee, and delicious sandwiches. There's also plenty of accessible outlets for laptops or charging your phone too. Plus you can look out of the window and the beach is right there. Awesome spot if you're in Outer Sunset!
author: Chelsea C.

description: The location and ambiance of this place are great.  But the coffee is not.  They use an inferior blend that makes a bitter, strange-tasting espresso.  My partner had a regular coffee that tasted like water.  Don't come here for the coffee.
author: David S.

description: My dogs like it because they can join me for oatmeal or other breakfast faves. Follow moster intake and coffee frenzy( no free refills) with a walk on beach or stare at streetcars turning on N Judah line. Friendly crew.
author: Fred  D.

description:
For a laugh, order a small coffee.

Then, order the medium coffee instead - cause that's what you meant, anyways.
author: Mal R.

description:
This is absolutely one of my favorite places ever. I love it for the convenient and wonderful location. It's right at the end of the N line next to Ocean Beach. On a warm day, it's great to just sit outside with a beer and enjoy the time. It's pretty great right before sunset. I've had afternoons here where people are outside with guitars and just jamming, and it feels like we're a community.

While not the best food ever, it's not bad at all. Lines can get pretty ridiculous, and the place is packed when it's nice out, but i just take it to mean that this is the place to be. Regardless of how crowded it gets, Java Beach is still the best beach front place around.
author: Phuong M.

description: Just love this place! One of my favorites! The hot sandwiches are just awesome! Especially pesto!!
author: Adam B.

description: The place was packed on Sunday afternoon, but they moved through the line quickly. We got a table after just a few minute wait. Food was a.maz.ing!!! We got the tsunami sub, a blt, and a vanilla latte. We loved it all!! Even the chips that came with the sandwiches were great! Huge plus having the MUNI stop right outside the door and the beach across the street!
author: Leah P.

description:
Still the worst service and attitude ever! Whats sad is there are a couple of nice people working there but a few bad apples ruin the bunch... and a cool location too. I am sticking to Sloat from now on.... I swear I was forced in here the other day.

I do have a question for people who study or work in crowded loud coffee shops: Why? How can you possibly concentrate on anything? It always makes me wonder how bad it must be at home if you drag your laptop and office to Java Beach to do work or study. Can anyone explain this to me please?
author: Lisa J.

description:
My pink and brown backpack was stolen from there on Sept. 9th!  I realized that I had left it under a table fourty minutes after we had left.   I called to see if someone had turned it in but no one had.  An employee went to look where we had been sitting.  When I called back later an employee told me that probably no one will turn it in.  On Sept. 10th we went back to Java Beach cafe to look around inside and in the surrounding area to see if my passport or other worthless items (to the thief) were tossed in the bushes.  We had no such luck.  In my backpack was my cellphone, camera with pictures of my newly deceased Mom, photos, a silver necklace, my Starbucks card, some Canadian coins, a Canadian check, my passport and more.  I had to get a new passport as I was traveling back to Canada two days later.  It cost over two hundred dollars to get the new passport..   I do hope that karma will happen to the person who stole my backpack.  We had gone to Java Beach Cafe to have tea and write my Mom's obituary.   I had never been there so wanted to go.  I did have tea and my sister had hot apple cider.   Unfortunately, the wifi was not working there (about 6pm).    When I called again on Sept. 12th I found out that they have cameras but not in the area where we were sitting :(.   I wish that an employee had told me on Sept. 9th when I first called that they have cameras.  I will not go back there.  
Please contact me if anyone has any info on the thief or finds anything of mine.  The photos consist of my Mom in the hospital with family around her, my daughter in her wedding dress and more.  
Thank you so much
Karen Schlocker  (I'm on Facebook)
author: Karen S.

description:
Been here a couple times since I moved to the outer sunset a month ago - only a couple blocks away!  It's convenient.  It's got delicious veggie hummus bagel sandwiches.  The pastries are yummy.  The pesto tomato mozzarella melt is gooey and toasty.  I'm pleased.  :)

I've also always been able to find a seat, and been fortunate to get there when there's no line.  Guess I'm just lucky.

Haven't actually tried their coffee yet, but I will!
author: Carly G.

description: This has to be the worst place for coffee EVER! I had a "Choose your own coffee" and it should have been, "Choose your own water"! My partner had a double espresso. His facial expression was very funny as he cringed as he swallowed. This espresso was the worst. It made my coffee taste actually good. Tasted like someone scraped it off the floor. The paper coffee cup started leaking before I got 1/4 of the way down. NASTY! Great location. Cheap coffee beans. 1 star only because they had free wi=fi.
author: Lucky J.

description:
The best caramel latte ever can be found here. Not overly sweet. Perfect in every way. 

It's a San Francisco kind of place with a diverse crowd and the best vintage music playing in the background. 

It was crowded the day I was there and I had to wait awhile for my coffee. That's the only negative. But just watching all the people makes the time fly by if you have to wait.

Oh and as an extra treat...walk with your coffee by the "beachy" decorated house up the street on La Playa. It has sea horses painted on the garage doors, a gnome in the window box and more things than you can possibly see in one visit decorating the outside of the house. Just be cautious tho' as the owner seems a tad unfriendly (sometimes sits in his open garage) which doesn't go with all the fun stuff on the outside of the house!
author: susan m.

description: Honestly, I wouldn't go to Java Beach ever if I wasn't staying in the area. The wi-fi, through free, is often really slow. If you walk in and sit down and try to use the wi-fi for a few minutes while you decide what you want to eat or drink, you may get rudely confronted by the owner or one of the girls who work there and told that 'You have to buy something to use wi-fi, FYI'. Yes, I have had this happen to me more than a few times. It's rude. Yes, their coffee is decent, and the food is pretty good. But everything is overpriced, and on top of all of that, it's often too noisy and packed in there to be able to have a conversation or god forbid get some work done without wearing headphones to block out all the noise. Sometimes they have live music, which would be great if most of the people who perform didn't suck and butcher classic songs. UGH.
author: Lindsey S.

description:
I really like this cafe for the location and for the people who work there.
The staff are friendly and the food is really good. The only drawback to this place is how many people are there at any given time. 
It is a smaller place, and there just aren't enough seats for everyone. There are the usual crowd who go to work on their laptops and can take up a table meant for 3. If people would be more considerate with sharing space, I think people would be a little more satisfied.

Also, when you order food or beverages, you must wait inside because they'll call your name. There are so many people that are here in the afternoon for the lunch hour that it gets overcrowded and really loud. I suggest you visit Java Beach Cafe in the morning or later in the afternoon. 

The food is a bit pricey but it is good. The coffee is great, but since it is all "fair trade" you can't have a free refill; you have to pay another $1.50 or so for another one. Kind of lame, but I guess I can understand it.
author: Angie P.

description: I absolutely love their decaf mocha.  They use organic coffee and organic milk.  Can't ask for more!    A bit pricey, but they have free wifi and cool places to seat outside.  Friendly, good ambiance.  Five stars!
author: Grace S.

description:
Java Beach Cafe...What can i say you never disappoint... you should take what ever it is that makes you so successful and open up a club.... the way you pack a house... awe inspiring... 

My date and i continued our day with a stop off at this cozy little establishment...with the order line running out the door... and literally rubbing elbows with the other patrons... 

again my date came to the rescue with her charming smile making the crowd some what unnoticeable... (sorry not completely) :) 

My date had a warm peasant pie with spinach and feta cheese... felt like being wrapped up in a warm towel straight from the dryer... and the soup...UH just intensified that feeling.... wish i'd ordered the same thing... 

I ordered the san patricio... cubed chicken breast in a mustard and mayo slathering with avocado and jack cheese served on ciabatta roll... it was ok... the chicken kept falling out...kinda messy... but still enjoyable... just make sure you get alot of napkins!! 

If it weren't for the weather i would've took my date back to the beach to enjoy our food... like a little pic nic... probably would have been ok because of the scalding hot, jasmine green tea... don't get me wrong, it was quite enjoyable... we just had to wait about 10min for it to cool down... :) 

there must have been some non-locals there or maybe they were just lazy, because you're supposed to bus your own dishes and garbage... but the coffee table we were using to eat off was piled with other people's left overs and magazines and news papers.... some what embarrassing to take a date... just hope she didn't mind.... 

have to remember to go there when it's not the typical lunch rush... 
I don't mind some crowds but that was a bit much even for the most active club goer!!
author: keith p.

description:
My friend introduce me to this place when we were hanging out. 
I love that it's next to the beach, which gives that whole laid back atmosphere. Although, my friend and I didn't spend time there since we were on the go, it seem like a great place to have a nice cup of tea/coffee w/ a friend. It has nice interior design. It's small but I don't really see it as a problem (unless there's a lot of people of course).
I only been here once but I do plan on coming back and bring friends along because overall I love the aura that I got from that place and I have yet to try out the food and drinks they have.
Oh for those who aren't really a coffee person such as myself, I suggest you try the White Mocha, I actually enjoyed it.
author: Rose L.

description:
A very nice local coffee place in the outer Sunset!  It's one of those places that you can just sit back and relax and enjoy your coffee.  It's great.  I just ordered a to-go coffee and the caramel latte was really good. 

I like it because it's a great local hangout. Support Local businesses!!
author: Jannie Q.

description:
Try the Caramel Latte!  Not too sweet and not too bitter....just right!

UPDATE 4/13/08
I came back here on a beautiful Sunday morning with my mom and brother after his bike race in Golden Gate Park.  At about 10 a.m., it was pretty packed.  This is definitely a great place to enjoy your cup of coffee and enjoy the sunshine, maybe take a stroll along Ocean Beach.
author: Jen S.

description:
Java Beach is a great place to sit down and read a book or do some work on your laptop with free internet access. The house coffee is nice and just the overall atmosphere is nice with indoor and outdoor seating. 

I've been here a couple of times and have only been disappointeda few times. Once was for gross bagels and the other for narsty piroshkis. I think if I go to a coffee joint, I'll just stick with the coffee or hot chocolate. Other than that it's a nice cozy place.
author: Michael J.

description:
I like a late night cafe where the coffee is strong and there's lots of snack variety. Enter...Java Beach Cafe! 

My fave thing about this place, besides the fact that it's a cool spot near the beach, is menu variety. My friends and I spent a good 5 minutes deciding on our coffee order. I ended up with a pretty delicious almond milk mocha. Tasty and a little bit healthier than your traditional mocha. Yum!
author: Tiffany E.

description:
GREAT blended mochas. at 5+ bucks for the smallest size they damn sure better be great. Sandwiches are pretty good, the breads could be better, but they are still good.

Also, super chill atmosphere. Nice comfy couches and laid back music. Awesome little spot to hang out
author: Nelson S.

description:
nice place, pretty basic neighborhood cafe in the outer sunset - super crazy rainy/windy day at ocean beach stopped here for a coffee. 
The only bad point is the prices 

$2.25 for a small coffee??? I'm not at Blue Bottle, sightglass or Four Barrel! 

'Normal' coffee in SF (in my view) should be $1.50 - $1.85 for a small machine made brew...yeah i know its only 50-75 cents, but it would prevent me from making this my every day local spot if i lived here. 

Solid place though, i would come back in for sure.
author: Ben B.

description: It's the only coffee shop around.  It's the only bar around.  So you don't get a choice.  Just stop by and drink up.  It's relaxing.  A sandwich is can fill your stomach too.
author: Byron L.

description:
It can be hard to get a table indoors but there's plenty of seats outside.  White Mochas and Hot Chocolates are pretty good here. If you plan to sit down and drink, make sure you sit away from the door and windows because it can get a bit chilly in here - your hot drinks can get cold pretty fast!  The sandwiches they make are just okay.

Free WiFi Spot that stays open until 11 pm - great place to study; my main reason for coming here.  I would love to see more outlets though.  In my experience - It's funny how most Free WiFi Spots don't  have too many outlets and the ones that DO have plenty of outlets are those that DONT even have Free WiFi...did that make any sense lol?

FYI: They serve alcohol as well.
author: jesiree b.

description: Love this place!  I had a salad and free wifi. I got there early enough and got a good seat in the booth. Since I sat there for a couple of hours, I bought more food items: lemon bar, salad and cookies. The staff were nice and not pushy (since I was there for a good while). It's a nice spot. What more can I say?
author: Fran S.

description: Worth the wait,but if the line is long, you can get your order in quicker if you call their phone number.  They will take phone orders before the people that are standing in front of them.
author: Eric P.

description: Great coffee. Good salads. Good food. Great time when there is live music, which is getting harder and harder to catch there. I wish they had music more often. Often really hard to find a seat.
author: Larry H.

description: Like a quick trip to a sleepy beach town cafe.  Sandwiches could be a little better, but with the variety of food and beverages (including beer) you can't go wrong.  Sit outside in the rare warm weather when you can.  Inside can get crowded on weekends.
author: Nick F.

description:
My favorite neighborhood spot for free wifi.

Pros:
Free Wifi
Table-for-twos next to wall outlets.
Big salads and toasted sandwiches.
Decent restroom.

Cons:
Need to get there early to grab a table. 
It gets crowded fast.
author: vicki c.

description: Lovely cafe. Great atmosphere. Cute, friendly people to look at and chat with. A great spot near the beach.
author: David K.

description:
my favorite place to go!
java beach has delicious food and tons of options.  i wish i could have breakfast, lunch, dinner and dessert here every day. the best sandwiches you can imagine!! amazing salads!  i love that you can get an out-of-this-world latte made by the baristas, or a mimosa or a pint!
it's a great vibe, great staff and customer service, it's a good place to go whether it's 6am or 10pm. there is such a wonderful community vibe that just feels really special, you'll be very happy  if you come here.
author: Victoria T.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to go get coffee. The location is great, and the place itself has pretty good food. Their sandwiches are awesome and they have really good salads as well. They have outdoor seating for those rare warm days at the beach, but the downside is lots of people love this place as well, so seats might be limited.  

They accept credit cards, but with a minimum of $10, so you might wanna have cash. 

They also have a little bar in there (never tried anything like that there), but if you want a cold beer on a warm day, I guess that would be nice too. 

There arent many cafes along the beach, which i guess why this one is so popular. But it serves its purpose well...just wish it wasnt so damn crowded.
author: Nika G.

description:
After frequenting this place for the last year, today I realized that I wasn't really happy with the quality of their coffee anymore.  I don't know if it was my perception or if their quality went down, but somewhere along the line a fine double cappuccino turned into what is essentially milk coffee.  Between that and the unreasonably long lines and standing-room-only crowd during the weekend, lunch and breakfast, I've started choosing other places in the neighborhood.

Mind you, the location of Java Beach perfect and the food is great, no squabble there.  Even so, I'd recommend people venture out and try the other places nearby, like Sea Biscuit (http://www.yelp.com/biz/sea-biscuit-cafe-san-francisco) or Kaila's Corner Cup (http://www.yelp.com/biz/kailas-corner-cup-san-francisco).
author: Daniel H.

description: Started making this place part of my Sunday ritual....run the great highway, reach the BEST COFFEE OF MY LIFE....and run back?? Always makes the run there worth it. Amazing coffee, and i love that they have the option to use almond breeze instead of milk or half and half I thought I was the only one..how did they know?? I have yet to try their menu but have had their muffins and YUM!
author: Shannon O.

description: This place is a neighborhood institution. It always seems busy and it can definitely be an amusing place to sit and sip. The location could not be better... right near the park, the Muni line and most importantly, the beach.
author: M C.

description: This place opens super duper early. Also includes a full bar with drinks of all sort including coffee and pastries as well as meals. The store takes fucking forever to make a damn late. That's the bad thing. The good thing is that their coffee is fairly priced, and the workers are awesome and friendly, but for some reason always seem to spell my name wrong.. But the atmosphere is amazing, the people are always nice and i think there is live music. The seating is huge, it can fit a ton of people inside and out and its directly across from the beach full of used needles hiding in the sand. Definately check this place out, be aware of the long lines. that's the worst part about this store. Their Hot Coco is terrible....unfortunately. well...you just get the lumpy powder at the bottom.
author: Cody A.

description:
During a stay in Outer Sunset on a short visit, I would come here everyday. I was staying just two blocks away so it was a short walk. Good coffee and pasteries. Free internet was very useful during a house search in which we had no internet at home. 

Steps away from the beach, it is a great location. A nice hot cup of coffee on a chilly morning is perfect. Also the muni is right around the corner which is quite convinient.
author: AL S.

description: Great sandwiches, great coffee, great vibe! If you're a meat eater, get the Tsunami, you won't regret it!
author: John F.

description:
I TOTALLY LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE!

Its a cool little hang-out spot, they have delicious sandwiches, and they have a wide selection of drinks. You can customize it to your liking, and is way better than your big-box chain SBUX. ( Not being a hater, I work for Starbucks, but little places like this are amazing, and I am SO glad I found it.)

Every time I go to the city, I HAVE to stop by, even if its just for a chai or a hot chocolate. They have amazing pastries, and a delicious croisant filled with feta, mushrooms, and spinach.( Try it toasted, it is BOMB!)

Favorite coffee place, by far, in S.F.
author: T. C.

description: So, my GF and I were in the sunset and we decided to check out this little cafe. The inside decor was really nice and inviting. It had nice ocean photography photos and a lot of wood inside. I ordered a specialty sandwich which I cant remember the name but  it was really excellent. The multi-grain bread was very fresh and soft. The pesto was nicely spread and the turkey was very flavorful. To my surprise the sandwich was served with chips as well. I think I paid $7.50 which is very reasonable. This is a great find! I can honestly say, I can't wait to go back and try another sandwich or their coffee.
author: Derek S.

description: Is it me or has one of my favorite post surf sandwich joints gone down hill? No more S,M,L sizes? Just one overpriced one now? Different less friendly faces seem to have taken over. Is it a new owner after all these years?
author: Will C.

description:
Cozy space, laid-back feel, not bargain basement prices, but good value
. 
I got the medium mocha, double shot and a toasted, ham & cheese croissant. Mocha was good and strong. Croissant was a nice snack. 
I can totally attest to the GREAT lemon bars. 
They've got their sweeteners DOWN too! Agave syrup, honey, brown sugar. Impressive, even tho I didn't have a drink to try it with. 
Definite repeat for my next trip.
author: Kevin C.

description: I'm not vegan and I loved the vegan cookie!  Good coffee, good sandwiches, great location!
author: Susie Q.

description: I'm probably biased because I live 5 doors down from Java Beach, but I think it's pretty wonderful. I'm not expecting the best coffee or espresso in the city when I come to Java beach. They're open early and close later than most places in Outer Sunset which can be really great. They have free wi-fi and a lot of plugs so you can stay all day with your laptop if you need to - which is how I wound up writing 80% of my masters thesis here. The baked goods aren't really anything to write home about, they can be stale sometimes, but the sandwiches are HUGE and the bagels are pretty good (this is coming from a girl who grew up on NYC bagels). I'm awkwardly a ~*regular*~ now and the stuff here has always been incredibly friendly and kind - it seems they definitely try to get to know people who come in regularly. They have live music at night most Fridays - Sundays and that can be a little annoying/loud but it's pretty consistent so you'd know to expect it. When it winds up actually being sunny in Outer Sunset people flock here before going to the beach (or after going to the beach only to be devoured by the fog) and it can get really crowded and leave you with a long wait time for food - which is why being able to call in your order is awesome. I'm also that girl who regularly asks to share a table with strangers who have room at theirs and no one has seemed really opposed to that yet so if it's crowded don't be afraid to ask someone to split a table with you! I also totally love the all the regulars here who gather around at night and play their guitars outside and drink beer - it's nice to see a little community going on here :)
author: Meaghan B.

description: Java beach has great food, beach type atmosphere, and a friendly staff.  I get sandwiches here for my lunch all the time.  Never a disappointment.  Great views near the beach with an outside patio area.
author: John C.

description:
Wow!! Can a small, private coffee shop be THAT good??!!.... YES!!!

I have to say that I was absolutely surprised to taste how good the coffee is here. Everyone knows I am THE coffee drinker, so I am pretty picky with my cafes. Their iced white mocha is deeeee-licious!

What a great way to top a day at the beach... when you're laying at the beach and need a little jump start, just walk over and Java is right there! This is for sure my new favorite cafe.
author: Milz T.

description: My favorite coffee place.  I live on the same block as Java Beach so I've been visiting them every day for years.  Their coffee quality is the best.  Bernie's  blend is my favorite.  It's their strongest coffee but is not dark blend, very important in my opinion.  I hate taste of burned coffee, and Bernie's blend is nothing like that.  You actually taste  coffee.  They have other bends available, and as any coffee place it has many choices of blended drinks.  Be aware of their iced coffee.  It's strongest thing you'll ever try, you might end up with some jitters and heart palpitations if you drink it on the empty stomach.  They also have great selection of pastry, which is gone by lunch time, but don't be sad they have healthy breakfast menu, great sandwiches, hot or cold, and last but not least great salads.  Place can get really busy on the sunny days in SF, and on the weekend.  The line ends up somewhere in the street, but don't be sad, waiting is totally worth it.  At night time you can stop for some music, glass of wine or beer, your choice.  Usually older crowd is relaxing during this time, some of them even dancing.  I think that anyone visiting SF should stop by Java Beach it's great coiffed, food, drinks, and it's right across the street from the Ocean Beach.  P.S.  They are dog friendly
author: Ingrid B.

description: Food is ok but way overpriced---$5.50 for a cup of ok soup, $9 for a sandwich + $1.50 to add for avocado? Sign indicating absolutely no refills? Also, wifi that only allows like 2-3 people to be on at a time. Guess their location across the street from the beach allows them to survive this way.
author: Swiss C.

description:
After a day of traveling on the N from downtown, walking on the beach, chasing the dog who was chasing a bird and admiring the ocean, the bf and I were in need of a little nutrition. The Java Beach Cafe was a convenient place... for a lot of people! Not that I minded, we still managed to get a table and enjoy ourselves. 
I didn't really study the menu like I should have. We just got simple sandwiches (but from reading the other reviews, it sounded like I should have gotten a Spinach Feta pie!). The place was packed, it just added to the experience and it was still relaxing. I will definitely return next time the sun is out!
Doggy had a drink from the bowls of water they had out. I love it when businesses are dog-friendly!
author: Amanda W.

description: Great sandwiches and amazing salads.  And it has wi-fi!  I would have given it 4 stars if it weren't for all the d*** dogs!  Everyone is not ok with dogs around when they're eating.  Doesn't make us bad people.
author: Eric M.

description:
I like the fact that a place like this exists.  And the outdoor seating is awesome and a rare find in this city.  The food and beverages are great and the prices aren't outrageous.

However, anything I have ever ordered that has to be prepared in the kitchen (i.e., sandwiches) has taken forever.  Even service on coffee drinks can be annoyingly slow.  So, it's good, but not if you're in a hurry OR really hungry.
author: Shari G.

description:
I don't get coffee at this cafe but I do get their toasted sammies and their salads.  And I would give them 4 stars but I always see flies trapped in their pastry bins.  I hope that doesn't mean there are flies in all of their foods.  Ok, flies aside, the salads are big and tasty and the toasted sammies are also really good. 

Another warning:  when they're busy, they are BUSY!  Morning coffee time means a line coming out of the cafe and snaking around the corner.  The kitchen area isn't big so hiring more people won't help.  You'll just have to really want what you're getting to wait in that line.  I say go somewhere else and get your fix another day when it's slow.  Like lunch at 3pm.  No line, viola!
author: Rosalind S.

description:
While the food instead the best around, there is truly nothing better than enjoying a sandwich and a beer in the warm afternoon sun. Close enough to the beach to smell the fresh ocean air, but far enough away to not have sand in your shoes.

Lines and wait time can get a bit long on the weekend or when it is particularly nice outside, but I guess it's just a sign that this is the place to be when you take the N to the beach and want to grab a bite to eat.
author: Allyson S.

description:
I'm glad this cute, yet laid back cafe is in my new 'hood and only a couple of steps from where I now live.  After a run in the park, my sister and I stopped by for a late lunch.  A friend had mentioned that their sandwiches were good, so I was looking forward to that. 

I'm on a pesto, mozzarella and veggie sandwich crave lately, so I tried it here.  It was delicious- toasted to a perfect crunch as the cheese melted and glued everything together.  I did have to wipe off some of the creamy pesto. A small order was actually a pretty decent portion. I'd definitely go with the hot sandwiches.  

Order at the counter, and keep an eye out for any open seats because it gets packed!  It seems like regulars camp out with their laptops.  I'm definitely coming back and bringing others with me!
author: Lisa C.

description:
Great place for lunch!

Couples of friends and I came here for lunch today, Sandwiches all around. For a decent 7.50, I got a fatty tuna salad sub! It was delicious, pact full of tuna salad as well as veggies, I was reallllllly happy when i picked up the sandwich after a fair 10 minutes of waiting... Ice tea was a bit expensive though, I got a 16oz of the goods and it cost me a whopping $2.95, really? I could get a 24oz diluted, ice tea from Starbucks for less than that... and it would taste just as good. 

but overall, java beach cafe is a definitely worth a trip, alot of seating indoors and outdoors! great place to eat with your bestie doggies.
author: Alex C.

description: This is the 2nd time I have eaten here on my trips to san francisco. I have ordered different things both times, one time ordering the BBQ chicken sandwhich and this time I ordered a ham sandwhich with pepperjack cheese and a lemonade. The food was great both times, the chips that come with the food are great and that lemonade was freshly squeezed or good enough to fool me, that didn't taste like it was storebought and I liked that about the place. They were friendly, and it is a nice place to get inside on those windy days
author: Tim C.

description: Discovered this place last week, and will definitely be back.  Great spot by Ocean Beach, with great coffee, chai and great food options!
author: Bridget B.

description:
It's open later than most of the sunset coffee places, so it ends up being my go-to place.  It's everything that is right about a neighborhood cafe.

Love the outdoor seating arrangement.
Good sandwiches, fresh pastries, fast service, good chai and most importantly great coffee.  Their beer selection was made for me.  They also have happy hour specials.

Always crowded, but I usually sit at the bar.
author: Natalie R.

description:
Love this place!
Upsides:
Friendly staff
Quick service 
Dog friendly , they have a dog bowl outside for your four legged companion :) 
You can get a beer or coffee , depending on what you are feeling like at the moment.
Their apple cinnamon muffin is SUPER GOOD! :)
They have food to go with your drinks.. Salads , sandwiches , pastries , etc
Family friendly 
Free wifi 
Outside seating 
The N Judah stops right in front

Downsides:
Pricey drinks for what they taste like  :( 
Their Italian  sodas are a little bland  ... 
Their blended coffee drinks are a little too sweet for me... But if you have a sweet tooth 
it might be what you're looking for :) 
Can get a little crowded on weekends and sunny days. Makes it hard to maneuver around the place.
author: Natalie B.

description:
Liked this spot which is right next to the beach and a trail for running. Definitely I will be back. 

Great place to do some writing with its nice view to inspire you. And also to do other projects which are not that creative, but at least with the view and the atmosphere, it won't feel like it's work. 

And the coffee, of course, is as good as Starbucks. Definitely I will be checking out their other drinks and the pastries too next time I am there.
author: Christopher R.

description:
I took about an hour to decide what I wanted, because everything on the board sounded good.  Wound up deciding to get the toasted ham and cheese on a croissant - and I was not disappointed.  Not very many places to sit on the inside - but they have a miniature bar, with 4 stools.  Nice touch!   

Its across the street from the SF  Zoo and down the street from the beach, so sitting at one of the tables outside is always a good choice.  The staff there was nice, so were the patrons.  Its a cross between coffee house, sandwich shop, and beach pub.
author: Warren R.

description: My boyfriend took me here when he lived in the Outer Sunset. They had amazing chi lattes and delicious food. The people were friendly and the service was good. The prices are pretty reasonable and I like it because it isn't Starbucks. I get tired of the chain restaurants and coffee shops. If I lived in the Outer Sunset I would definitely be a regular! Their is nothing like drinking hot coffee and enjoying the breeze from Ocean Beach :)
author: Allie M.

description:
I'm excited that this cafe is the closest one to where I live. Great coffee, great service, and situated directly across the highway from the Pacific Ocean. Who could ask for anything more? 

What's that? A nearby park, you say? No problem. Walk three blocks north, and you'll find yourself in the largest park in the city. 

If you enjoy a strong cup of coffee like say, an Americano, as much as I do, order the Muddy Water. You won't regret it. Oh, and pick up an apple fritter while you're at it. It goes great with Muddy Water.

I haven't tried any of the sandwiches here yet, but I've heard great things about them from coworkers, so that's next on my list.
author: Rory O.

description:
I'm all about consistency, and I have yet to be disappointed with Java Beach. The coffee is damn good and the staff pleasant. Maybe i'm easy, but it brings me back again and again. I thought the food was a bit expensive, but I enjoyed every bite. Which proves you get what you pay for, at least here.
I have barely scratched the surface of the menu, and look forward to trying a little more.
author: Bart P.

description: Not a bad place.  My friend Anna and I like meeting up at this spot since we both live fairly close.  We both had veggie sandwiches which weren't too bad.  I think I preferred their baked goods and coffee tot heir sandwiches though.  The pitcher of beer we ordered was 20 bucks, which was a bit too expensive for me.  I did enjoy the staff because they were friendly.  I will be coming back though, mostly for convenience.  Lol.  I hope their sandwiches get a little better though!
author: John H.

description:
Quad mocha.  By the beach.  'nuff said. Oh, and more importantly... they have a kick-butt Butterscotch Hot Chocolate drink.  That's right - BUTTERSCOTCH.

*Seriously, though... great eats.  great vibe.  right at the N-Judah turnaround at Ocean Beach.  I used to live right across the street from here, so I'm a little biased.
author: Olma M.

description: no longer serving these homemade lemon bars.. but i will come here for an amazing sandwich and a great cup of coffee or iced tea.
author: Ray S.

description: Good sandwiches here. I would get the sourdough sliced bread. The sour roll makes my jaw tired, but good. Always get it toasted. Watch out, the large is HUGE. Coffee is good too. Bagels are good but stray clear of the pastries. They stay open late too!!
author: Keyser S.

description: This little cafe is great, friendly staff, kid and pet friendly, they serve sandwiches and pastries. This is a great place for my family when we are on Sunset side because they serve a few draft beers for the hubby as well as hot cocoa and teas for my daughter and of course, great coffee and espresso drinks for me! The only downfall is that this cafe is so loved the seating is very limited as well as parking.
author: Lolly M.

description:
OH YEAH!!!!

I wish this place wasn't an hour away. Great beachside vibe and fantastic coffee!.

 I love skipping across the street (yes im the idiot bounding across The Great Highway) with a not too sweet mocha.  It was packed and I was worried my order would get mixed up with someone else but all the other orders were soy, extra foam, extra hot, double shot, cinnamon foofoo concoctions that a single mocha with whip was the odd man out.
author: Inga R.

description: This place is great! There aren't too many places near Ocean Beach to eat, so thank goodness for Jave Beach Cafe! They have great coffee, tasty food (their hummus bagels are delish!) and wonderful pastries (adore their chocolate macaroons)! The service is top notch each time I have visited (talk about grace under pressure) and that is amazing considering how long the lines usually are and how often the phone was ringing off the hook. Love this place. So. Much.
author: Storm A.

description:
The sandwiches here are huge and fresh!  

I love that you can get the food to-go and walk across the street to Ocean Beach.  

If you like yerba mate, this is a great place to get it as a latte or as a plain hot tea.  The coffee and espresso drinks are also great.

The patio is great on a sunny day for a lemonade or beer to go with a nice long read.

The bathroom is clean!
author: Elli F.

description:
Java Beach continues to be one of my favorite spots to visit when I'm in the area.

It's also great to know that the place is always packed.  Well, I guess this also means one of two things: get there early to get a seat, or have an eagle eye and/or a friend to nab a spot for you once a spot opens up.

Regardless, I always enjoy the goodies :D
author: Tammy L.

description:
I live down the block so whenever i need a quick coffee or hot chocolate fix, I would go here. I love the local feel of the place and the people here are so NICE!

I've only tried the coffee and hot chocolate and let me tell you; its just that! regular coffee and hot coco. But what sets this place apart from any other coffee shop in the area is that its REAL and heartwarming! The people here are great conversationist, i dig the live music and the  atmosphere is so relaxed.
author: Oliver D.

description: 5 stars to my favorite neighborhood cafe. They have a large menu and great coffee. You can get anything from a lemon bar to a hot baked sandwich. They service is wonderful and I love it because they accept credit cards and have outdoor seating. You can also always find street parking or take the N which drops you off right outside. They serve beer too!
author: M K.

description:
So far so good! I've been going for the past couple of Sundays. You DO have to get there early if you want a spot though. This place fills up FAST! After about 1pm or so there is a line out the door. The place is small and they do have seating outside. There's another location up Sloat.. however, I feel the energy of this place is a bit more mellow. The beach is right across the street!
Recently I ordered a nutella croissant. They were out but the lady said they could just make a new one for us! Very nice. Coffee is good. Liked the Mocha better than the Iced coffee... just my pallet preference. 
People are cool. Bring my dog with me and everyone's been nice to him so far so that's a plus!
author: corri i.

description:
After working a long day at the ballpark. I'd hop on the MUNI N and begin my long journey towards Ocean Beach. I'd often have electro ambient blasting in my ears as I took the long journey to Ocean Beach. But once I got there. Got out and felt the ocean breeze in my face, the salty air. I'd go to this cafe.

What can I say, besides its perfect. I've met so many different kinds of people here. I've drawn art pieces here. I miss this place.

I miss Ocean beach and I miss San Francisco.
author: Lana P.

description:
1. There are couches, chairs, a bar, outdoor seating, benches and, of course, across the street-sand dunes. As in, there is ALWAYS a place to sit while waiting for whatever drink, sandwich or salad I've ordered. 

2. They ask me if I want my soy iced chai tea latté sweet or spice, then make it accordingly. 

3. They're open really really early, and relatively late, so you can watch the sunrise and the sunset all in one sitting from the comfort of your chair.

Okay, I give up on numbering/attempting to justify why I love this place -- there are more than five reasons. They're just far enough from my house for me to run from my life's issues but close enough to return in 10 minutes by bike, full and happy. I've spent many a summer's day here reading, conversing with friendly, beautiful strangers and eating, of course. It's got a great vibe and the staff has always been warm and welcoming. What's not to love?
author: Amy S.

description:
Cool little coffee shop along the Great Highway and Ocean Beach. People are very friendly and the tropical decor is perfect for its location. I tried the mocha coffee and enjoyed every sip. I also saw beer on tap as well as sandwiches, muffins and other coffee snacks. A great place to chill with a friend no matter what time of day.

4 stars.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
The sandwiches here are supppppppppppeeeeeeeeeeeeer good, I could not even find a flaw!! I had a small French roll with BBQ chicken for lunch before walking to the beach that's just across the street, and it totally made my entire day. Enough said!

The only thing I didn't quite fancy when I went down there was the parking part, I had to drive about a couple blocks away to find a spot. It was not that bad actually, since I enjoyed walking around the area.
author: Miiiiei P.

description: I always make a point to stop by whenever i'm at ocean beach. Everything is just delish. and you'll always find a crowd any time of the day. good hand out place.
author: Lotta F.
